Reviews.Title: “Lahaina Shores Recent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Quinda12
Reviews.Content: I will try to be objective, we just returned from Lahaina Shores last night so this is very current. Old/Outdated. Musky smell in room. Filthy carpets everywhere. Faded furniture and decor. Shower was nasty with missing paint on metal. Towel very very thin. Ugly beach lots of rocks not pleasant at all. You have to pay 8.00/day just to park a rental. Pool was small and so was hot tub. Not appealing at all. Seemed to be an older customer service, everyone I saw looked to be over 60 or so. We stayed 6 nights and they wanted to move us every other night, we were promised an upgrade but denied it once we were there. I will never return. I recommend biting the bullet and paying the extra money to go up to the nice resorts with beautiful beaches. Bus fair is only 1.00 to ride into Lahaina front street and you will only need one day for that. One positive was the bed was comfortable and sheets where nice and smooth. Good luck. Hope you take this review to heart !!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: divefiji
Reviews.Content: We loved the location and accessibility to town. Our oceanfront room was great. If you were on the lanai or even had the sliding glass door open, you could listen to the waves hitting the shore. Our unit (431) was clean and recently redone. It has a Murphy bed so that we had lots of space to move around in during the day. We prefer the small resort feel that Lahaina Shores has. All staff was helpful and friendly. I understand that each unit is maintained and decorated by them, but our was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Location on the Island!”
Reviews.Author: Fred G
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at Lahaina Shores although we've been to Maui numerous times. Having usually stayed at major Kaanapali hotels, we decided to try Lahaina Shores at the recommendation of a friend. We were leery as some of the TripAdvisor reviews were not complementary reflecting a dated property, but as others have stated, it is important to request an upgraded renovated 'premier' ocean front room, which we did. The hotel is not quite as fancy as many of the major hotels, but our room was exceptional looking as it had been recently renovated. The room was wonderfully appointed and modern and most importantly right on the ocean, where we could hear the waves roll in as we sat on our Lanai or dozed off to sleep each and every night of our five day stay. We found the staff to be helpful and courteous going beyond the call of duty at every opportunity. The grounds were lovely and there was never a problem obtaining a lawn chair. To top it all off, the location is the best on the Island enabling one to walk back and forth to town for shopping, strolling or dining without the necessity of a car. The only disappointment from our point of view was the absence of a fitness centre of any form with the closest one being a ten minute drive away. Anyway, this quaint hotel was perfect in all regards. We cannot see staying anywhere else on a return visit to the Island!

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: sarah c
Reviews.Content: Excellent location- easy access to Lahaina as well as the rest of the Island. Definitely not as fancy as many of the hotels on the island, but it is good value. The unit was pretty clean and the other guests were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: malibuman_8
Reviews.Content: Loved the location. easy walk into town , lots of restaurants,bars,shops and cool art galleries.the hotel is a bit dated but this is lahaina ( an old town ) not kaanapali. bed was nice. staff was helpful, when we told them we needed another fry pan they had one there by the time we got back from the store. maid service was good they made sure you always had fresh beach towels. the pool / hottub area was clean with plenty of lounge chairs. have to use room key to enter onto beach which is a good security measure . the ocean out front is shallow, only waist deep not good for swimming or snorkling just cooling off, would be great for families with small kids.heard raves about Betty,s cafe happy hour I dont see why they only had 1 food item on it and very weak cocktails. a better deal was right nextdoor at Stumpytown they had 2 ahi-ahi tacos for 6 bucks all day long and reasonable drink prices.also check out Moose McGillicudy,s for live music and stiff drinks. sunrise cafe down by the marina had good breakfasts for cheap.( HAWAII CHEAP THAT IS) for real beer go up to Kahana and Maui brewing co.the only place I could find an IPA on the island , good food too.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy beds but dated facilities”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie E
Reviews.Content: We mostly stayed at B&Bs in Hawaii - this was our only "resort" so I expected something a little more luxurious. They still use actual keys to lock the room, and they don't really have internet access: if your laptop still has an ethernet port, then you can access the internet that way, but I got the impression that it wasn't free. (I was told the ethernet cable connects you to the cable company, and after that, internet access is between us and the company.) Parking involved an extra fee. All that said, however, I will report that the beds were quite comfy, and the view from the private deck was very nice. Our toilet wouldn't flush when we first arrived, but they sent someone to fix that pretty quickly once we complained. And they had a pool, hot tub, and beach access, which was nice. So, I don't regret that we stayed there, but if we go back to Lahaina, I think we might try one of the other resorts.

Reviews.Title: “as tony the tiger would say great”
Reviews.Author: Nadine B
Reviews.Content: loved the view of the mountains such a beautiful world.the housekeepers was very pleasant .The staff made us feel real welcome ,will definitely come back.loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but make sure you get a renovated room.”
Reviews.Author: StinkyandStinkpretty
Reviews.Content: We arrived New Years eve exhausted after an 18 hour flight from the east coast. We were booked in and given our keys. Yes remember those? The hotel doesn't use electronic keys, a definite security issue here as they can easily be duplicated. We arrived at our room and were very pleased to see that they had upgraded us to an ocean view, but with a catch. Instead of two doubles, we were given was a queen and a cot. We immediately discussed this with the front desk. There was nothing they could do. It was New years eve and they were fully booked. Gee thanks. I sucked it up and took the cot. The next day i again discussed this with the front desk. I felt disrespected. They moved us to another room with two doubles as originally reserved and upgraded to ocean front. Thanks but i still feel disrespected. The first room was dirty. The hallway carpeting was filthy and stained. Cabenets wouldn't close in the room. The tub had a permanent dirty stain. The second room was nice. I was told that the rooms are condos and the owners decide when to do the upgrading. Good luck with that. Were we the brunt of an overbooking pratice? I'll never know. We met a couple from our fligtht the folllowing morning during breakfast, they weren't impless either and will not return. The renovated rooms are nice, make sure you get one.

Reviews.Title: “Negative reviews”
Reviews.Author: d j
Reviews.Content: I will start by saying that I do not own a condo at Lahaina shores I have stayed here over 15 times ( in different rooms but all on the oceanside) in the last 3 years mostly long weekends from the West Coast. The main complaints fall into 2 categories the construction noise and the room condition. The main remodeling construction of the lobby area and the external structure is now over so the construction is now contained to individual rooms The problem with the rooms are that they are all privately owned and as such are in very different condition. Some are great some are terrible.I am sure most people are shocked when they get to there room after looking at the lobby they probably think they stepped into a different hotel. The lobby area and furnishings do not honestly represent the room space and furnishings you will stay in, in most cases. In an attempt to correct the this disparity between the lobby and the rooms the ownership have made it mandatory to upgrade rooms for people in the rental pool , this will fix the problem but in the meantime there will be construction noise in individual rooms as they are being remodeled. I have stayed while a room close by was being remodeled and the noise was not that bad but then again I am in Hawaii so I spend most of my time on the beach during the day not in my room. In conclusion I would say that Lahaina Shores is a great place to stay, the alternatives are huge resorts that give you the feeling you could be in any place in the world . I would suggest 2 things, first call the front desk directly before you arrive to make sure you are getting the room you want ,( they also have slightly higher priced rooms that have already been remodeled ). You can also book the rooms from the owners directly at VRBO and these tend to be nicer rooms but are also usually a bit more expensive as they charge a cleaning deposit. I think it worth it to spend a bit extra to go home with great memories as opposed to the people that commented on how bad their room experiences were.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: mustanggirl57
Reviews.Content: The pics of this Hotel doesn't compare to when you see it in person. We walked in our room we had a spectacular view of the mountains. The sliding door was open we were so excited we were taking pics with our cell phones and texting our family and friends back home. Yes to make them jealous. ha-ha The housekeeping ladies were so sweet. We had a studio with King bed. We originally were suppose to have 2 twins but we didn't care. The bed is comfy. Everything is within walking distance. Would definitely return. Actually can't wait to return I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Just right”
Reviews.Author: Shane K
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 days at Lahaina Shores last week and it was wonderful. To be able to sit on the balcony first thing in the morning and watch the Maui day begin was a great way to start my day. We opted for the ocean view room and it was well worth it! The sunsets were amazing and a clever eye could spot whales spouting and breaching off shore! The room was nothing fantastic; a studio room #409 was very basic and a little run down. The carpets and dÃ©cor were old and it was not a pristine environment. The location was superb, the ability to walk to shops, restaurants and other manner of entertainment was all there at your feet. To us it was â€œJust rightâ€� So my rating is for the whole experience that staying at Lahaina Shores provided, not just the room itself. We would not hesitate to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: francesca790
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd time I've stayed and fantastic yet again! I have travelled alot and am very picky. I can tell you that this place is great! The staff is nothing less than exceptional and some have been there 20 years! The location is incredible and quiet. The room rates are reasonable and everything within walking distance. It's a hidden gem. Bravo, good job. We'll be coming again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms on the beach”
Reviews.Author: case0149
Reviews.Content: This property was really wonderful. We spent 7 nights in a mountain view room. I know that each room is a little different so I guess you might not get a great room but we did (room 320). Even with a mountain view instead of an ocean view (more expensive) it was really worth it. Its on the south side of front street so you can walk to everything in Lahaina. The staff was wonderful, especially Anne at check in. I would highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: travelbutterfly87
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is just perfect! Away from the noise but so close to everything! When we checked in the guy (i think his name was Bill) was really lovely, he made sure our room was ok and recommended things to do and where to eat. Parking is also a bargain! The room was quite large and clean with a fully fitted kitchen (great for keeping costs down!) our bathroom however was a slight dissapointment. When you switched the light on the extractor fan came on and was so noisy I ended up showering in the dark everyday! The balcony is a good size and we ate outside every night. The view of the mountains was lovely but next time I think I'll opt for the sea view because it just looks stunning! The swimming pool is a good size and clean and tidy outside with access to the beach. - Very Nice! Concierge were also a big help - Mahalo!

Reviews.Title: “Way better than the big names around”
Reviews.Author: Amit_World
Reviews.Content: This place is right in front of the beach. The waters are best for paddle surfing, not at all violent during the day. Best place to relax. We got a beach facing room and we made sure we slept with the balcony doors open. The sound of the waves were very soothing. The room had more amenities than mentioned earlier. There is fridge, utensils from plates, wine glasses, knives, cooking range, pans. You have almost everything you need if you want to cook your own food. Next time I go to Lahaina, I am surely staying at this place. Do not miss the next door bar on 505 front street, there is also a grocery shop in that complex. Right across the famous banyan tree there is a place where you get Shave ice. Its a must have thing. I had mine with Kahlua cream and vanilla.

Reviews.Title: “Just what I wanted”
Reviews.Author: CarnivoreGunter_TX
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™ve been to Maui a few times and was tired of the mega resorts that require driving into town for everything and I was tired of blowing $50.00 on breakfast. I had always wanted to try Lahaina Shores while sitting at the bar next door. Decided to try it this year and loved it. A lot of retired folks come for long vacations and the place is real quiet, hardly any kids. Walk right out the back door to a small pool then a few more steps to the beach. Easy walk from hotel the other end of Front Street. Great bar next door and you can watch the Feast at Lele from your balcony. I will go back the next time Iâ€™m in Maui. THIS IS NOT A FIVE STAR HOTEL. You want a good room with plenty of room and a Million dollar view you will be happy. If you think the Four Seasons is just OK you will hate it. Itâ€™s great for a week as you can stock the kitchen with snack and liquor and save some money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay right on the beach”
Reviews.Author: MustLoveDogz
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights here over Christmas (30-something married couple). This is not a flashy resort with an awesome beach, but it is right on the hot strip with an acceptable beach front location. We had a mountain view studio queen. It was not yet renovated but it served us well. Basic kitchen & bathroom, older furniture. We really liked being able to make our own in-room breakfast every day. We didn't spend much time in the room so no other meals were cooked there. The beach is sandy but once you enter the water it's rocky and doesn't get deeper than your waist. The pool and hot tub were nice and relaxed in those every evening after long days discovering Maui. There were an adequate number of beach chairs and most people just lounged on them on the lawn. The grounds were pretty with palm trees and tropical flowers. We used the parking lot for $8 per day and always found a spot. When we needed internet, we went over to Betty's Beach Cafe right next door (in the 505 Front St shops) and used their free wifi (wait staff will provide the free password if you ask). There are other handy shops at 505 Front St (convenience/souvenir store, rent snorkel/boogie boards, restaurants). Pool/beach towels are provided in the rooms; you can exchange them for fresh ones at the front desk. We also used the laundry facilities on our last day so we had clean clothes heading over to the big island. Overall, this was a nice budget accommodation in a good location. Couldn't give it 5 stars because we didn't get a renovated room (and they still use keys - literally). But it served us well for a good price!

Reviews.Title: “What a great vacation!”
Reviews.Author: catnhat222
Reviews.Content: My first time to this resort, but certainly not my last. We got a Ocean front studio they gave us a unit that obviosly had been recently renovated. Marble counters and new appliances, nicer stuff than I have at home. We used the kitchen every morning for simple breakfasts and made dinner one night. I was surprised at the cost of eating out so it was nice to have some options with a kitchen. Lahaina is a larger town than I had thought before going so we did alot of walking. Parking at the Lahaina shores was only 8.00 per day with in and out privledges but if you are going any where in Lahaina you pretty much need to pay for parking hence the walking. The beach in front of Lahaina shores is a good walking beach but there are much better swimming beaches on Maui. Big beach is my favorite down past Wailea. The feast at Lele is right next door and from our balcony we saw the show each night. The units were quite and restful. We never waited more than a few seconds for an elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful vacation - just too short”
Reviews.Author: Lawrence M
Reviews.Content: We had a great time in Maul, just didn't have enough time. Next time will be longer. Lahaina Shores is in a perfect place, lots of action nearby. Security is great and the staff was wonderful. Didn't need the pool because the beach is just out the back gate, the pool is great though. Old Lahaina is within walking distance with plenty to do and lots of good food.

Reviews.Title: “Nowhere else in the world”
Reviews.Author: Dianne B
Reviews.Content: Having been to Lahaina Shores Beach Resort 4x we don't need to try elsewhere on Maui, nor would we vacation anywhere else in the world. It is truely paradise to awaken every morning to the blue ocean, skies and warm sunshine. Where in December can you find 76-80 degrees? The beach is literally at our front gate, just past the swimming pool and hot tub and the quiet grass yard to relax and read a book. Who needs a car when Lahaina town is just blocks down the road or take the beach? The sun and moonsets are camera perfect from the lanai. The rooms are decorated beautifully Hawaiian and the wait staff was there every day to refresh towels, coffee and make the bed. It was luxury living. This is what a vacation is all about. The best part is that it is the United States!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Resort”
Reviews.Author: Ericl61
Reviews.Content: Carm and I stayed here in June of 2010.....Little late on the review. We stayed at Lahaina Shores for 3 nights. Wish we could of stayed our entire trip here. The beach is small and private. The grounds are extremely well maintained the staff was extremely nice. The room was very comfortable (we had the ocean view). There is a great gal that helps book trips....sorry forgot here name but she was very helpful. Another great thing is you only need to walk a few blocks into town which can easily keep you entertained for a whole week. The Banion tree park is Awesome and some of the best restaurants around. Don't hesitate to book your stay at Lahaina Shores.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Time”
Reviews.Author: Don R
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Lahaina Shores Beach Resort was one of our best yet in Hawaii. The location was excellent being within a couple blocks of Lahaina Banyan Tree park area. The resort was always clean and quiet. The pool rules were enforced well, keeping it a relaxing and safe area to get some sun and swim. And access to the beach was steps away with a well locked gate that guest use their room key to open. The beach was pure sand and always clean and very empty when we were there. This was also another access to walk to the square in town. The rooms were also excellent, being well stocked with any cooking needs you might have. Housekeeping had a diligent staff who kept the entire building and the rooms spotless. This is my new favorite getaway. Don Russell

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: pitboss3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Lahaina Shores from 12-07-11 thru 12-14-11. Had a great time, staff was very friendly, walking distance to anything in Lahaina. When we go back to Maui we will stay there again. Great place.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Lahaina”
Reviews.Author: BC-bikers
Reviews.Content: Lahaina Shores is a cross between hotel and rental. The suites are owned by individuals but they are offered as vacation deals like a hotel and they have a concierge. We got a great deal on this for the first week of school - I would not be impressed if we didn't get such a great deal. Because we got a great deal we had a mountain view which was very scenic and lovely but if you want ocean view they quoted us and extra $160 per night. The suites are clean and the kitchen was fairly functional. They are somewhat dated as are the appliances. This did not matter to us at all but it may matter to you. We used the kitchen as we tried to do this trip on a tight budget... That said, Maui is expensive. The price of food at Safeway, and Walmart was comparable to what we pay in a high end grocery store in Vancouver BC. Dining out is also expensive so we tried not to. Also they charge for wifi but right next door at Betty's (pub) they offer it for free sooo...we went for 2$ margaritas during happy hour to check our email etc. We used this trip as an opportunity to learn how to snorkel. We bought a guide from: http://www.tropicalsnorkeling.com/ It was the best $30 we spent. We used it to identify places we wanted to go to. We saw the most wonderful things. Huge turtles and gorgeous fish. We did this on our own with a rental car. We bought our own gear. We went to a dive shop and tried some masks on to make sure we had gear that was going fit before we left Vancouver. We absolutely fell in love with snorkelling and had a great trip. This meant that we travelled the Island extensively. I think Lahaina is the best place to stay. It had such a charming centre - the most AMAZING art shops. I saw genuine Warhol and Dali paintings and because of the economy they are hungry to sell (so be careful or you might end up buying something super nice). We also saw some great photography shops. Thomas Barbey and Peter Lik. So inspiring and beautiful. I also loved the location of Lahaina shores. Just at the edge of town but very walkable. The town and location are why I gave 4 and not 3.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Ymseduria
Reviews.Content: Stayed there five nights on our recent trip to Maui, and we were very satisfied! We rented a studio with an ocean view, and our unit seemed recently renovated (it smelled new) and it had all the appliances we needed. However, it was the ocean view that just amazed us. Non-obstructed views of the ocean from our own lanai, at an affordable price, right in the middle of Lahaina - you just can't beat that. We started the morning with breakfast at the lanai, and finished the day with a night cap there - and even slept with the lanai doors open to the soundtrack of the Pacific. The beach in front of the hotel wasn't the best, but it had some pretty good snorkeling. We also used the pool and spa The staff was also nice, the room was clean.The only drawback was that internet was wired and cost $9.95 a day so we didn't sign up for that. Will be back when we return to Maui!

Reviews.Title: “Nice propert, great location”
Reviews.Author: sugarbearz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Lahaina Shores for 5 days. The condo is older but it's super clean, plenty of room for the two of us and you could not ask for a friendlier staff. We like to party so being within easy walking distance of the night life on Front Street was a big plus. The studio had a gorgeous ocean view and a kitchen with all the utensils we needed to prepare simple meals. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “My new home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: christyann1
Reviews.Content: Okay so I start by pointing out that this is a no frills hotel but it is still a gem. The room was perfect for what we needed it for, sleeping, cooking, and getting ready. It was amazing having the kitchen once we got sick of eating out constantly. Plus it's very nice on the pocket book. An average meal for the 2 of us was $60 on maui. The location rocked in my opinion. It was just far enough away from the front st tourist area while still being close enough to walk to it. My one recommendation would be to get an ocean view. It's worth the few extra dollars. We slept with our sliding door open every night and woke up so refreshed every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: OntheMNlake
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here 5 nights. We had a ocean view studio. Loved the view! The room was basic. The bed was comfortable. The staff was friendly and helpful. The location of Lahaina Shores was great. It felt very private yet everything you could need was within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Second time visiting did not dissapoint”
Reviews.Author: taynru
Reviews.Content: We returned to this hotel where we stayed when we were married 10 years before to celebrate our anniversary. We were not disappointed! This hotel is made up of condo style rooms where some are privately owned and some are managed by the hotel. We chose room 507 with an ocean view which was privately owned through VRBO. The room was recently updated and had new appliances, marble counters, tile floors and new carpet. The view was amazing and there were automatic blackout shades to keep the sun out in the late afternoon. The only reason I am not giving this 5 starts is because I am a tech geek and the tv was outdated and small, the radio display would not work and would often turn off, and wile there was internet, it was not wireless and the cable would not reach to the porch. I bought a 25' cord from Radio Shack and was easily able to over come that problem. Internet was expensive but I needed to use it to stay in touch. The location right in the town of Lahaina is a huge reason why we returned. All the restaurants, shops and stores are less than 5 min walk away. We saved a ton of money mixing drinks to go in our room and wandering along Front Street. We stayed over Halloween and there is a huge annual street party where thousands of people fill Front Street in costume and party. So many fun costumes! Just next door to the hotel is a retail center with a fully stocked convenience store and a restaurant called Betty's. Betty's has free wireless and every night there is a Luau right out there window that you can enjoy for free. The luau is operated by another business but it's like you are right there in the audience and can see the whole thing. Lahaina Shores is NOT an all inclusive resort with porters and waiters and huge sculpted walking grounds. It has an adequate pool and a hot tub and there are enough sunning chairs for the guests. The beach is narrow but is quiet. If you are looking for a pool bar and huge beach this is not the hotel for you. However, if you are looking for clean, good value, amazing location, and a view of the ocean RIGHT on the beach, this will be a wonderful fit. Mahalo Lahaina Shores

Reviews.Title: “A great home base”
Reviews.Author: JayW913
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights, including over our wedding anniversary. We were careful at booking to get a room with the ocean view. Completely recommend this. From our lanai we had gorgeous sunsets, views of Lana'i and we could hear the waves crash. Room itself was overall basic, but extremely clean and not small, even with the kitchen. There is no restaurant in the hotel, so note that if you are arriving late and hoping for room service. There is a Safeway about a five minute drive north of the hotel and is a great place to stock up. Just doing breakfast in will save you money in Lahaina. The concierge was fantastic. She was able to help us sort out which tours/activities we could realistically do and was a wizard at booking them for us. Hotel had a bottle of wine waiting for us on anniversary day. Great time!

Reviews.Title: “Beachfront serenity”
Reviews.Author: marjen
Reviews.Content: Our studio ocean view room had a full kitchen and a queen bed and a fabulous view. Because each "condo" is individually owned, rooms vary widely from modern to 1980s decor. Our room was on the 3rd floor. It was slightly dated, but the bed was comfortable and the 12-foot wide window/sliding door led to a nice balcony with comfortable seats and table surrounded by 180 degrees of Pacific Ocean and Lahaina. Every morning we made Kona coffee in the coffee maker and watched the color of the sky lighten from dark blue to grey to orange and pink to brilliant azure. It was very relaxing. A couple of days, in the afternoon, we did hear construction going on in the next unit, but overall a very nice propery. Walking distance from downtown Lahaina. Restauants and market right next door.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Clean Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Cath027
Reviews.Content: The Lahaina Shores Beach Resort is in a great location, just a short walk from downtown Lahaina. The room was clean, but the decor a little outdated. It is right on the ocean and you can fall asleep to the sound of the waves. Good quality for the price! I would certainly go back!

Reviews.Title: “was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Donna3m
Reviews.Content: Booked our trip through a travel agent, so we got a package, air, car,and a hotel for 2 days. We were in Maui for 10 days so we booked a resort hotel for the full 10 days. The idea of packing up and relocating is not for us, but we were in the area and saw the hotel and checked it out. We fell in love with it!! We checked out of our resort hotel early to stay at Lahaina Shores. We only wish we stayed there the whole 10 days. I think we would have saved a lot of money too. we left Maui knowing where we will stay the whole time. Loved everything about it!

Reviews.Title: “yes I would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Leana M
Reviews.Content: Really liked the location of the hotel - close to Lahaina - also the views of the ocean from our room were awesome. Could use new carpeting in the hallways and beds could be a bit more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, awesome view and nice staff”
Reviews.Author: RunnerGrl123
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in late September and had a good time. We stayed in a room that had not been recently remodeled, so the appliances were a bit old but it still included all the amenities we needed and everything was functioning. If you are looking for a resort type place this is not it. But the hotel is clean, the staff is always friendly and waking up to the sound of the ocean and the view from our room was amazing. Shops and restaurants are only a short walk away. It was nice being away from all the hustle and bustle and really enjoy the serenity. I didn't use the pool, but it seemed as though a lot of guest took advantage of the outside lawn to mingle, eat and lay out. The beach is narrow but it was nice and quiet and just steps from the property to a gate.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: abyssau
Reviews.Content: Stay at this hotel! The staff are friendly and the facilities are great. The facilities are clean. The location is a short stroll to the main heart of Lahaina A word of note, the beach isnt that great for this place, but for what it lacks in a beach is made up for its location near the city - if you are looking for a beach resort, go to Kaanapali. The hotel is quiet and it doesnt matter which side you stay in - mountain or ocean - its a good view. The bus service from Lahaina stops early in the night - and getting back would be a nightmare from Kaanapali if you dont drive a car - so for convenience sake its great to stay here as you are near all your food. The place has a refridgerator and its a short bus trip to "the cannery" which is the supermarket. The only thing that i could say which is not in the favor of this hotel is the beach(its not like kaanapali) but its has everything else to make up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel for the type of location”
Reviews.Author: SMorovich
Reviews.Content: Great price & value hotel. Immediately on water with a quaint, well maintained property. On Front Street, walking distance to the entire town. Rooms are large enough with good size kitchen and full-size fridge. They were replacing all outside furniture with new ones the day we left. Be aware no free WiFi ($10 a day) and parking is extra. **Make sure to pay a little more for the ocean front room or be disappointed.**

Reviews.Title: “Was mislead”
Reviews.Author: gypsysouldesign
Reviews.Content: The condo was alright. Furnished with alot of extra's, however, trying to get our deposit back took over 3 months. Also, was quoted a price but when it was all said and done, we were charged 35.00 more per night! When we requested the owner to honor her quote, we were told she never said it would be for the lesser amount so bottom line is we have had to "eat" over $400.00. Not worth the time and effort to fight over it, but will definately NOT do business again with this owner.

Reviews.Title: “There are better locations to stay”
Reviews.Author: DannyWink
Reviews.Content: Hotel/Condo are nice, staff very friendly. Pool and hot tub are very clean. The beach is not a great beach, so don't stay here if you want to walk to a nice beach and camp for the day. It's a quick walk downtown. All rooms of course have a kitchen and there are 2 grills on site. If you want a better beach, stay up around Napili Bay for more laid back area with a great.

Reviews.Title: “What a place / Great Location”
Reviews.Author: gilly6050
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 5 days at Lahaina Shores and thought it was great. The postion close to town made it easy walk to all the great restaurants and shops. The rooms were big and the views to the ocean were amazing. We loved the pool and the spa and the grounds around the complex were lovelly. The resort is right on the water and we will come back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Made I
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days at Lahaina shores and really enjoyed it. Our room was mountain/parking lot view but ocean is just around the corner so that was not a big problem to us. Room was very big and confortable, tiny kitchen with all you need for cooking, we used it a couple of time and was useful enough. Resort is just a short walk from Lahaina shops, in a quite place anyway. every morning they have a welcome desk for new comers where they explain you about main tips from the island and give you a breakfast. We didn't attend but requested support from the women at this (Expedia) desk for booking several activities, even last minute...they made them all, great support! Wi-fi internet is pretty expensive, you have to connect through an external website but I needed it and made it! We used the laundry too, washing machine had a problem in starting but after a guy from the hotel came and slammed its door a few times, it started and worked well! only bad thing: a cricket coming out of our Kitchen sink!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location/Great Value”
Reviews.Author: R B
Reviews.Content: This Resort was a great value for the price paid. I had an Ocean View room from which you could wath the sunset behind Lahaina right from the outdoor balcony with a nice glass of wine. Lahaina Village shopping and restaurants were a short walk down the road and the property was right on the beach with easy access. I was doing a stopover on the island enroute back to the Mainland but would be happy to spend more time at the property again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: RitaSarasota_FL
Reviews.Content: This Resort has a beautiful view, the unit was very nicely laid out. It is close to Lahaina, you can easily walk there. The problems we found. A few units at a time are being renovated, if you are near one of these units it is very noisy. In talking to different people by the pool it seems the units that have not be renovated, that some are in better condition than others. Older is one thing, but things not working and dirty carpet is another. The pool is very small and even though the weather was warm everyone was complaining how cold the water was. The beach is not very good. They don't have any chairs you can use to sit on the beach. The staff was very nice. I think it will be a lovely resort once all the renovation is done. I don't think we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Amazing Views”
Reviews.Author: DeaDuchess
Reviews.Content: My new husband and I stayed at the Lahaina Shores Beach Resort for 6 days during our honeymoon. The view from our oceanfront room was breathtaking and our room was very clean, but a bit outdated- although we were willing to look past that because of the awesome view, location , and value. The resort is located at the end of Front Street in Lahaina which is walking distance to many stores, restaurants and bars. We were able to book all of our excursions from the lobby of the resort as they staff a "local expert" to assist in conceriege type services. The hotel is not "full service" and they do not have a restaurant or bar on site so we stocked up on groceries at the Lahaina Safeway, made use of the full kitchen, and enjoyed our breakfast on the lanai (balcony/patio). There is also an awesome restaurant directly next door to the hotel called "Betty's" that had an excellent happy hour and great food. We will definitely be staying at Lahaina Shores again!

Reviews.Title: “location&value”
Reviews.Author: William T
Reviews.Content: Our 2nd Maui trip 9/1-9/8 at Lahania Shores , very good location with engaging staff , a very useable room. Easy walk to food and fun, gallerys,shops. We very much liked the vibe of Lahania and Lahania Shores. It may not be full service but full service was close at hand in town. Its a great location to go north to beaches and resorts or south to all that Maui has to offer. Kids might fill the need for a bigger pool and beach , but this is a nice couples location on a real people $.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in #121”
Reviews.Author: thomasu5
Reviews.Content: Perfect location on Maui. Short walk to Lahaina with nice restaurants. Nice beach and good swim. Very nice appartment (but it seems not all appartment are the same standard from what we heard) with all equipment you need and actually more than you would expect. The only thing I did not like is the prepayment of the whole rent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent oceanfront location right in Lahaina!”
Reviews.Author: RickR2008
Reviews.Content: This is our 2nd stay here. If you want a reasonably priced, oceanfront location in Lahaina, this is the place. The rooms and furnishings are not the most up-to-date but being right on the ocean and in walking distance of the action in Lahaina makes up for it. The staff is knowledgeable & friendly. It isn't a full service resort but you can easily walk to spasm if desired. The beach is right outside the door and the ocean views are spectacular. They have an Expedia local "expert" (her words,not mine) to assist with reservations and tour packages.

Reviews.Title: “If you want peace and quiet, DO NOT STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer G
Reviews.Content: Very dissatisfied with this establishment. I will start with the pros: Nice lobby, good location, and room was clean and spacious. Now onto the cons...Since Sept 1st, there has been renovations happening in the room or rooms next to ours (beside our room and above our room). Therefore, there has been horribly loud construction sounds and jack hammering from 10:00 AM till 5:00 PM. I am currently listening to this as I am writing this review. The first time it was happening, I didn't think much of it cause we were leaving anyways. All other weekdays, it was not an issue because we were gone the entire day. The weekend and Labor day were not an issue as well because renovations were not happening those days apparently. However, today is Tuesday, our last day on Maui, and we are exhausted and not feeling well and the jack-hammering/ banging is occurring. I called down to the front desk twice now and the first time was told there was nothing they could do, no matter where they put us in the building, we would hear construction happening in one of the rooms but that I would receive a call back to inform me when the construction would stop. That call never came. So I called back again frustrated that I couldn't even make a phone call or speak to my husband due to this loud noise. This time, I spoke with a woman who denied that there was any construction happening around our room. She more or less was arguing with me about it but said she would call and find out if there was construction happening but still stated that there was nothing that could be done. Management here is completely unsympathetic and unwilling to compensate us for this annoyance. Do not stay here unless you plan to be gone all day, otherwise, you WILL most likely be hearing jack-hammering and management WILL NOT care.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect vacation spot”
Reviews.Author: Hupz
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I spent a long weekend here last week, and it was really great. The view was fantastic (but make sure, as some other reviewers have said, that you get an ocean view room, and make sure it's on the second floor or higher) - literally a 180-degree view of the ocean! Service was excellent, and the hotel is unionized which is a big plus for me. Also, it was just a block or two from the center of the tourist district in Lahaina, so it was An easy walk to the night life happenings and some good restaurants. This was a great value for the buck. I would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “We really wanted to like this place”
Reviews.Author: islandcindy
Reviews.Content: Lahaina is a fabulous town, and this looked like the perfect place to stay. Just a short walk to Lahaina Town, and an ocean-view room at reasonable prices. Unfortunately, it was not to be. It was the final leg of my husband's 3-week business trip to Hawaii. Since I couldn't get a flight home from Kauai, I made the trip and stayed in Maui overnight. He had reserved an ocean-view studio with a king-size bed. We arrived at about 9:30 PM on Sunday night, anxious to check in and find a restaurant for dinner. When we got to our room, we discovered it was mountain-view, so we immediately headed back to the front desk to have it changed. After reviewing the various bookings and room availability, they reassigned us to another room. Because it was so late, I headed off to one of the restaurants next door hoping that they were still serving (they weren't), while my husband switched the luggage to our newly assigned room. When we reunited, I learned that while we had an ocean-view room, it had twin beds. So much for the room that we had reserved. The other problem that we encountered was the overall maintenance of our room. Because the shower head was not properly installed, on first use water sprayed all over the room. We were able to fix it, but the point is that it shouldn't have been necessary. The other problem we encountered was that the iron did not work properly - it was too hot - and it burned one of the shirts that we were ironing. All in all, it was a big let-down for the end of our trip. On the plus side, the view was beautiful. Note, however, that if you're on a lower-level floor (we were on the 3rd floor) the palm trees block some of the view. You'll have to go to the 1st floor near the pool or beach to take sunset pictures. There were specific reasons that we wanted to stay in Lahaina for this particular trip, but in the future, I doubt we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We will return!”
Reviews.Author: Familynielsen
Reviews.Content: Lahaina Shores Beach Resort was clean, the staff were friendly caring and kind. The unit was cleaned each day and an abundance of towels were provided. The pool and hot tub were steps from the door with the beach a stones throw away. We travelled with our 80 year old father who had no difficulty getting to the ocean. Lounge chairs were always available. It was pleasant to sleep listening to the waves. It was quite here and very peaceful. When it was time to check out the staff made it as pleasant as possible by storing our luggage, giving us a key to the gate so we could use the beach as well as the pool and hot tub for the rest of the day. Before our departure they allowed us access to a suite for an hour for showers and changing. Having a full kitchen made it very convenient to prepare our meals. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: gnomes101
Reviews.Content: Despite my intial concerns, the 45 minute drive from the airport was worth it. Lahaina Shores is a great hotel, just a short walk from the main shops/restraunts in Lahania. The beach isn't the best, but the hotel offers you a great place to base yourself to explore Maui. The rooms were clean and comfortable, each with a spectacular view. Initally, we were given a ground floor room, but choose to change after reaslising that you enter from the outside of the building and they offer no real privacy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, in the heart of Lahaina town. You can walk to shopping, the pier, luau's, etc.”
Reviews.Author: jboneil
Reviews.Content: Stayed at a privately owned penthouse condo. Very nice, with in-suite laundry, and huge lanai. Nice, king sized bed and two fully equipped bathrooms. The owners provided a bunch of beach stuff to use. Very convenient location for driving out to the hwy, as well as an easy walk to most amenities within Lahaina. Very nice lawn for sunbathing, with a pool & hot tub. Key access to the ocean. Nice coral reef in front of the complex makes for a soft surf & some good snorkeling. Thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “For the price, it can't be beat.”
Reviews.Author: jackpinesavage
Reviews.Content: Although we only had a small room with a Murphy bed, It was really a wonderful experience. Everything we needed was available, the service was good, and the location was the best. Right on the beach, good beach for walking, and Lahaina is a great town. This was our second trip to Maui and for the price, this was the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “I will be back”
Reviews.Author: John C
Reviews.Content: Lahaina Shores is an excellent place to stay due to location and outlay. Having a full kitchen condo suite is a great bonus. The ocean views are outstanding with an excellent lanai. You are only two blocks from the center of Lahaina, hence only a short walk from the old town with excellent amenities for any age group. I personally utilized the Maui bus service which was very good, for all travel around Maui other than the paid excursions which were excellent. The beach access was excellent, and the whole persona was quiet and mature. Very friendly people, with outstanding service from Classic Resorts in Lahaina who did my booking. Thank you Cynthia.

Reviews.Title: “virtually perfect”
Reviews.Author: janedoeNearLondon
Reviews.Content: Great location, great apartment, lovely pool/garden area which was surprisingly quiet given the number of units (we were there mid July). Right on the beach (only hassle is you need a metal key â€“ where do you put it?!) â€“ you can walk down to the beginner surfing area. Reception staff very helpful and any problems quickly addressed. Parking $8 per day but cheap and easy compared to the rest of Lahaina. Next door to mini shopping centre with posh restaurants, beach cafe (a bit noisy in evenings but quiet by 10pm), convenience store and surfing / kayaking teaching / rental outlets. Lahaina itself has lots of shops (including a big Safeway) and restaurants but gets really busy in the early evening. The coast north of Lahaina is full of condos but not much else so everyone comes down to Lahaina.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel at a good price”
Reviews.Author: melissa328
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel from July 23-27th during a three island stay for our 10 year anniversary. We chose it because of the location, price, and good trip advisor reviews. We stayed in Maui before at Kaanapali Beach at the Royal Lahaina. We found this hotel to be nice. The room was very large and had a nice size kitchen with a full size refrigerator. The bathroom was nice and I liked the fact that the shower and toilet area were separated from the vanity and sink. Our view was a mountain view and okay. We did look up into the mountains but also overlooked the parking lot. But the balcony was large and fine for our needs. We were in close walking distance to the tons of shops, galleries and restaurants on Front Street so that was a plus. The hotel had a small pool which was nice and they supplied towels. Parking was $8 per day in a secured lot. We were right at the beach, but it was very small and not very appealing. I would suggest finding another beach to visit. There are so many beautiful ones on the island, so drive to another location for a better beach. The concierge offers a free talk and a continental type breakfast on your first morning with some danish, muffins, coffee and juice. She will book any excursions that you are interested in. Also, I liked the fact that there was coin operated laundry available on many floors. We did laundry on the first day we arrived since we had already spent a week on the Big Island and this saved us from packing so many clothes. All in all a nice place to stay at reasonable prices. I woudn't call it luxury, but it was clean and well maintained and accomodated our needs. The only thing that would have helped would be an included breakfast. But since there was a kitchen and supermarket nearby, you really could have your own breakfast items to prepare yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing! Great value for the location.”
Reviews.Author: DanSydneyAustralia
Reviews.Content: Right on the ocean with the waves underneath and the sound of waves all night and a view from the balcony straight into the sunset over the water! The garden is well maintained and beautiful especially at sunset. This place is somewhere between a hotel and condo. You simply must get an ocean view room - it's well worth it. We had ocean studio room 517. The interior is spacious with an ok kitchen. Perhaps here it depends on the actual room. The beach is tiny especially at high tide but there is a good area of sand 50 yards north. The Lahaina shops are 150 yards easy walk away. Our booking had been mysteriously cancelled so double check your booking. Check out Lahaina Coolers for dinner. Swim also at Black Rock at Kaanapali.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location; So-So Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jaymers11
Reviews.Content: The hotel was part of a Hawaiian Airline vacation package. It's one of those time-share deal so our room had a kitchen and laundry on our floor. If you are booking this hotel, make sure you get the ocean view side of the hotel- it's the one of hotel highlights. The other highlight would be having the beach right on your backyard (so-to-speak),also it's quiet and relaxing. The "so-so" part of this review is that the place is a little dated, kind of clean, the room felt a little musty, and the staff was ok, helpful but not stellar. The hotel is about a quarter of a mile walk to the hustle and bustle touristy trap of Front St. Other than that it's fine- nothing to write home about but it's not bad either. If you're looking for location and convenience and not wanting to leave the beach and you're a few steps and an elevator ride to your room to freshen up your beverage then this place is for you. But if you're going to nit-pick and just be plain "Mr./Ms. No Satisfaction I Complain About Everything" I suggest you pay the extra three grand to your vacation package and stay over in Kaanapali at the Westin or something.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay in Maui”
Reviews.Author: bobc6710
Reviews.Content: The grounds and staff were wonderful. Room was clean and had enough space for the 2 of us. Close (walkable) to the town of Lahaina but far enough to be away from the hustle and bustle of all the people.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Marypenrose
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay, wished we didn't have to leave! Enjoyed the shops and restaurants on front street. Nice little town! Enjoyed our ocean view room! We will be referring this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The most amazing vacation I've been on with friends”
Reviews.Author: terrilomb
Reviews.Content: Ashley, at the front desk, was always helpful and courteous. Her smile brightened my day each time I approached the desk with questions. Also, Jenny, who manages housekeeping was also very helpful. Actually, the entire front desk staff was fabulous, but I can't remember all their names. I wish we had help with our luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ihandfull
Reviews.Content: Lahaina Shores is a decent hotel. I was only there for two nights for business and did not use any of the amenities, so I cannot comment on them. I had a 2nd floor room facing the ocean, the view is spectacular and the sound of the waves was beautiful. If you are staying awhile, the closets are HUGE and there's kitchenette, which is really nice to have. The noise from the neighboring restaurant and people by the pool made it slightly difficult to fall asleep. But I kept the tv on, which drowned out the noise. One issue with my room was that the adjoining room door was not locked and was loose in the door frame, which seemed like a safety issue for a woman staying in a room by herself. I was able to open this interior door and see my neighbor's door, where I could hear them inside the room. The other side of each door doesn't have a door handle, so I don't think you could actually open your neighbor's door. But, my door was loose in the frame, so it might not take much to get my door open. I called down to the desk to explain the issue and a maintenance person came to my room. He didn't have a key to lock the door. Our temporary fix was to put a chair and table in front of the door. That way, if someone were to try to enter my room, I would hear it. Other than the security issue, the hotel was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: sara32149
Reviews.Content: We can't wait to go back to Lahaina Shores Beach Resort. We arrived late because of delayed and changed flights. We were greeted by the most wonderful and friendly staff at the front desk, despite the very late hour. She was able to answer all of our questions and get us settled in our room with efficiency. We stayed in Penthouse #7 and highly recommend it!! When we opened our lanai (balcony) doors we were greeted with a nice breeze and the sounds of the ocean. No other sounds except the calming waves could be heard...just what we needed to put us to sleep after a day of flying. Of course the comfy bed and pillows helped as well Before bed, we received a phone call from the front desk to check that everything was satisfactory and to see if we needed anything. So kind and thoughtful. The next morning we awoke to beautiful sunny skies and clear waters (just what Lahaina is known for). Our view from PH #7 was priceless! We could see the beach and the waters in front of the resort, the quiet, small harbor with boats coming and going, the offshore islands, etc. It was everything you wanted to see your first morning on Maui! Throughout our stay, we were always greeted by kind and helpful people at Lahina Shores. From the front desk, to the activity expert, to the housekeeping service. The pool and spa area was a great place to relax and read and sun bathe - with barbeques near by those nights we stayed in. We loved spending time on the lanai of PH#7 on the patio furniture that afforded us the wonderful views and in the evenings we had the soft music from the luau to eat to!! The beach was just STEPS from the resort and always quiet and calm. The resort is located on the BEST beach for swimming and paddle boarding but also close to surf lessons and good snorkeling. The resort itself is also in the perfect location to walk to 505 Front Street for: surf lessons, restaurants, a luau, and a massage or a spa day! It is also located a short walk to downtown Lahaina with even more amazing restaurants, art galleries, the Banyan Tree, shopping, etc! If you have a rental car, it is in short driving distance to Whaler's Village and Black Rock (more good snorkeling), Airport Beach, Maui Tropical Plantation, just to name a few. I highly recommend Lahaina Shores Beach Resort and Penthouse #7 will impress you both inside and out!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place - We will return”
Reviews.Author: gupperTexas
Reviews.Content: We were there for a week and had a wonderful time! We had heard others who had complained about the rennovations required on some of the rooms...We did NOT have that experience. We were given a very nice rennovated corner room with a great ocean view. We paid extra $20 per night for rollaway for our young daughter. The place had a full kitchen and plenty of room on the balcony for small meals. The staff was excellent especially Laura. The town of Lahaina I loved and it is just a short walk to shops and restaurants.... In past trips we had stayed in Kaanapali however this was a nice change from all the traffic in that area.

Reviews.Title: “Gracious, Hawaiian style resort. Can't wait to return.”
Reviews.Author: Roz37
Reviews.Content: I stayed in room 523, overlooking the ocean, palm trees, lawn, and pool. Gorgeous sunsets as Hawaiian music from the evening luau next door drifted in. The room could be quiet, dark, and cool for sleeping, but I preferred to leave the lanai doors open to the breezes. Great location ~ a nice five minute walk to the Lahaina shops. Concierge services were excellent ~ and always got the best price. Remember to book the speedy shuttle if you're not renting a car at the airport; a taxi will cost you $85.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to rest and fix breakfast but it's far from luxurious!”
Reviews.Author: jerrocop
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this resort. The rooms were clean and the staff was great. Fresh bleached towels every morning and the maids were great. The rooms are a little outdated (90's). Kitchenette has sufficient dishes and utensils. NO INTERNET OR WI-FI!!!! Location is right on the beach. Within walking distance to shops. Parking was extra but we found free parking on the street. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best way to experience Maui”
Reviews.Author: hcm723
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our fourth stay at Lahaina Shores and I am already feeling homesick for our little home away from home. Lahaina Shores is conveniently located within walking distance to restaurants and shops. The units are individually owned, so the decor varies quite a bit from room to room. If you want to save some money, the mountain view rooms are nice and the view is pretty. But, it is worth spending a little more for an oceanview since the building is practically on the beach. Either way, the grounds are pretty and it is just steps from the elevator to the beach. It is a very quiet relaxed atmosphere without all of the commercialism of the big resorts. All units have kitchens, and there are a couple of barbecues on on the grounds. The beach isn't exactly the best on Maui, but it is uncrowded, and offers some good snorkeling. If you go out in the morning while the tide is low, and walk south on the beach, you can walk out thigh-deep into the ocean and enjoy seeing a tropical aquarium full of fish, eels, octopus, and maybe even a seal. This is a no-frills resort so if you are looking to be pampered and waited on, this is not the place for you. If you want comfort and the real feeling of Aloha, this is your place! Just a couple of miles up the road, a local family has a barbecue stand and they offer the best Huli Huli chicken. You can get a 1/2 chicken plate lunch for cheap, and if you chose to eat at one of the picnic tables nearby, you just might see some turtles playing in the surf..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: funbeach007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Lahina Shores resort for 7 nights and had an absolutely fabulous time. The room was clean and had everything we needed to be comfortable and enjoy our vacation. It was a very short walk to town which we did every day. Even though we did not have the ocean view room seeing the mountains was equally nice and very beautiful. It was nice to be able to go from ocean to hot tub to room in a few steps. Highly recommend and would defiantely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What a great view”
Reviews.Author: jvig
Reviews.Content: We had a enjoyable time in Maui. The concierge at the hotel was very helpful. Our view of the ocean was great, we got up at 3:30 am to a full moon. I would definintly would stay here agian.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute gem”
Reviews.Author: BJellybean
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to find this resort on a random search, and we couldn't have been happier. It was right in Lahaina, but far enough from the action that you weren't overwhelmed with traffic. The rooms were beautiful, the view was stunning, and the concierge was incredibly helpful without being "sales pushy". I would highly recommend staying here if you're traveling to Maui!

Reviews.Title: “Staff, location perfect!”
Reviews.Author: leisuretraveltime
Reviews.Content: Location couldn't be better. Walk to the elevator from your room, through the lobby and withint 10 steps you are at the pool, out of the pool and 5 steps you're in the hot tub, and out of the hot tub another 20 steps and you are on an incredibly soft, sandy beach. The reef is about 100 yards from shore and so the water in the bay off of the beach has no rip current, no huge waves, and is warm, perfect for those who don't want to swim the rough sea waters and perfect for little children. If you want big waves, walk slightly down the beach and you can have all the big waves you want! Only a few hundred yards from Lahaina Harbor, and a couple of blocks from downtown Lahaina. The staff is so accommodating, responding to every need within minutes (even a call for a box of Kleenex reached our room within 2 minutes). Make sure you pay the extra for the ocean front rooms...worth every penny! Sleeping with the sliding door open and the ceiling fan on, listening to the soft surf outside all night with the gentle trade winds blowing - - paradise! And if you like luaus, you can watch the Feast at Lele next door every night - free from your lanai! Recommend this resort highly to those who don't need any foo-foo. Our home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing & quiet resort for two busy moms on vacation!”
Reviews.Author: NMWarren
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights with my friend to get away from the daily grind, and boy did we enjoy ourselves! The resort is laid back and quiet which was very appreciated during the night. We went to another location for some sightseeing and were very happy and content to be staying at Lahaina Shores Resort rather than the chain hotels that were packed and loud. This resort is SUPER close to shops and restaurants, so we walked most of the time. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Sallyellen
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really a collection of condo's, it is right in the heart of the bustling town of Lahaina on Maui so very easy to get to the harbour and shops and restaurants in this pretty little town. Our room had a kitchen with all one could need, so we could eat on our balcony or try one of the many restaurants. We had several restaurants next door, plus a grocery store. There is lots to do and see, all easily bookable at the Hotel or in the town. The room was cleaned daily, the floor was a bit sandy but as we were right on the beach this was not surprising.

Reviews.Title: “A Surprising Gem!”
Reviews.Author: gypsysouldesign
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Lahaina Shores 6+ times and love it. Each unit was different and some were definately more updated and stocked than others. This trip we stayed in Room #403 and will rent this one again! It came beautifully stocked with beach chairs, cooler, binoculars, etc. Only thing is, this is available to rent from the owner direct, which means there is not daily maid service. Not for everyone. No glam or glitz. Not conducive for young children. Wishes are: HEAT THE POOL!!! Cold even by Hawaii standards!..allow guests to park for free or at a reduced rate. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Best view ever-”
Reviews.Author: LDBGresham
Reviews.Content: This was the best trip ever- We listened to the water and birds all night long very relaxing. 2 blocks from front street were all the action is, peace and quite just 2 blocks away. non smoking was wonderful. each room has it own decorations some need updated and some are great- but the view makes you forget about it all. I would not get a room without this fantastic view.... can't wait to go back..

Reviews.Title: “a little misleading”
Reviews.Author: jeffndeb
Reviews.Content: We stayed a 101 Lahaina Shores for 10 nights. The condo was not bad, I felt that it was falsly advertised. The complete Kitchen did not have a dishwasher and the washer and dryer were on another floor. The condo was in need of some minor repairs and was not really clean. We did a little clean up and bought alot of tinfoil products and we managed to have a good holiday. Just a little heads up that it was just alright.

Reviews.Title: “OMG Worst place to stay in Maui!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Snowkilla1
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying nothing is as described in hotel description. When we first got to the hotel it seemed not very well maintained and out dated. They gave us they key to our room and when we got to our room we were astonished. We actually wanted to get our money back and try to check in to another hotel. They showed us three rooms not a one of them had any updated features like tvs fridges bed furniture NOTHING. We had a VCR this should say it all about how out dated this resort/hotel is. In the room there is a old 20 to 25 inch color TV. They said there were all 27 inch flat screen tvs in the rooms. The fridge barely kept our food cold. The bed was old and soft and to mention the bites I was getting. There must have been bed bugs because the bites would show up in the morning. We never thought about it until it was to late. I have stayed in Maui for the last Seven year from the Sands of Kahana, The old Maui Islander, Napili shores and this is by far the worst hotel ever. I have hotels at home that rate to this hotel and they are about 15 bucks a night. There is no morning coffee in the lobby. They constantly want in the room to do maintenance. The walls are paper thin and you can hear everything your neighbors are doing and saying. My wife and i paid a lot of money to stay in what we thought was a 4 star hotel/ condo and we had nothing but problems. What a waste of money on this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Lahaina Shores - A Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: piratepirate
Reviews.Content: We spent 12 nights at this resort and were pleasantly surprised, given some of the negative comments made earlier. I'll try to be concise. Our room, 411, was well equipped. The Murphy bed was comfortable and folded up easily to create more space. Kitchen amenities were fine although having plastic tumblers for pool drinks would be a bonus; mine was a deal at $1.99 at Longs. Housekeeping provided two coffee pouches per day, each enough for 4 cups, so as I am the only coffee drinker, we did not need to purchase coffee. Fresh towels were left each day, and the room well cleaned. The green towels, for pool and beach, are plentiful and one can easily request more at the front desk. Two towels will cover the poolside lounge chairs; there were never issues in getting a chair. Grounds and building are kept clean, staff is pleasant and the location great. Because the beach is narrow, and is a bit pebbly when entering the water, it is not ideal for water play; bonus, perhaps, as it tends to be quiet. Best entry spot is towards the north end of the building. Note - to get to and from the beach, a room key is needed to open the gate. Also, this hotel is not suited to young children who are old enough to run around. There are no play areas on the grounds; during our stay, some children, understandably in need of activity, were "surfing" in the pool, climbing the closed gate, spending unsupervised time in the hot tub, and capturing little lizards and feeding them flowers from the flowerbeds. I'd recommend that savvy parents choose another location for those beyond the toddler stage. There were several babies staying with exceptionally attentive parents. I would not hesitate to return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: careyle
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 7 days in March 2011 and our stay was beautiful. We even survived the Tsunami. Got evacuated to the Lahainaluna high school up on the mountain. We did not fear for our lives but worried the hotel would take a hit and we would have no place to stay. This happened on our second nigh there and the hotel made it. Hardly a sign that anything happened. We even went on a sub tour the next day and the water was clear as can be. Maui was beautiful, the town of Lahaina was a treat. Restaurants galore and shops for all kinds of things. One thing I must say, if you are going to schedule a luau do your self a favor and book the Feast of Lei Lei. We went to 2 luau's. one at the Hyatt, drums of the Pacific. Might as well have been in Atlantic City, the show was horrible. The Feats at lei Lei the so authentic and the food, high end fare, was excellent. We were right on the beach with the sunset and waves crashing on the beach. This was the high light of our stay. The Hotel did not have the amenities that some higher end hotels have but the rooms were clean and the staff very friendly. we had a studio which had ample room for 2 with ocean view. And the view was simply breathtaking. We were on the 6th floor which gives you a view without obstruction. The beach was nice, could not surf but it was clean and the water so clear you could see your feet at night standing in knee deep water. We plan to be back in 2012 and every other year after that. The plane ride was horrible but well worth it. The ride to Lahaina was gorgeous. Mountains on one side of the road and the ocean on the other. Best place to stay if your budget is tight.

Reviews.Title: “Great location-great value! Loved Lahaina Shores.”
Reviews.Author: tabasco
Reviews.Content: I was a bit skeptical never having seen this place and was pleasantly surprised with the property. The room had a nice sized balcony overlooking the beach and ocean, a fully equipped kitchen and was very clean. The staff was very friendly and the property was nice and clean. It is not fancy by any means - but very quaint and a good price point. It is a little off the beaten path of Lahaina, which makes the beach quiet. Yet, just steps away is a nice little shopping area (505 mall) with a fun restaurant (Betty's Cafe I think) and a wonderful little art galery (great prices too), and it is just a 5-10 minute walk (or run) into the heart of Lahaina. A few lessons I learned in my 4 days there: I heard the Molokini snorkeling was not worth the money so I rented snorkle from a local shop and went to the black rock by the Sheraton - very nice. You can park at Whalers Village for 3 hours free with validation. I stopped at Hula Grill for a snack on the way out. There are other good places on the island and the snorkle shops will help you. The Ulalena show is very nice evening out - and walkable from the hotel. The shuttle to/from the airport is around $50 each way, so I went on to Priceline and bid $22 on a car and they accepted it. Well worth the money to have a car. For local gifts like beach towls, wooden bowls, etc. Wall Mart is a great value. You'll save a bundle. And lastly, if you get a chance to visit the Big Island - do it. It is awesome and I recommend Captain Cook areas for snorkeling.

Reviews.Title: “We thoroughly enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: dfinder
Reviews.Content: Great accommodation, perfect location, friendly and efficient staff

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Maui!”
Reviews.Author: beaner30
Reviews.Content: Aweswome location and resort - we had a wonderful room with a full kitchen and a great view. The staff were very nice and the beach and pool were perfect. Not crowded or too busy - and never had to wait for the elevator - which is a bonus! Would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kgenske
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there for one night and wished we could have stayed longer. Its right on the beach and a short walk to all the shops, resturants, marinia, and the banyan tree in Lahaina. Our room was facing the West Maui Mountains and very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “So comfortable here”
Reviews.Author: wewannagoagain
Reviews.Content: My 4th stay at Lahaina Shores, and it could not have been better! We requested a specific oceanfront room, and were delighted when we checked in and saw that they had given us our request. The front desk staff was amazing--didn't walk past Carmen with her waving a big Aloha to us! We had an extra person with us this trip, and therefore needed a roll-away bed. The extra bed made it a bit tight, but we were gone during the days, so it wasn't a big problem. Housekeeping was great. The lawn, pool area and beach are nice. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in Maui”
Reviews.Author: bms1983
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the best possible location of Maui. It is perpetually sunny near the hotel when other areas of the island are not so lucky. This hotel located on Front St which is the hub of Maui dinning and entertainment. Unless you plan to drive to Hana or see the volcano, you do not need to rent a car. Everything you need is in walking distance from this hotel. The beach out front of the hotel is protected by a barrier reef. The water is very calm and it is the perfect spot to float out on a raft in the ocean and soak up the sun. It is also perfect for begging kayaking and paddle boarding since there aren't strong currents or big waves. At sunset you can watch the Feast at LeLe luau from the beach in front of the hotel. The staff was very nice and the room was perfectly fine for what we needed. There are a couple of supermarkets nearby where you can buy groceries since the room comes with a full kitchen. The concierge was very helpful and was very knowledgable about the island. We booked a whale watching and a dinner cruise through her and we loved them both. The beach outfront was sunny and not nearly as crowded as the Kannapalli resort beaches.

Reviews.Title: “A "LONG" over-due Honeymoon. GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: Gene6119
Reviews.Content: This place is great! Very comfortable, "laid" back, relaxing, perfect for us. The rooms are clean, well appointed, modern; a place that is easy to say "Ahhhh"! Great location, walking distance to all recreational activities. Shopping, restaurants, historical sites and the harbor for Whale watching (seasonal) sport fishing, ferry to Lanai. The staff is the BEST! Very courteous, professional, conscientious; they are "ALOHA" Mahalo!! I must say the water pressure in the shower is a little weak. Some guests forget about the "No Smoking" policy. The beds are very comfortable. I will go to this place again!

Reviews.Title: “Lahaina Shores Beach Resort is Top Notch Again!”
Reviews.Author: jerrybook
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at the Lahaina Shores Beach Resort. The staff is friendly and efficient and the rooms are clean and large. We like the fact that downtown Lahaina is just a short walk.In spite of the Tsunami and a night on Lahinaluna Road in our car, we had a great visit to Maui. When we return, we will once again make reservations with the Lahaina Shores Beach Resort. Mahalo!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: mgalla4728
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. Our room faced the mountain, which I thought was equally stunning as the ocean view. The room size was perfect, the kitchen well stocked with plates, pots pans silverware and glassware etc plus a coffee maker and a toaster and a full size fridge with freezer. The bed was very comfortable. Morning coffee on the lanai watching the sun come up over the mountain was a special treat, and always in our jamies! The staff was always very nice and helpful with every request. The event planner, Julie, was great to work with and gave us lots of ideas of the best way to do whatever we wanted. The hotel was within walking distance of Lahaina where there are tons of shops and resturants and history. The only negatives about the place was that they charged $8/day for parking and internet was $10/day. I thought those charges should be rolled in to the room price.

Reviews.Title: “best-located hotel in lahaina”
Reviews.Author: kaz188
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 5 short nights in a mountain view room #520. the room was adequately clean but a little dated. bathroom and kitchen needs a reno and thermostat on a/c doesn't seem to work as it was constantly on. excellent proximity to shops and restaurants in front st, lahaina harbour, the giant banyan tree, etc. there is parking next door on 505 front st for $5 a day (i believe) however as we were staying in a privately owned room, we got to park there for less than half that rate. we will definitely stay here again on our next maui trip but spend the extra $$ on an oceanview room.

Reviews.Title: “Lahaina Shores best location on Maui”
Reviews.Author: Carol32832
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent a great week in Maui, and loved staying at this hotel! We stayed in a 1 bedroom condo- penthouse 7- which had a million dollar view of the harbor. We not only saw gorgeous sunsets, but as a bonus it was whale season. Sitting on the lanai with a pina colada was an unbeatable way to watch the whales that were very active in Lahaina. Another reason we enjoyed this location was the close proximity to town. When going to dinner or drinks, we didn't need to worry about driving-we just walked everywhere. It was walking distance to the harbor where snorkeling excursions, whale watch trips, and more where located. Perfect Place!!

Reviews.Title: “To expensive for what you get”
Reviews.Author: susanne_johansen1
Reviews.Content: Accepted a room with oceanview. Room was overpriced. You could hardly see the ocean becaurse the palmtrees were to high in front of the hotel. Ekstra charged for parking, internet.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Blaxton
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 weeks in February. The room we stayed in was quite dated and could definitely use a reno but it was clean and you can't beat the location.
