You could walk everywhere in Lahaina and it was close to the wharf for tours etc. The staff were friendly and accommodating. A couple of negatives: it seemed very difficult to get yourself a lounge chair outside by the pool, even though the resort says they won't tolerate people saving chairs with towels etc, they don't enforce this at all. They do not offer free wifi or a computer/business center to use. This hotel will charge you $8.00 per day to park your car. We did have a good stay here and enjoyed our trip to Maui!

Reviews.Title: “Like returning to my home in Maui.”
Reviews.Author: 43018Richardo
Reviews.Content: Ability to walk to the tour boats, shop (a little), Kimo's, shuttle to Whaler's Village, have Mary Kay (Hostess) obtain reservations for events, and walk the beach, spa, pool,do grilling, breakfast on the Liani (patio to us in Duluth, Mn) and the friendly,professional people. I am a frequent visitor and can hardly wait to return. I do not own any property at Shores, but should you wish to contact me, please do so. Richard Gurske-Phone [-], e-mail: rgurske@clearwire.net.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect without being over the top”
Reviews.Author: natty350z
Reviews.Content: There's no hotel bar or restaurant but Lahaina Shores Beach Resort is perfect in it's own way. The ocean view rooms let you enjoy the views, the wonderful sunsets, even the music coming from the Feast at Lele next door. The kitchen in the room and laundry facilities allowed us to save money for other things. The staff is friendly and accommodating and the pool, jacuzzi and grounds are clean. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our vacation”
Reviews.Author: Mt_VernonWashington
Reviews.Content: Was really worried about this hotel before staying here but as it turned out it was everything we were looking for ..Air conditioning was something we have to have and did use every night. We had an ocean view studio on the sixth floor .Our room was very clean only bad thing I would say is the wallpaper in bathroom was peeling a little and just a little out dated. Overall perfect views great sliding door that opened up to our balcony where we could here music from luau next door .We heard that the end units you could actually see but we could not we were located directly in middle . I never used pool but husband did and said it was a little cold but with the weather outside it was refreshing.Well maintained and deeper then most hotel pools but not real big perfect for this hotel..We did go snorkeling out front and being I was new to this it was perfect for a newcomer but a lot of reef is dead because people actually will walk out to reef and kill the coral.Hotel staff were excellant whether it was the front desk or anyone working there very very helpful..Being close to town was also another plus.Public basketball and tennis courts really close to hotel also there are three restraunts next to hotel and a small whalers general store perfect for quick items .If there would be anything I could change at this hotel it would be to not charge extra for parking and to have beach chairs available to guests.We would definitely stay here again .We will be going back to maui in May but being we are taking our teenage children we will not be able to stay here.The hotel only has studio and one bedroom rooms and we cannot afford two rooms here.We will be staying in Napili next time .

Reviews.Title: “Good location & best value”
Reviews.Author: HappyKum
Reviews.Content: Close to the town with a lots of shops, beautiful courtyard with ocean view. Staff at the front desk are very friendly and helpful. Thank you for a welcome bottle champagne. Room & bathroom are big but very basic. Everything is very outdated, all in 1970 setting. It sure needs a good make over on the entire property. Internet should be included but it costs $9.95 per day. No restaurant or coffee shop at the hotel. It would be nice if they provide juice, water or cookies at the lobby for the customers. However, we have a good stay at Lahaina Shores. Hope they will have a major renovation in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Introduction to Maui!”
Reviews.Author: LDR22
Reviews.Content: I have to say that the Lahaina Shores Beach Resort is PERFECT if you are looking for a great "get your bearings" hotel in Maui. We arrived at the Lahaina Shores at midnight after an exceedingly long trip from central Canada with a 17 month old-- the night clerk was very friendly and greeted us like long lost friends! We had an ocean view studio room and once the windows were open we could hear the waves crashing and had a perfect island breeze coming through the windows. A wonderful introduction to Hawaii! (I recommend spending the extra money on the ocean view if you can -- the sound and breeze is worth it!) The furnishings were typical rattan and the TV was a flat screen, with many channels to entertain us during the early morning hours of our jet lag. We skipped the complimentary "sell me some side trips or a time share" breakfast and walked down Front Street right into the thick of things with all the restaurants and shops there for the choosing! We wandered to the grocery store and picked up some food, and then back to our room with our fully kitted out kitchen. The kitchen had a full fridge, and stove, plus many utensils, pots, pans and dishes to use. The beach out front is calm; which is good for little kids to get used to the ocean in! Plus its long enough to do a little bit of walking or jogging if you are so inclined. Front Street is also nice to jog down earlier (7am-ish). We only stayed at Lahaina Shores for 4 days 3 nights (we headed over to Makena for the main portion of our trip with a final stop in Napili at the end). The pluses: the location the fully kitted out kitchen the size of a ocean-view studio (perfect for two adults and one baby (in a portable crib)) the beach closet storage washer/dryers on each floor The negatives: the carpets in the hallways were a little dirty can hear the luau next door at night (but that is over generally around 8 or 9pm) and is kind of fun to listen to the parking (have to pay for it, but you have to pay for it on the entire island basically) also parking spots on Maui are TINY!!! But we found this to be true everywhere on Maui not just in Lahaina.

Reviews.Title: “Even Better than the Previous Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dalecorp
Reviews.Content: After staying at Lahaina Shores for years, we were pleased to see the introduction of premier rooms last year. The ground floor contemporary suite that we are staying in the second year in a row now is superb and as good as one could obtain anywhere - right up there with the Four Seasons: The room is beautifully detailed with the finest furniture and two 55" televisions. Most importantly, the mattress provides the perfect night's sleep - there is nothing worse than a bad mattress to ruin a stay?!? Anyway, it was impressive to see that the property had been newly landscaped since last year yielding a huge improvement both functionally and aesthetically. The pool is in the process of being completely redone which is a welcome improvement as the old surface was not pleasing. Most importantly, it was never a problem getting a lawn chair on a daily basis either on the grounds or on the beach. The day is nicely completed with a drink on our private lanai watching the sun set over the ocean.... Another important factor is the great location enabling one to stroll in to Lahaina town in a short walk for dinner and drinks without the worry of driving. There really is no better location to stay on Maui and now that premier rooms exist, you don't have to stay at one of the five star resorts to enjoy comfort. The wrap-up: great room; great service and most importantly, the best location on Maui!!!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel lahina shores”
Reviews.Author: aloha82trabucocanyon
Reviews.Content: have been there many times love it,. far enough from middle of lahina to be quiet at night, but close enough to walk. also little market next door and other restaurants, especially bettys cafe for breakfast, lunch and dinner and happy hours and at dinner you can view lauau in front. . love lahina shores

Reviews.Title: “Penthouse With Incredible Mountain Views, Great Location Too!”
Reviews.Author: lizbit47
Reviews.Content: I rented directly through the owner as recommended by other TripAdvisors. By renting through the owner, you know exactly what your condo will look like. I feel sorry for some of the guests who ended up with bottom floor rooms directly facing the parking lot! I got a great deal on a Penthouse http://www.vrbo.com/103392 that had incredible, relaxing mountain views. The condo was clean and had everything you could ever need. I checked in at the front desk, and they were very friendly although they did remind me to contact the owner and not the front desk with major concerns. Lahaina vacation was perfect for those wanting everthing within walking distance. On our last day, we had too much to bring back so we bought an extra suitcase at the nearby mall and walked it back to the condo no problem! The beach is quiet and the water good for simple snorkeling (some fish, not great, but still relaxing). Careful of the sharp coral though - tip: go further West on the beach (away from the condo and Front Street shops) for better beach and water...

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the price - RIght on the beach”
Reviews.Author: informedtraveler00
Reviews.Content: This place boasts great location being right on the beach (can walk to the sands right from the well-kept lawn and swimming pool). We got the ocean view room and the views were spectacular all day. You can even see the mountains/island of Lanai right from here. The scenary even at night is spectacular with several small boats (some private, some dinnere cruises with ther twinkling light with Lanai island in the background). Beats the price you would pay for similar views in Kaanapali. It does not have the hustle-and-bustle of the big-name resorts (a good thing in my mind), and is located in Front street, but still removed from the busy shops there which are still only a short walk away. We walked to the Banyon tree park a couple of times and to the Lahaina harbor. The rooms were well kept and came with a full-kitchen with utensils, microwave and full-size fridge. The only draw back is you can't swim deep into this part of the ocean here due to the breakwaters, but the beach is sandy, clean with some calm waves. Nice for a morning walk, which we did every day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: EasyWalker
Reviews.Content: This condominium/hotel is a great value for this part of Maui. These are owner-units, available as hotel rentals, so they are equipped with refrigerator, microwave, stove and dishes. The property has been very well-maintained. We stayed there about 25 years ago, and found it in excellent shape this trip. It is not a real resort hotel - no restaurant or shops inside. But there are three restaurants and a bunch of shops right next door. And it's a 5-10 minute walk to downtown Lahaina. It's on the ocean, with a large, grassy lawn in back with chairs and lounges, and a pool and spa. And, of course, a beach beyond the lawn. Very courteous staff, and very responsive. Wifi in room is not free, but I was able to get free access to a couple unsecured routers from my balcony!

Reviews.Title: “not impressed”
Reviews.Author: need2shop
Reviews.Content: We read reviews before booking this hotel, but I do not understand the rave reviews at all. First, resort is an overstatement. The pool is minuscule. The hotel is quite old and in a residential area. That means that across the streets there are houses, and roosters, and noises. One person had work done in his yard for 3 days, so you could not be in the room during the day. The rooms that are discounted have â€œmountain viewâ€�. That is code for parking lot and houses across the street. If you hold your head high and only look up, you will see the mountain. Otherwise it is the parking lot. BTW, you will not necessarily be able to park in this parking lot. They let you park in an underground pubic parking lot with leaks from the ceiling that worried me about parking there. Yes, the hotel is close to shopping places but is far from anything else. You need to drive to get to a decent beach. There is an old smell in the hotel and the substance they use to clean the carpet has a smell that persisted in air for days. The room was clean, but the appliances were older than I am. We asked for a queen bed. This bed was composed of 2 old twin beds, which both were deflated in the middle. So basically we could either sleep in our own bed or we could both sleep in one of the twin beds. You may safely skip the â€œfreeâ€� breakfast the first day (just coffee and Costco pound cake and the Expedia Concierge tries to sell you activities. You can save money staying here, but if your goal is a romantic gateway, this is NOT your place.

Reviews.Title: “Okay if you're on a budget, but don't expect to be amazed.”
Reviews.Author: JERANDVAL
Reviews.Content: My wife and I originally booked this hotel for 7 nights after staying in Waikiki on Oahu for the previous week. We have been to Maui before and stayed in the Kaanapali area on our previous trip and we were trying to save some money by staying at this hotel on this trip versus paying more to stay in one of the Kaanapali hotels. It wasn't worth it. The staff was nice and friendly, but this hotel doesn't offer many nice ammenities. The rooms are independently owned so you don't know what type of shape they're in before you check in. I'm sure some owners put more pride in theirs than the one we were given. We didn't like our room at all. It was very outdated and needed improvement. I don't wan't to be overly critical because we saw some rooms that looked pretty nice but you don't have a choice of what type of room you'll get. The location is good, being right on the beach, but the beach isn't that great. Very shallow water and a lot of rocks in the ocean. No snorkeling in front of the hotel. It's convenient to shops and restaurants just down the street and a short walk away. If you book a ocean view room, the view is very nice, but the mountain view rooms just look over the parking lot. This hotel doesn't have a restaurant or bar/lounge so you either have to make your own meals in your room or go out to a restaurant. It has a small pool and hot tub and a decent grassy area for sunning, but there just isn't anything special to "WOW" you about, except for the ocean view. This hotel might be fine for some people, but it wasn't for us. We checked out after 2 nights and went to another hotel in Kaanapali. We didn't want to stay here for another 5 nights. Our room was just too depressing. It's a crap shoot as to what type of room you'll get here.

Reviews.Title: “Economical”
Reviews.Author: daq_17
Reviews.Content: Pros: -fairly clean -friendly staff -within walking distance to many restaurants and shops -kitchen with full size fridge, stove and microwave -large rooms, comfy bed -Awesome view of beach or mountains -takes about 10 steps to be on the beach -surfboard, kayaks, snorkeling, etc rentals right next door -Expedia concierge on-site to assist with tours and such -pool and grounds were well kept -affordable CONS: -the dishes were dirty and we had to wash them before we could use them. -the cleaning ladies did not do the dishes, they left them in the sink every single day. there are no dishwashers, so I had to do dishes on my vacation. -$8/day to park -cannot take the resorts chairs onto the beach, had to rent chairs from next door for $5/day. -the room had an old/dirty feel to it. Each room is owned by an individual, so they differ greatly. We saw some really nice ones, but ours had not been updated. You should be aware that the picture you are looking at to book, is probably not the room you will actually be staying in. -Internet was $10/day -while you can get in the water, it is very shallow and not conducive to swimming. It is also very rocky, so wear beach shoes. I don't recommend kayaking, as we kept hitting rocks.

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL BEACH FRONT W/OUT MEGA RESORT PRICES....NO REGRETS!!!”
Reviews.Author: SandallsSanDiego_CA_
Reviews.Content: Lahaina Shores Beach Resort is small, quaint and charming. Is the only resort in Lahaina that is Beach Front. I rented a studio ocean front and let me tell you, ocean front is the way to go! The lanai is spacious and the ocean water literally about 50 feet. Slept with the sliding glass door open and heard the ocean all night.....AHHH R&R!!! The condos are all individually owned, so some are premiere units vs standard which boils down to furnishings. My only suggestion is to try and book furthest SOUTH as there is a Luau right next store and if you in a unit furthest to the North, you might hear the Luau/music etc. The condos are walking distance to town. We took a shuttle from the airport, then rented a car the last view days and returned it to the airport. The concierge can arrange for the car rental and then the rental company will pick you up. They charge a $40 return to airport fee, but it's cheaper than a shuttle for two and/or taxi. There is also daily maid service and pool/beach towels provided daily. All in all a very nice resort. No regrets here and will definitely stay there again! ALOHA!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!! Spectacular Oceanfront Views!! Short walk to downtown!!”
Reviews.Author: Chaneyent
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with our 2 teenage daughters, spent 10 glorious days at the Lahaina Beach Shores Hotel! I can't say enough about how beautiful the oceanfront view was from our balcony! Absolutely spectacular!! With the amazing view and the beach literally at your back door, there really was no need to go anywhere else. The beach was very private. We stayed the last week of July through the beginning of August, which you think would be a busy time of year, but at any one time, there were no more than 5 other people on the beach with us (usually less). The hotel only has about 6 or 8 beach lounge chairs right next to the water, but we always found some empty. There are plenty more lounge chairs for sunning yourself up next to the pool and on the large, beautifully landscaped grassy area around the pool. We booked 2 adjoining studio condos so that the 4 of us could vacation comfortably. With 2 teenagers girls, having 2 bathrooms was a must! Their room had 2 full sized beds and our room had a queen sized Murphy that stored in the wall. Having our bed out of the way, made our condo the roomier of the two, so we hung out and ate meals there. The room furnishings were outdated, which is the only thing I scored down in the ratings (that, and wanting free wifi). The kitchens are supplied with an adequate amount of utensils, serving pieces, etc. But, they do not have even basic staples (salt, pepper, sugar), so you need to bring or buy everything that you'll want to use. I brought my spices from home, as prices for groceries are higher than in the states, and I didn't want to buy another jar of dill, when I only needed 2 Tbsp for my recipe. The staff was wonderful! Very, very friendly and helpful. Being just blocks from downtown Lahaina was perfect. We walked there everyday to shop, have a bite to eat or see a show. For a list of some of the stores and restaurants, visit www.frontstreetlahaina.com. Ulalena is a must see! A captivating performance of Hawaiian culture and history. Don't expect a luau type hula show... this is dramatic and romantic and adventurous and thrilling and funny. Like nothing you have ever seen or heard before. The live band is amazing! For more info... www.mauitheatre.com. We bought an A3H Discount Gold Card for $30, which got us premium seating tickets for half price. The card has many other discounts for attractions. for more info... www.hawaiifun.org/GoldCard.shtml. Great eats in downtown Lahaina! Cheeseburgers in Paradise - yum! Kimo's for fresh fish, prepared how you choose, and tropical drinks! Our favorite spot to snorkel was Turtle Town, just south of Wailea... lots of fish and lots of turtles. They are protected, so stay 10 feet away and watch them gracefully glide through the water. Don't just look for them deep in the sea.. I was in waist high water, when one popped it's head up near me. When visiting Maui again, our first and only choice will be the Lahaina Shores Beach Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: UghDoug
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent 8 nights at the Lahaina Shores Beach Resort and we were very happy with our stay. We decided to stay here because the property was ocean front and very close to Lahaina. The view from our room was excellent. We were no more than 30 yards to the ocean and had a spectacular view of the island of Lanai. The ocean in front of the property is surprisingly shallow. You could walk waste deep out to about 75 yards from the beach and at that point there was a reef you could stand on where your whole body was out of the water. Snorkeling was not great though. We did see a few fish but there are better places to snorkel. This property is about 300 yards to the start of all the shops and restaurants on Front St. and takes no more than 10 minutes to walk to. That was a very nice plus as we never had to drive to get to Lahaina. We had an ocean front studio which was plenty big enough for the 2 of us. If you"re a family with anymore, you would probably need to get a one bedroom. The ground floor rooms are more expensive, but don't take a mountain view-all you get is a view of the parking lot. The rooms were a little dated but clean and comfortable. And the swimming pool is a bit small but the area around the pool was very nice with plenty of grass and shade. My wife says she wants to stay here again the next time we go back to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Peaceful, Well Kept, Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Nick_Nora
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our first trip to Hawaii, Maui. We stayed at Lahaina Shores Beach resort for the first part of our trip. We were concerned about the property because so many reviews said there was construction and that it was loud, dirty and that the staff was rude. I am here to tell you that NONE OF THE ABOVE IS TRUE! We had a room on the 6th floor. It was not updated like we had thought it would be, but it was cute and clean. The staff was friendly. The location was great. We would recommend this to any of our friends or family. This was our honeymoon. Reasonable prices and you get a full kitchen for when you just want to have a sunset dinner on your patio.

Reviews.Title: “The condo and the sunsets were so romantic we arrived as partners and departed as fiances!”
Reviews.Author: cat2707
Reviews.Content: The Lahaina Shores is the perfect venue if you want a laid back, relaxed, do it yourself beach vacation with a lot of the hotel amenities. The condos are all individually owned so you have to do some homework to make sure you have an updated unit as the resort is aging. We found the VRBO website to be an excellent site for checking out the condos, with pictures, and you can also check the ownerâ€™s availability calendar. The lobby has been recently refurbished, and is beautiful, as well as a lot of the rooms. The hallway carpets are a bit old and dirty but not a problem overall. The hotel staff was very helpful; if you call for information they never answer the phone but leave a message as they do get back to you. The building is plantation style, which I find very charming, and they take pride in the appearance by asking that no towels and such are hung on the balconies, makes for nicer pictures. The resort grounds are well kept and the pool and hot tub were very clean, the ocean was still warmer than the pool though. The ocean couldnâ€™t be any closer which is why I booked this place, so close that we had to close the sliding door at night as it was so loud but it was still great. The hotel has a concierge who works for Expedia and will help you book any of the many activities that are on offer on the island, although you might still save a bit by pre-booking on the internet. The morning after you arrive there is a welcome presentation including juice, coffee and muffins and was great for our first breakfast as we hadnâ€™t had time to shop yet. I went parasailing, which was fantastic, and my fiancÃ© just wanted to take pictures from the boat, they do charge for all passengers. Because he wasnâ€™t participating we werenâ€™t able to take advantage of the â€˜early bird specialâ€™ for some strange reason, so it cost us $110 as opposed to $90-95 if I had booked it in advance on the web. If you walk up to the boats directly to book a trip on the spot, they do charge extra. You see lots of cheap prices in Lahaina when you walk in to town (5 minutes) but most of them are tied to a timeshare presentation. The resort is 20-30 minute ride from the airport and we found Speedi Shuttle, located in the airport, to be the easiest and cheapest way to get to and from as you donâ€™t need a car if you are not planning to venture out of the Lahaina area â€“ it cost $54-58 for 2 of us. Lahaina is a small, very touristy town but it has plenty of good bars and restaurants and lots of little boutiques, discount stores and 2 grocery stores. Foodland is pretty close and if you sign up for their card, we just gave them a phone number, you get the member discounts; Safeway which is at the other end of town, is accessible by bus. Right next to the Lahaina Shores is a small mall that has a couple of good, albeit fairly expensive restaurants, as well as Bettyâ€™s which is more reasonably priced and serves breakfast through to dinner. There is also another venue that has a luau every night which was kind of nice to listen to while we watched the sunset on our lanai. Kimos in town was a great, middle of the price range, steak and seafood restaurant, not as much as Ios or Pacifica next door but a step up from Cheeseburger in Paradise or Bubba Gumps. The concierge has a binder containing menus and coupons for most of the restaurants. Overall, we loved the condo and the location and canâ€™t wait to get back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: 457khz
Reviews.Content: Primary reason for booking here is that our flight was arriving in Maui late in the night, and I wasn't keen on blowing a bunch of money on an expensive room to just get a few hours of sleep. I looked at the options closer to the airport and was creeped out with the selection, and thought this was a good alternative while getting a chance to explore another part of the island. Took only about 30-35 minutes to drive, and at night there was minimal traffic. Easy to find, and turned out to be a great location within Lahaina. Its a great location to stroll the many shops on/around Front Street for shopping/restaurants. The pool looked quite nice, as well as the beach. Only checked it out briefly, didn't stay long enough to see how the scene played out during the peak hours. Had a mountain view room, which was nice but basic in furnishings. Looked like it would be well equipped for a longer stay. Decor is dated, but adequate. Beds were average, aircon was quite loud.

Reviews.Title: “Lahaina Shores is an excellent place to stay on Maui!”
Reviews.Author: vollywolly
Reviews.Content: In late Sepember my sister and I traveled for the first time to Hawaii. We had only limited time (5 days) so decided to spend all our time in Maui in a location where we wouldn't have to have a rental car. Through AAA we arranged to stay at Lahaina Shores Beach Resort. We didn't want to stay at a "mega resort" and Lahaina Shores was within a short walking distance of the things we wanted to see, shopping, restaurants, and activities we wanted to participate in. We found Lahaina Shores to be very comfortable with a gorgeous view of the water, anchored ships, snorkelers, paddleboarders, and surfers. Our accommodations were great and the staff was friendly and helpful. These are actually condo units, some owner-occupied and others rented out when not in use. Our oceanfront studio had a kitchen and a large balcony, and was decorated very nicely. We got the 3rd night free. You can walk on the beach to the waterfront, and it was only a short walk to the luau we had scheduled the first night there. There's a nice pool and a grassy lawn between Lahaina Shores and the water. You can choose to sun on a provided chaise lounge or find a shady palm tree to sit under to read a book. We walked everywhere and even took the city bus around for only $1. We had a great vacation there and I would go back to Lahaina Shores in a heartbeat. In fact, I'm busy plotting how soon I can get back there right now.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Lahaina”
Reviews.Author: SilviaRioBrasil
Reviews.Content: Minutes away from Lahaina, well located, with restaurants and shops at walking distance. We stayed in a studio with mountain view. The small but well equiped kitchen was the best to fix our breakfast and to make our coffee at the end of the day, which we drank at the balcony enjoying the view. The staff was very nice and we`ve got good tips on what to see from the concierge. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: FUNINTHESUN0203
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Lahaina shores for a week. The location was great, away from the big chain hotels. Very quiet hotel, nothing fancy but nice and clean and good value. My only complaint was the front desk. Many times we had to wait for a while since they only have one person working at a time, we arrived at the hotel at 1pm and they did not give us our room till exactly 3pm, not a minute early. All the rooms are studios so you have a full kitchen. The hotel is in a nice location, walking distance from downtown Lahaina close to shops and many nice restaurants. I would defiantly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “There is no other place to stay but Lahaina Shores Resort!”
Reviews.Author: Cruiseader
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked into the Lobby at Lahaina Shores we were afforded the hospitality and service we anticipated. Walking into our room for the first time was more than we expected. A perfect 5th floor room looking out at the sunset was awesome. The studio room had everything we needed for our 6 night stay. The proximity to the downtown night life was perfect. The pool area and accessiblilty to the beach was really welcomed. I can't think of anything we didn't approve of. Our grateful thanks go out to the staff of Lahaina Shores resort for making our first trip to Hawaii one of the most awesome vacations we have experienced. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking View and Great Location. A major Aloha venue!!”
Reviews.Author: kdleathers
Reviews.Content: The hotel was grand but more of a residence type of place. Full fridge, dishes, full oven and range. The rooms are condominiums rented out by their owners in this "hotel" which is fairly common in hawaii. The view from our second floor oceanfront room was absolutely fantastic. Open the sliding glass doors and be rocked to sleep by the lapping waves 30 feet away. The sunsets, as you can see, were breathtaking. It is located at the south end of Front Street in Lahaina. This historical little whaling village is one of my favorite places in the islands. Parking was very convenient. The rooms had wired internet but my internet devices were only wifi. Plenty of nearby restaurants and lots of shopping. I will try to go back here as many times as I can. this was our 6th trip to the islands and 3rd trip to Maui. This was our first stay at Lahaina Shores and we loved the location and view. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: JGenese
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to Maui and Lahaina Shores Beach Resort and we are so glad we stayed here. We checked out many resorts on-line and are so glad we picked this one. We actually drove around to other resorts and the location for this hotel could not have been better; it was close to all the shops and restaurants. Our newly remodeled sixth floor ocean front studio was beautiful, It was so nice to sleep with the sound of the waves crashing. Betty's Beach Cafe was conveniently right next door, close for cocktails, lunch and evening apps while watching the Feast of Lele luau in the evening. Everything was wonderfu and WHEN (not if) we come back, this will be our choice. Thanks for a great experience and especially to Allyson.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect view & within walking distance to shops”
Reviews.Author: Wilson0904
Reviews.Content: Lahaina Shores was a pleasant surprise. The room we had was well kept, but unfortunately outdated. Each of the units are privately owned so the decor can vary significantly. My husband and I were looking for a no frills, peaceful, ocean front room where we could just unwind and enjoy the Hawaiian air. We were on the third floor with a corner room which offered us a balcony and side lanai. The weather was perfect and we were able to sleep with both patio doors open all night. The resort is also adjacent to the Front Street shops and within walking distance to the heart of Lahaina where you can see the Banyan tree. The only down fall for a short time was that the Feast of LeLe is just steps away from the resort so you can hear some of the performance. It didn't disturb our sleep as the luau was done by 10, but for just couple hours it does take away from the peaceful ocean sounds.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RogerIvanVelezCorea
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay here. The receptionist named Allyson was very friendly and helpful. The hotel is very neat, clean, elegant, and the location is awesome. I really recommend it to everyone. Enjoy Maui, Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Love the location!”
Reviews.Author: BikersPetlauma_CA
Reviews.Content: Usually stay in one of the Kaanapauli Hotels/Condos (Hyatt, Westin etc) and find ourselves driving to Lahaina for dinner and various activities. Thought we would change it up this time and stay right in town, not rent a car. It could not have worked out better! Executive Shuttle picked us up at the airport and delivered us to our resort. Our studio with full size granite kitchenj, upgraded large bathroom, was on the 2nd floor with an ocean view and a comfortable murphy bed. We rented bycicles and went to all the shopping centers and even Kaanapauli several times. Also took the public bus which picks up at the Wharf Shopping Center for $1.00 when we had to travel to an AT&T store to replace our cellphone which somehow "jumped" into the pool! The staff was very helpful. The location was great for our purposes and the Mango stand across the street sells local Mangos which are delicious for $0.40! A wonderful 10 day trip!

Reviews.Title: “Vacation in paradise”
Reviews.Author: grizzly9
Reviews.Content: We went to Maui for our 3rd time on August 21st through the 29th and stayed at the Lahaina Shores. This was quite different for us as we've always stayed at Kanapali in the past and always drove over to Lahaina. We wanted to try something totally different and we don't have little kids anymore so no need for a big resort area with big fancy pools, room service, etc. I have to say that we LOVED this place!! We stayed in room 601 which is absolutely amazing inside and out. The location of this room is unbelievable with 2 lanais - one with an ocean view and one with a mountain view. We fixed breakfast in the morning and had coffee on the lanai and made mai tais in the evening and watched many sunsets on our lanai. We did rent a jeep to run around the island and search for beaches during the day and would come back and relax at our room or by the pool before heading out for the evening. We thoroughly enjoyed being able to walk to town every night. We ate at Kimos, Longhi's, Lahaina Fish Company, and more. We loved long drawn out dinners with unbelievable fresh fish and a good bottle of wine and never had to worry about driving back. After dinner it's fun to enjoy the atmosphere of Lahaina and stroll through some of the shops. I can't say enough good things about this location and this resort. Laura and the other employees at the front desk were extremely nice and helpful when needed. I was disappointed that parking was full in the front when we got there and we had to park in the garage next door. I was told that we could move as soon as someone checked out and a place opened up, however, we stayed in the garage as it was very convenient and safe. It also kept our jeep cooler during the day. We would definately go to Lahaina Shores again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay Ever”
Reviews.Author: vijac
Reviews.Content: Most pleased with our 10 day stay in a beach front studio ... perfect location, loved the ambiance, more than adequate space in the studio ... and Happy Hour at Betty's next door!!! Couldn't have asked for a more relaxing holiday/birthday/retirement celebration

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location in Lahaina”
Reviews.Author: margstew
Reviews.Content: We love to stay at Lahaina Shores. This was our 4th visit and it just keeps getting better. It is in the perfect location ... within walking distance of shopping and restaurants. Love to hear the waves at night while falling asleep and watching the beautiful sunsets from our ocean view studio.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected Delight”
Reviews.Author: Wanderlustvancouver9
Reviews.Content: In September I spent 12 nights at the Lahaina Shores. To be honest, I was really nervous about picking this spot after reading the recent trip advisor reviews. To my delight, I managed to have a wonderful stay. This hotel is indeed older, and run down. I think the secret to this place is making sure you stay above the main floor parking lot side, and avoid the west corner of the building, you will be kept up by disco music until about 2 am, the rooms on this side were lovely, woud be perfect for hearing impaired. I had a view of the maui mtns, very nice. The grounds are lovely, the view breathtaking, pool was nice and staff was great. I intend to make this an annual ritual, you can have your 5 star hotels at an exboritant rate. Lahaina Shores provided me with everything I needed, and I was able to stay longer because of the reasonable rates.

Reviews.Title: “Two Weeks in Paradise...”
Reviews.Author: WarmTradewinds
Reviews.Content: Why I really enjoyed staying here: location, location, location (& ocean view) + friendly staff + cleanliness + excellent grounds maintenance. The lanai was fairly private, and I could leave the sliding glass door open all night for fresh air and the sound of waves. This unit (they're all different b/c they're condos) was a studio that had a murphy bed with a good mattress, so I had a good sleep by night and a full living room by day. While not a full service hotel, right next door is a convenience store and some excellent restaurants. It is about a seven minute walk to the famous banyan tree that is a traditional gathering place of Lahaina, the marina for adventures, and the shopping along Front St.. Overall, it was an excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Genuine aloha spirit”
Reviews.Author: WellnessWithAloha
Reviews.Content: We always stay at Lahaina Shores when we are on Maui, which is about once a year. We've tried other condos on the island, but always return to Lahaina Shores. The location is perfect, right at the end of Front Street and within walking distance to some the best restaurants. The staff all demonstrate the true meaning of aloha spirit, plus many of the staff are Lahaina natives. If you are looking for a place that is quiet, not crowded with one of the best locations, Lahaina Shores is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: ozzydj
Reviews.Content: Definetely reccomended.Good location , friendly staff , hot tub and kitchen are big plus ++

Reviews.Title: “What an amazing view”
Reviews.Author: AvidDiver4037
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Lahaina Shores with my daughter while visiting Maui as part of her HS graduation gift. The hotel has recently been entirely remodeled and the improvements are well done. The rooms were clean and well maintained as were the hallways and elevators. There are a number of laundry rooms that are easily accessible and inexpensive to use. The location is outstanding, only a five minute walk to "downtown Lahaina" if there is such a thing. Right next door is Pacific-O an excellent restaurant and just a few steps beyond the pool is the Beach. You awake (or go to sleep) with the gentle song of the ocean whispering in your ear. But the most amazing thing is the view from the room. At night it was a full moon over the water with the lights of boats going to and fro. In the morning it was palm trees framing the islands of Lanai and Molokai. Gorgeous. And very reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Completely relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkCourtney
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my time at Lahaina Shores. It was in a convenient location, the staff were very friendly and the resort was very relaxing. Maui was my last stop on my busy vacation and all I wanted to do was rest. I was able to do that at Lahaina Shores for sure. The bed was so comfortable I slept 11 hours straight in complete quietness. The pool area and beach were very peaceful and the short walk to the shops was handy. I will surely come back.

Reviews.Title: “The best deal in Maui”
Reviews.Author: b85prose
Reviews.Content: We just returned from spending 9 days in Maui. We stayed at the Lahaina Shores Beach Resort which is a condo hotel with individually owned units that you can rent from the owner or from Classic Resorts. We had an Ocean front studio on the fourth floor. It was clean and had a spectacular view from a spacious lanai. The hotel is on the beach just a few blocks south of the main part of Lahaina so it is within easy walking distance of the harbor and many restaurants. The grounds of the hotel were very nice with a pool and hot tub and a big grassy area. You step out of the gate and you are on the beach. We only one very minor observation or criticism; our unit had not been updated in awhile and could use a facelift. We were with a group of people and saw other units in the hotel that had been updated and there was a difference but not so much that it affected our stay in any way. For a price less than half of what the resorts a few miles up the road were charging this place is hard to beat. We would definitly return!

Reviews.Title: “Penthouse 706 was perfect with teens with so much space and a huge lanai!”
Reviews.Author: ChefSuzette2006
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed 10 nights at the Lahaina Shores in Penthouse 706. The bedroom had a very comfortable king size bed and a large bathroom with walk in rain shower. The kitchen was gourmet (I'm a personal chef and found everything I could need!) The front room had a fold out couch and all of the rooms had the most storage I've ever seen in a condo. The washer and dryer in the unit was very convenient to keep towels fresh and keep the amount of clothes packed to a minimum. The complex is Old Hawaiian Plantation style has has a very relaxed and quiet atmosphere. Walk just two blocks to downtown Lahaina and you have all the nightly entertainment, boat trips from the harbor, and any activity you could possibly imagine. For our son, the best part was the wave break next door to this condo where we took surf lessons and our son could surf every day without us having to drive to the beach with the surf board. Location was our favorite so far and we have been to Maui three times! No wind like in Kaanapali or Wailea! The owner also has beach toys, boogie boards, coolers and beach chairs stored on the lanai. I can't wait to go back to this resort!

Reviews.Title: “Penthouse "Suite" that was anything BUT - STAY AWAY”
Reviews.Author: play21cw
Reviews.Content: For our honeymoon, my wife and I fell in love with the pictures of this place. We called several times and were told the hotel was renovated, and that our room, ocean view penthouse, was brand new. After checking in we went directly upstairs to check out the room we'd be spending our honeymoon. We opened the door and were horrified, so much so that my wife became emotional â€“ maybe it was the outdated wicker furniture, or the cracked, dirty tile floor, or the dirty carpets, or the slime covered door knobs, or the smell coming out of the kitchen cabinets, or the cracks in the ceiling, or the bugs in the bathroom, or the smell of sewage coming from the water, or the dirty linens, or the fact that the place resembled a jail cell.... Needless to say we were not going to tough it out for another minute. We contacted our travel agent, who told us we had 100% insurance and were covered if we wanted to leave, which we did. We spent about 45 minutes on the phone making other arrangements, and after getting confirmed for a 1 bedroom villa at the Ka'anapali Westin Resort and Villa's, we brought our luggage back downstairs and checked out. When we said we were checking out the man at the front desk seemed puzzled, I explained the problems we had (bait and switch) with the room and that we were not going to spend our honeymoon in this place. After looking at the computer puzzled for a few moments he offered us the opportunity to look at a smaller room, which had been renovated on the first floor, he explained it would be more money though â€“ instead of getting even more angry with him I explained that we were done, and that we wanted out â€“ we had reservations at a 5 star resort down the street. We left and never looked back! Looking back I am glad we didnt settle for this place. Don't make the same mistake we made, dont even book here! Spend the extra money and stay at a nice establishment â€“

Reviews.Title: “Well run, clean and beautiful location at an outstanding value”
Reviews.Author: dbdkas
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at large chain hotels. This is a well run hotel with outstanding views, right on the beach with a good ammenties right in the town of Lahaina for a great price. The hotel manager and staff were helpful with suggestions of the area and extremely friendly. They have a great concierge as well. The rooms are really clean with full kitchens! We will come back to Lahaina Shores.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Hawaii!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: stacie10
Reviews.Content: We had our honeymoon in Maui! So beautiful! This resort is the only beach front in Lahaina, walking distance to downtown Lahaina, which has lots of reasonably priced gifts, do your shopping at the Foodland and apply for their discount card for discounted grocerys (it doesn't matter if your only there for 1 or 2 wks) you will notice a big difference on your bill. There is a corner store beside the resort for basic grocerys. The best place to go for amazing burgers is the Cool Cat, you have to go!!!! Wow! been there twice!! You can also do a timeshare presentation for free excursions, we did the Lana'i/Molikini boat trip for free! It would have cost $133 Can each, meal provided on boat as well! If you love lavender, check out the lavender farm, bought some lavender butter, amazing! Can't stop smelling my hands!! Lavender coffee was good too! Highly recommended as it was to us, buy in most stores, Maui unrevealed.... best book for best places to eat, travel, waste of time things to do and this guy is extremely honest, he'll tell you of hidden gems that other tourists have no clue so when you get there there is not many people there! Great book, we explored a lot! Highly recommend driving the road to Hana...all the way...even the scary bumpy dirt roads....something out of a movie!!! Drive to the top of the volcano 10,000 ft, awsome up there! Snorkell at Black rock, swam with giant sea turtle, when your on the boat to Lana'i you will sea lots of dolphins swimming beside and infront of the boat, they like to ride the wave, take lots of pics!!! Forest Gump was made in maui, you will see a bench called Buba Gumps, with forest suitcase/box of chocolates..sit and take a pic! Only thing I wished they had was nightly entertainment, you'll need to go out for that! Highly recommend the retaurant beside the hotel where they do one of the Luau's, a bit pricey but the show was amazing, it's like a 10 coarse meal...crazy! take pics! Need to book that one! If you rent a car they charge $8 to park a day, that's discusting!

Reviews.Title: “You can do better for the price...”
Reviews.Author: FriendlyCanadian
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Maui, I'd suggest staying elsewhere for the price. We actually booked this hotel for only one night as we were taking the ferry to Lana'i. Though the lobby, pool and grounds are pretty nice, when I saw the room I was glad it was only for one night. I don't tend to spend much time in the room, but we had previously stayed in a hotel, condo and b&b while in Hawaii and tended to pay 125-170+tax per night for significantly nicer. Had I paid the 240 that this room was valued at, I'd be quite disappointed. The front desk staff were nice and I don't mean to complain as we were happy enough, but I paid $124+tax and again we only stayed the night. If you are not renting a car this might be the hotel for you as you can easily walk to Lahaina but there parking in town and many nicer beaches elsewhere. The room was old and not as horrible as some describe it, but was quite dated. (You also have to pay for internet, parking and local calls). Overall, I'd use the term 'okay' to describe this hotel. I wouldn't recommend it, nor would I be likely to stay again but if you've already booked it don't panic... enjoy Maui is beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Kelly0929
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a "cheap" place to stay and don't plan on spending much time in your room, this hotel will work. It is old but clean and the view from our ocean-side room was beautiful. The pool was small but didn't look very clean so we were interested in getting in. The area around it is a bit seedy and the hotel staff is less than helpful. Check in was extremely slow and being dog tired from a long flight and still on east coast time, it was excruciating. If you decide to stay here (because the price really is good) I would recommend getting a good dining guide book so that you don't have to depend on the staff for suggestions or directions. They really don't care to go the extra mile when helping guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Jewell0501
Reviews.Content: I took my daughter to Maui during her summer break away from college. Lahaina Shores was the best hotel and most perfect location. Bubba Gump Shrimp, Hard Rock Cafe and many other restaraunts were all just a 7 minute walk. There's a ton of shopping and activities just one black away. Just two blocks away are two buses that charge just $1 each way and will take you to other shopping and activities around Maui. As far as the hotel, it was very quiet. The only time we heard anyone was maybe twice during our stay and it was just two people walking down the hall and talking. The hotel has a small kitchen so you can get on the bus, go to Safeway for groceries and cook most of your meals which can save you money on having to eat out all the time. Will most certainly stay again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Quanit, great location, great restaurants, great shopping nearby”
Reviews.Author: MilaJ_10
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Lahaina Shores which ended up being perfect for us. The is the second time we have stayed here. First time was back in 2008 and received the same service. It's a great hotel with execellent customer service. I loved the location because it was close to some of our favorite restuarants and shopping. We ate at I'o which was so amazing. We also saw the Luau that they put on. Really, a great show! My favorite part was finding this little hidden gem! Went shopping at a store called Maggie Coulombe the first time I stayed here and purchased some Sophie Grace Maui jewelry. It's just goregous, hand made pieces with kind of a beachy (almost Santa Barbara meets Maui) feel. It's so chic looking. Complete strangers stop me in my path when I wear this particular necklace. Anyways, come to find out she doesn't sell her stuff at Maggie's anymore. Found out she's at the Grand Wailea Resort poolside. I traveled there just for her and got a few more pieces. I also found out she has a website too. It believe it's sophiegracemaui.com Definitley worth a look. I can't wait to come back to Maui next vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Boring. No frills. No "hotel" services - this is a condo!”
Reviews.Author: filmtheory
Reviews.Content: Stayed here three nights at Lahaina Shores Beach. Paid $160 (too much). Not impressed. I say pass. Other reviewers are off mark. Stay somewhere else! Cons: dirty carpets, pull down beds (yikes!!), uncomfortable mattresses, no restaurants, no bellhop on full time call, tiny pool, loud construction next door, out dated 80's furnishings, loud AC system in room, $8 per day park, etc. No free Wi Fi either! $10 per day for ethernet (outrageous). Pros: location, good balcony ocean view, kitchenettes, and that's about it. Lahaina Shores Beach Hotel ... Hello! You need work.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Sandy22579
Reviews.Content: I realized I didn't write a review of this place when I stayed here last year. Needless to say, I am still thinking of it! My boyfriend and I loved staying here. We booked an oceanview room and boy, was I glad we did! We woke up, bf made me breakfast, and I just got out of bed and went outside on the lanai to have omelets while looking at the wonderful view of the water, palm trees, and island of Lanai next to us. It was the most wonderful start to the day. As for the room itself, it was extremely roomy for us. I loved the kitchenette. It had everything we needed in there. We went to Safeway and stocked up for the week and it saved us so much money that would have been spent on eating out. Also, sometimes I get sick of restaurant food so it was good to cook our own food. We did not use the pool because it was being worked on, but we did go down to the beach one day. It was small but we didn't mind. Reception was very nice, especially Allyson K. The bath products smelled really good too. Front Street was full of places to explore and we did a lot of that. Also, I highly recommend a visit to the AKL lavender farm in Maui. It's so gorgeous and I spent over $100 at their gift shop! All in all, we had a wonderful trip. I'd love to go back there again once construction is finished. The one thing that I didn't like about the hotel was the construction which was two doors down from us. It was a little distracting to eat breakfast on the lanai and have a wonderful view but hear drills and hammers. That was the only thing we didn't like. Otherwise, I'd want to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place”
Reviews.Author: foodhry
Reviews.Content: If you are lookiing for a resort with golfing, marble lobby, overly exaggerated landscaping, and making you feel as though you are a big shot, then go somewhere else. If you want a REALLY friendly, comfortable, family atmosphere, then stay here. You will feel important here primarily because you'll feel like you are at home. Great location, can walk to everything, but not noisy and the beach right in front is great. Staff was always available and helpful. We will be back, there is no other choice.

Reviews.Title: “Over the Rainbow”
Reviews.Author: susieq333
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had an amazing week at Lahaina Shores. We drank fine wine in downtown Lahaina, ate breakfast next door view of the ocean, treated like royalty by the staff and greated with an amazing rainbow over the mountain view. Walked the beach every morning, swan and snorkled, attended the luau next door, even had an hour massage. Never had a better time and at a great price. Will be back and highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely would stay at Lahaina Shores again”
Reviews.Author: scubajim1
Reviews.Content: Lahaina Shores Condos was perfect. Second floor ocean view. Fabulous! Walking distance to dive shop and tourists shops. Great! Employees at location, Friendly and courteous. Staying at the Lahaina Shores....priceless

Reviews.Title: “amazing views”
Reviews.Author: Rosebudds
Reviews.Content: We were there from 6/7-17 and we had such a good time. The beds are very comfortable and the staff is nice. You have your own private piece of the beach which is one of the best area's for snorkling! I'll go back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “It all depends on your outlook?”
Reviews.Author: travelramble
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Lahaina Shores for three days, two days before our timeshare week and one day after. The room we had was a one bedroom studio oceanfront. Well here goes, the hotel is basically a two star. It's older, and reminds me of your typical beach motel. The room was large and had a full refrig, stove, dishwasher, and microwave. Everyone at the hotel was very nice. When we had a problem with an iron the employee at the front desk called five minutes later to make sure we got it. We called the hotel to see if we could check in early and they took my cell number and called. Now for some reason the hallway didn't smell so good, but room was find (also need new carpeting). Like I said the hotel is a two star with a five star view (pic enclosed). You wake up looking at the boats on the water and the island of Lanai. We also paid $140 per night, which for an oceanfront view I don't know if you could beat it. At the Maui Marriott if we were going to pay for the three extra nights they were $375 per (however, no comparison between Lahaina Shores and the Marriott). Also, Lahaina Shores is located at the beginning of Front St. the main shopping and restaurants of Lahaina. So if you don't mind walking you don't have to drive. From the hotel all the way to the other end is about a mile (also lots of people and not threatening environment). So this is really a tough one to call for me. Great view, location and price. You get an older, clean and adequate hotel. I would probably stay there again if I was watching my $$$. Dining tips (we ate a bunch of different places) - best seafood at Long Boards at the Maui Marriott, then Dukes and Kimos. Bubba Gumps and Cheeseburger in Paradise were so so. If you want something really different, which was exceptional try the Melting Pot across from the Lahania Cannery Mall.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, relaxing place to base your vacation”
Reviews.Author: BayBoater
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Lahaina Shores Beach Resort and got 4th floor ocean view rooms. We had been apprehensive about the construction we had read about in previous trip reports. I can honestly say either we were lucky or it was winding down. Yes, there were workers running around in the hallways and elevators. But, any noises were brief (2-3 minutes) and most werenâ€™t bothersome. Both rooms were clean and comfortable. The ocean view was well worth the extra money. We set up a spotting scope on a tripod and saw whales from our balcony every day. Walking distance to downtown Lahaina. A great location to travel north or south for day excursions.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: Jodeus
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Lahaina Shores Beach Resort for eight nights beginning on 5/26/10. Major reason for choosing the hotel was the location on Front Street. Most people who have left negative reviews of the place just really need to do research prior to staying. The hotel is pretty much no frills, no restaurant, no gym etc....but I knew that prior to booking! What it did have for us: a very comfortable bed, clean room (old tv but oh well), nice pool and hot tub, small but accessible beach and the best location in Lahaina. My wife and I walked Front Street enjoying the stores, shops and restaurants every day we were there. Everything worked out great here, I would not hesitate to stay at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: lheafey
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in a studio unit on the ocean side. We loved the proximity to the beach, great restaurants, and shopping. The location couldn't have been more perfect. The beach is literally right there! We appreciated the relaxed atmosphere, the ability to cook a few of our own meals (although 2 of the best restaurants in town are right next door -- don't miss them!), and the short stroll up the road to shopping and boating charters. The view from our veranda overlooking the island of Lanai was our treat at the end of every day. We became friendly with folks we met at the pool who had rented a mountain view unit, and it was lovely, to. We had heard ahead of time that it wasn't necessary to rent a car for the entire week, and that turned out to be so true. We took the shuttle bus a few times to pick up groceries, and that worked out great. Hotel staff were very helpful in pointing us in the right direction when we wanted to rent a car for a day to do an island drive. We will definitely be back, as this place seems to offer one of the best values in and around Lahaina.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Comfortable, Close to Everything and Really, Really Nice”
Reviews.Author: CharlieSliders
Reviews.Content: This is our third trip to Maui in the past decade. Our first stay (on business) was at an opulent, big name resort for big bucks. Our second stay was at a local chain hotel at less than $500 per night. Both were an extravagance, crowded and had that "chain" feel. But, during a helicopter ride we noticed a charming property virtually on the beach. (The other properties we enjoyed were "beach poor" and required a substantial walk to reach what there was.) The next day, we inspected the property and found the staff extremely cordial. An older property, it just completed a Million $$ renovation. What they don't have... a restaurant, a health-club, a bar, golf course or free Internet. Why? Because the finest restraurants and clubs are just blocks away, along with upscale art gallaries, the dock, Internet cafes and all the shopping one person can do in a lifetime. What they do have... really nice people, the best lanais overlooking the ocean, your own fully-equiped kitchenette, a laundry, a pool and whirlpool ten feet from the lobby and the beach is only twenty-five feet beyond the pool. Lahaina Beach Resort is not fancy, but it's really clean... and half the price of just about anywhere else. We were really able to relax, watch the cruise ships and surfers and take a short walk when we needed to fill the refrigerator, rent a scooter, watch a Luau, have a coconut gelato, go fishing or get a massage.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel of our two week trip, wonderfully comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: debbiegordon
Reviews.Content: We just loved this hotel. Staff friendly, rooms clean, priced right. Would thoroughly recommend it, and really appreciated the email a week after we arrived home thanking us for staying. Nice touch!. We loved Harry Troupe, the singer at Cheeseburger on Paradise, and had a fantastic meal at Bubba Gumps. The trivia was a nice fun touch. Maui is so clean and friendly. Hire a car and take in the sites. Wish we had stayed a few more nights. We will return. Mahalo. from Tasmania.

Reviews.Title: “Service makes up for lack of amenities”
Reviews.Author: Rollergirl37
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Lahaina Shores for 10 days. The service was great. We had two rooms because the first one we could hear construction. Even though I called specifically called and asked about construction and was told nothing was planned. There a quite a few homeowners upgrading their units and do they do not have a set schedule. The three rooms we saw were pretty dated. The front desk was quick to show us 2 other rooms and , they were very accomodating. They certainely make up for lack of ammenities in their service. Its a good value for the money. You are close to downtown and the Ocean views are spectactular. If you going to stay opt for an Ocean front room,its so beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “New and Improved”
Reviews.Author: Dalecorp
Reviews.Content: The location was always second to none and now the rooms are exceptional as well. Had the privledge of staying in one of the premium ground floor one bedroom units that was recently renovated to the highest of standards. Four Seasons look out!?! The main living area consisted of entirely built in furniture with granite counter tops and an ostrich skin banquette coupled with a huge flat screen television. The kitchen was state of the art as well even though I only ate breakfast in the room, so it was not used to its potential. There were two bathrooms also of five star hotel quality attached to a very impressive master suite with a mattress to die for and a huge plasma screen of its own! Each of my days was completed with a drink on the lanai watching the sun set over the ocean as an occasional whale leapt from the water. I usually don't take pictures of hotel rooms, but this stay I made an exception so that I could show my friends. The pool area and surrounding land are peaceful with abundant lawn chairs. As usual, the courteousness and service of the staff was top notch coupled by the location, location and location of the property. It is so convenient to walk in to town each and every night for dinner and then a stroll through the galleries and stores. Lahaina Shores is right in the heart of everything and that's what makes it so special. I really look forward to returning next winter.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem of a place to stay”
Reviews.Author: PHX-OGG
Reviews.Content: Lahaina Shores Beach Resort has so many positives, it's a must stay and we'll return again and again, we hope. First, the location can't be beat. It is a quiet location on the south side of Lahaina, has a beach just a few steps from the resort, and you can face the ocean or be thrifty and take a room on the mountain side. Many excellent restaurants are next door and others, only a couple of blocks away. In the center of town are where all the excursion boats leave from. Second, the building has just finished renovations, looks great and the rooms are decorated very nicely. Listening to the waves crashing at night is heavenly. Third, you always feel at home here with the friendly, helpful staff. Lastly, the value for what you pay is wonderful. This is definitely a hidden gem in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Getting old but still nice!”
Reviews.Author: Venturatravelers
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Lahaina Shores from March 19 until March 29, 2010. We have stayed here twice before thru the years. You can tell the complex is getting older but it is well maintained. Because each room is a privatly owned condo, it is the owners responsiblity for design and upgrades. We stayed in condo #519 and you can tell that the owner has kept it simple with no upgrades but it was kept clean and tidy by the cleaning staff. We like staying here because of it's location and it is one of the only places to stay in the town of Lahaina with an ocean veiw and you can walk into town. I think most people would prefer staying at the newer, fancier hotels in Ka'anapali but we do like staying here. The grounds are clean, well lancscaped and nicely kept. The view from our room was stunning. We looked right out onto the ocean with Lanai across the channel. We could see whales each morning and several times during the day and evening and the sunsets are beautiful. It is a short walk, maybe 50 feet, from the back of the complex to the beach. It may not have the glits and aminities that the newer hotels have but to my wife and I, it is an "oldie but goodie". We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but terrible room (Room 425)”
Reviews.Author: l_citybythebay
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the beginning of Feb. and we got a great rate with a ocean front room. We knew about the construction beforehand, hence the great rate. The hotel itself is in a great location, very nice beach and not crowded at all. Not a frilly place . Lots of lounge chairs on property but only 6 on the beach. The whole time we were there there were no more than 12-15 people on the beach. We did not use the pool but it looked fine. The ocean is very shallow there so snorkeling was easy and we saw many fish. And you can see the whales from the balcony which was fun. There is no rental rafts or anything there so you have to go buy or rent somewhere else. I went to safeway and bought a little umbrella and went to costco for rafts and food. Lahaina center of town is just a short walk down the street so that was great but not to close to be noisy. However these rooms are individually owned and some are nice and some are not. Our room was not. We were told it was a king bed, it was a queen and very uncomfortable. The whole unit is very outdated and dirty. Housekeeping is very poor. The carpet was very stained and I found FOOD under the bed and dead bugs on the sheets. Minimal equipment to cook with, we just grilled out (there are two gas grills on the side of the hotel). The room was basically like a motel room. Other places we have stayed in like this had more room amenities like dish soap, more bath towels, condiments, etc. I know this sounds picky but these things add up. They do have 3 washers and dryers there , cost was about 4.50 to do a load (wash & dry). The updated rooms I'm told are R-507 (king), R-517 (queen), R-109 (premium), R-111 9premium), R-212, R-302. I did not see these rooms personally, this is info from front desk. There is a desk downstairs to book excursions, there are many to pick from. I do recommend renting a car if you want to see the island. It is very easy to drive. Warning, if you do the Hana drive plan on a whole day, it takes 3 hours to drive 30 miles, and bring drinks and food. There is a little roadside food place just before you get to Hana, wonderful garlic shrimp and coconut shrimp. Hana highway is very twisty and narrow, they call it the divorce highway, if you drive it you will see why . :) I for one will never do it again! All in all a very nice vacation and Maui is beautiful. People are friendly and I felt very safe going downtown at night by myself. So bring your own snorkeling equipment and have fun!!!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful spot”
Reviews.Author: weimgray
Reviews.Content: great place... walking distance to downtown, shops and restaurants. Great staff. Beach is at your backdoor.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: jodiesme
Reviews.Content: We enjoy our 10 night stay. We originally booked the whole stay for mountain view because nothing else was available. On arrival Allyson went out of her way to find us some nights we could switch around to an oceanview and we jumped at the chance. Moving rooms couldn't have been easier. We packed up in the morning, handed over our keys, went out and did our thing for the day and when we came back in the afternoon they had moved our things for us into the new room, even the groceries. Just had to pick up the new keys and we were "home". We did get to stay in 3 different rooms. First was the Mountain View. Not as nice at the others, 4th floor, a little more dated, beautiful view of the hills and it was interesting watching the road and "action" out front. A crazy little rooster sure did wake early though and wanted you to join him. Once I closed the door though, you no longer could hear it. Second room was on the 5th floor ocean view. Nicer room. Same layout basically, just felt nicer somehow. Beautiful ocean view. Fun watching the luau next door along with hawaiian music. Lovely atmosphere. Last room 6th floor ocean view. My favorite room. Love the arched window looking out over the ocean and Lanai. Rooms were all clean, One had a cockroach one night so we flung it off the lanai and hoped it didnt land on anyone else. Basic kitchen stuff. Might want to bring your own salt and pepper, they only had those little packet type things. Bath products all provided each mornng. Construction was pretty much done. A little bit of painting going on the entryway when we arrived but even that was done by the time we left. They still had the 7th floor covered so must still be working up there. Didn't seem to affect anyone that I could tell. They all looked like they were enjoying themselves as were were. Great place to stay if you like to walk in the evening. Very safe feel to the streets, well lighted, many places to eat and things to do without driving anywhere. THis was our 4th stay and hope we get a chance to stay again. Not a fancy resort, but we love it there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but dated accomandations”
Reviews.Author: JonathanMV
Reviews.Content: The location was great. It was at the end of the busy walking strech of Lahaina. The building itself if under renovations so we hope the rooms will improve. I was shocked when I came in and couldn't find the bed! Shockingly it was a bed that pulled out from the wall... We didn't expect that the Studio suite we booked would be so dated. It had a full bath and a full kitchen which was great but it needs some serious work. They were renovating half of the building so hopefully they renovate the rest but I thought their price was too high compared to what you're getting. The balcony was large but the garden view was a view of the road, some old residential houses and the moutains in the background. We choose this hotel because it was on a beach but the beach was dirty and not something anyone would lay on... don't stay there because of the beach or to get nice accomandations... stay there for the location only. OH and the roaster across the street woke my wife up every morning at 3:30 am...

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice for the Price”
Reviews.Author: prettyangel687
Reviews.Content: I traveled in March 2009, i am just writing this review now, so it could have changed in the year i have been there. I booked on a special with pleasant holidays. Airfare from SF, with car for $893 total for 2 ppl. I had a no view room. We were hoping to get upgraded when we got there, but they did not have anything available. Check in was great, friendly and fast. I found the room to be very roomy, kitchen looked clean, everything looked clean. CLEAN is very important to me. Came with a sponge and soup to wash dishes too. Balcony was decent size, and bed was decent too. Location was in front of a tiny little beach, with no room for lounging. Not the best of beaches either, so i would recommend going somewhere else. The pool was just a normal pool. I liked how it was on Front street, but it is at the END of the street. We did not mind, since we enjoyed the walk. I stayed in a wide range of hotels. From the mandarin to the park hyatt to 2 stars. I found nothing wrong with this hotel. If you want posh, go somewhere else, you are only paying for a 2-3 star, so dont expect spectacular. You wont be in your room most of the time anyways. I would recommend this place to all my friends if they wanted a good budget type of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lahaina Shores #403”
Reviews.Author: daggar
Reviews.Content: This is our fifth stay in unit #403 over four years. I first found the listing on VRBO, and the worst part of every stay is having to leave! As soon as we leave, we both start looking forward to when we can return. This will sound crazy (my wife says I'm crazy) but last night I actually had a nightmare....I dreamed I was back home! Fortunately, I woke up to the sights of swaying palm trees! I am personally amazed every time I see a negative comment about Lahaina Shores. At first, my wife and I were a little put off by those reviews, but in reading them carefully, it looked to me to be written by people who thought it was going to be a Resort, like the big Marriotts. We were just at the Marriott St. Kitts the second week of January, and it was very, very nice. The $25 hamburger and $8 beer was fairly tasty, and they had a couple of very nice ($$$$) restaurants on site, but you couldn't just wander down the street to find neat shops and reasonable local cuisine. So, to temper this review, my wife and I solidly prefer a non-all-inclusive-resort type of location. Now, that said, when you arrive at Lahaina Shores, the lobby is spacious and inviting. The view of the ocean from the lobby sets the mood. This is going to be good. Lahaina Shores has no restaurant or bar, but next door is a selection of each at 505 and Lahaina Shores has a direct walkway built over there so you don't even have to go out to the street. The real reason we chose Lahaina Shores over other condo rentals initially was the proximity to Lahaina town. It is literally a 5 minute walk to the Banyan Tree and all the shops, restaurants, and bars along Front Street. If you want to go on a whale watch, snorkel cruise, or dinner cruise, the boats leave from just the other side of the Banyan Tree. If location is important to you, you have no other choice. The reason we prefer non-resort properties is both for the ability get out and walk to things as well as to be able to cook for ourselves some. We get tired of eating out every meal, even when it is a $15 bagel just downstairs at a resort. We usually make our own breakfast, and when we get lazy, Betty's is just next door. We like choices. Now, from my tone, you can imagine the shock of reading the post below about unit #403. I will admit, and I have advised the owner, that the tub needs to be replaced. There is nothing unclean or unsafe about it, but there is about a 4 inch section where the fiberglass has separated and the top layer peeled off. The owners have assured me that this will be repaired this summer. We just use it for a shower anyway, so we really aren't negatively affected. Everything else in that post is an exaggeration. I was here for 2 1/2 weeks in December with my family, and am now in the middle of our usual 4 week stay to avoid the winter on the East Coast. While my family was here, I got to visit four other rooms that they were in. We were all aware of the construction in advance, and received a discount because of it. I can honestly say that the construction didn't affect us at all. A little noise here and there, but no dust or dirt, and the workers we did run into were careful to stay out of our way. They seemed to understand that we were on vacation. Luckily, in December, the contruction was at the other end, on the other side. I'm sure that helped. Now, the contruction final phase is primarily in the penthouse units on the top floor, so we are even less aware of the construction in progress. Would I rather the construction not be going on? You bet. Am I letting it bug me? Not in the least. I've been in the room two weeks, and we rearrange the furniture as soon as we open the door as we work in the mornings, but I'm going to post pictures so you can see that this is a beautiful place. Do understand that when we arrived, the place was spotless as it had just been cleaned. We rent directly from the owner, so we choose to do our own cleaning, which is taking place tomorrow.
