Still, I think you will be able to see that #403 is in great condition, with an unmatchable view, and so close to town you can walk in for a cup of coffee. I wish I lived here!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Room #331, a BIT too close to the "action"...”
Reviews.Author: millersdad
Reviews.Content: We arrived the second week of January to spend the next 6 nights here. The check-in process went fairly smoothly, though there was much construction going on outside so we weren't sure where to park upon our arrival so we could get checked in. I figured out something workable though and my traveling companion (my senior mother) stayed in the vehicle while I spoke with the front desk. All the front desk folks I interacted with during our whole stay were super helpful. We were assigned to room #331, an efficiency with two separate beds. The kitchenette was functional and supplied with enough utensils and equipment to allow for basic meal preparation. The fridge was on and pre-chilled, so it was ready to accept some breakfast basics and snacks that require it's use. Our room was clean and kept so throughout our stay by our wonderful maid, Phyllis. The property will clean rooms daily, however it's up to you to do your own dishes/cookware. The construction that was SUPPOSED to be wrapped up around Sept. 2009 is still ongoing. Sadly I had to inform my travel agent of this and ask if we should find alternatvie arrangements. My TA contacted them and Lahaina Shores gave us a "relatively accurate" appraisal of the state of repairs. Due to it's excellent location, allowing us to walk to much of the town of Lahaina, we opted to give it a go. considering all the rooms there and the construction being confined to one end of the building, our chances were good we'd be insulated from the intrusion of construction repairs. Well, odds were not in our favor on that. The rooms across the hall from us were all undergoing construction as were the ones directly next to us on the north side. I will say they had plastic on the hallway carpets to minimize construction dust, but it was still there. Location, location, location. That's really why I had settled on Lahaina Shores when I was setting up our vacation. (well, budget, too) but convenience and walkability to Lahaina-town was an important factor since my mother loves to walk a bit. Due to her health & age, she can't hike or do long walks so having options available that were close and not requiring too long of a walk or the use of a car (we had a rental, but let me say finding parking in Lahaina isn't particularly easy at times). Our room overlooked the ocean at tree-top level. This made seeing possible whale sightings a bit on the tough side, however the view was sitll wonderful. If you're expectations are realistic, I feel you get a reasonable place to stay. I'd certainly NOT pay full price for any room here while there is ANY construction going on. Bargain for a decent discount. Convenient? Absolutely! Four Seasons Quality? hehe, no. When will construction be completed? a GOOD question. First it was Sept., 2009, then it pushed back to Dec. 2009. I'm guessing probably Sept. 2010. You know what they say about renovating. "it takes twice as long and costs twice as much"... and this IS Hawaii, where one might get the impression the construction workers aren't in that big of a hurry to end this job.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Utahnloves2travel
Reviews.Content: We had an oceanfront 1 bedroom 2 bath unit. It was very roomy for 4 people. It was a wonderful experience-walking distance to so many things, beautiful view. We would stay here again when visiting Maui.

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For.”
Reviews.Author: CDN_Woman
Reviews.Content: The Lahaina Shores Beach Resort is a decent place to stay if you are on a budget. The room my husband and I stayed in was certainly dated. The furniture reminded me of the late 1980's era. The kitchen was NOT fully equiped which is completely misleading by the website. Your best bet is to shop for plates, cups, bowls, etc... at a dollar store prior to arriving for you accomodations as the quality of the "fully equiped" kitchen is poor. And do not forget to buy cleaning products if you want to have a clean / dirt-free stay. A part of me certainly wanted to spend an entire day cleaning the dirty fridge handle, the dirty light switches, etc. The amount of dirt that has accumulated over time on the light switches, etc is clearly evident! Another disappointing aspect is the Internet. Lahaina Shores does provide you with Internet, however you have to bring your own computer/laptop. It would have been helpful to know that the accomodations only provides you with an internet wire. So, if you plan to use the internet, your best bet is to either bring your own laptop or go to one of the Internet Cafes in town. Other issues/concerns include the telephone connection which was often full of static. After several attempts at manipulating the telephone cord, the static sounds would go away. The static made it very very very difficult to hear your conversation during telephone calls. And as for doing laundry... well.... that's another issue. I did laundry a few times and each time I encountered difficulties with the washing machines. Basically, the washers would not run unless you slam the washer door with great force. All of the machines have the same issue. And as to how hard to slam the washer doors.... well... as hard as you can and until the washing machine works. I was privilaged enough to be shown that trick by the helpful staff. As for the construction... well... I knew all about it. Yes it was distracting, but my husband and I spent very little time in the condo during construction hours. The nice things about Lahaina Shores Beach Resort includes: - the amazing view of the Ocean, considering you have an ocean view suite. - the helpful, friendly and accomodating staff. - the nightly rate for an Ocean View ($139.00 - during construction) - the nice pool & hot tub. - the proximity to the beach. (Note: beach is has lots of rocks mixed with the sand). - the amount of lawn chairs available for use. - the proximity to town. - the smoke free environment. The big question is whether or not we would stay here again. Well...the answer is no. Once the construction is over, the cost of accomodations will be inflated back to the normal rate. The stay will not be worth the cost and your best bet is to pay $100-$200 more a night with alternative accomodations where you will be satisfied/content with your stay. There is NO WAY that I would pay the regular rate for an Ocean View Studio considering all the issues/concerns my husband and I experienced. If you are on a budget and you need an inexpensive place to sleep, then perhaps this is the place for you. But just remember, you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the construction disruption...”
Reviews.Author: markduck
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four night stay. Because of very loud and very smelly construction project, price was reduced super low making the ordeal a decent value. Room (ocean front studio) ws $139. We begged to get a north end corner, and was accomodated after the first night, which was due to caring front desk staff. the rooms ending in "37" overlook the Lahaina Luau. Place was filthy, parking cumbersome. After construction project will need thorough cleaning and is in urgent need of renovation. Toilets clog and maids don't bother to flush or clean them, linens are rags. Great location for sunsets and whale watching.

Reviews.Title: “This is the hidden jewel in Maui! Stayed for my honeymoon! LOVE IT!!”
Reviews.Author: butterfly890809
Reviews.Content: After much research i chose this place for my honeymoon. It was the best! Had champagne waiting on us in the room. Ocean front...like just steps from the pool. Private beach with a reef circling it so there was NO waves. AWESOME to swim in! Staff was great. Everything was just perfect. Great location. Very few people stay there b/c they don't know how wonderful it is. Some locals told us that was the best & most private in Maui. Love Lahaina!!!! Much better than Kaanapali! Very laid back and not so crowded! Can't wait to visit again! Oh, and they clean your room everyday too!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: kmg320
Reviews.Content: Lahaina shores is a great spot. Comfortable rooms offer full kitchens. Laundry facilities on each floor. Beach right outside the door. Walking distance to famous Front Street. Gives you everything you need. Great restaurants, shops, ATM's all close by. Beautiful grounds with swimming pool and jacuzzi right off lobby. Will be going back in 2010.

Reviews.Title: “Good (Location and View) Bad (Construction and Smoking Policy)”
Reviews.Author: StanYork
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 11 days at Lahaina Shores. If you want to stay close to Lahaina, this property is a great choice since it is walking distance (long walk) from the shops. The ocean front condos have great views. Lahaina Shores is offering good rates right now because they are under construction to renovate the property. Their website states that construction is limited to Monday through Friday, but they also worked on both Saturday on the two weekends we were there. The hallways look like a construction zone. The hammering/drilling was very loud from our room. The beach is not a very good swimming beach; no sandy bottom off shore and there is a creek/drainage ditch emptying into the ocean at the edge of the property. The swimming/snorkeling is MUCH better further North in the Kaanapali Beach area. And finally, they have a extremely strict no smoking policy. There is no smoking allowed in any of the rooms or anywhere on the property except one unsafe, unlit designated area along Front Street. Guests who smoke must walk past the construction trailers in the dark to get to the only designated smoking area. Keep this fact in mind if you are a smoker.

Reviews.Title: “We knew about renovation, but.............”
Reviews.Author: travelbysue
Reviews.Content: This was a first time visit to this resort, and we were fully aware of the renovations going on, but that really wasn't the problem. On the plus side, smack dab in Lahaina, walk to good and reasonable restaurants, happy hours, etc. As far as the beach, I wouldn't swim in it, very silty, mud and sand, and who knows what because it's so close to the harbor. The room was so so, our queen bed was two twins pushed together. On our last day the bath tub stopped up, had to go to another room to shower. The staff was very nice, but we usually stay at the Maui kaanapali Villas, but we thought for a change we would try the Lahaina Shores. If you want a bed and a shower, this is the place, but remember, no restaurant on property or bar, and you have to drive to Kaanapali for a much better beach experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: kait1yn
Reviews.Content: I was very concerned with the last review I read before going to Maui. It seemed like the hotel will be a dump because of the renovation. I'm so glad that our experience was completely different . The lobby is pretty and the staff were friendly and nice. The hotel was fully booked so when we found out that our room has only 1 queen bed (we requested 2 single beds), they were unable to move us. They sent a rollaway bed instead. They were only able to move us 2 nights after. In order to make it up to us, they waived the parking fee for our whole stay. The construction did not bother us. It was done during the day and we are usually out and about those times. The room was nice. Furniture is dated but pretty comfortable. We had a beautiful view of the mountain. Hotel is right on the beach and a few blocks away from Lahaina town. There are restaurants and mini-grocery right next door. Will definitely stay here again just for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Lahaina Shores Beach Resort, Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: lms3
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went to Maui Hawaii for the first time back in Sept, and stayed at Lahaina Shores Beach Resort. A good friend of ours had recommended this hotel, and even though it was under construction at the time we went, it was still a great place to stay. The construction didn't affect our time there at all. (Most of it was happening when we were out during the day anyway). The pool was nice, and it is right on the beach! There were times when I was laying out, and no one else was around, which was amazing. The only bad thing is that the beach is not very big, and there is coral to be careful of. OVERALL GREAT LOCATION. very close to to restaurants, bars and night life. It was really cool because we walked just about everywhere!! It was a great way to take in the scenery and experience our trip. The hotel is right on Front street which is was really cool too! Our hotel room was nice, queen size bed and an amazing view. This is not a four star hotel by any means, but it's great if your on a budget!! We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Third time is the charm!”
Reviews.Author: wewannagoagain
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at the Lahaina Shores, and each time it has gotten better. We have always booked oceanfront accomodations, but be sure to specify what bedding type you want. We had twin murphy beds on our 1st trip, and I really was disappointed. Last year we requested a king bed, and got it, this year we had a queen bed. SO make sure you specify the bedding type you prefer. The studio oceanfront we had this year was so quaint. The owners did a great job of updating the decor. I felt very comfortable in this room. The construction was not an issue to us, as we were busy during the day, and it was done by the time we returned each evening. We enjoyed being on the beach and in the lawn area, so no pool during the construction was not a problem. Although there is no restaurant on site, there are several next door at the 505, and also a convenience store with snacks, souvenirs, and beverages. I have stayed in 5 star hotels that I had to walk further to the restaurants than I did to the restaurants that were not on this property! The proximity to Lahaina Town (4 blocks) is a real bonus for meals, shopping, water tours (snorkelling, dinner cruises, whale watching, etc). You are already parked at the Shores, so you can walk and not have to deal with the nightmare of finding parking in Lahaina. The front desk staff may have been having an off week, because they were not as friendly as they were the last time. Yes, the same front desk staff! If you are looking to book a luau while staying at the Lahaina Shores, book the Feast at Lele. It is right next door, so you can enjoy a few adult beverages, and not have to worry about driving. The down sides to the Lahaina Shores are no free internet access, no waher/dryer in room, and per night parking fees. We spent 5 nights at the Lahaina Shores, and then moved on to another property on Kaanapali Beach, and altho it was nice, we will spend our entire trip in Maui next year at the Lahaina Shores because of the proximity to Lahaina Town.

Reviews.Title: “Upgrade to ocean view”
Reviews.Author: Mclovebugs
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I have stayed at shores 3 times now and is the best location for food and nightlife. Suggest spending the extra money for an ocean view but other than that I will continue to stay there. Do not expect a fancy resort for it's just a condo so for the last reviewer it is not a fancy resort. Kapalua bay is the best beach I have ever been to so you must find it. Sits just south of the ritz it is a must. For the best breakfest the gazebo at the south entrance of napili bay is is the best

Reviews.Title: “Not for a romantic getaway, NOT A RESORT!!!”
Reviews.Author: dreamweaverj25
Reviews.Content: Don't be deceived as my wife and I were!!! We planned to stay at the Lahaina Shores Beach "Resort" on our honeymoon and were not pleased from the moment we arrived. The "resort" was under construction and we knew this going in to our stay there, so the tarps, workers, and noise were to be expected and that is not our gripe. The staff (both of them) were not only unfriendly, but down right rude and unaccommodating. We were "greeted" at the front desk by the most unfriendly person that we encountered on our entire five day stay in Maui. When we informed her that we were on our honeymoon and had been married the day prior she said nothing and gave us our room key and little direction. Upon entering our room, we were greeted by one of the most unkind smells that I have ever smelled outside of a port-a-john. The room stank of musky urine. It was also about 90 degrees throughout the majority of the hotel; the exception was the elevator which was kept at a balmy 100 degrees. The bed in the room was a standard twin, the room would have been considered clean but only by our 5 year olds standards. With further investigation/inspection of out honeymoon accommodations we found that the room was outdated, the paint was chipping, the fixtures were very old, and the AC hardly worked due to a clogged air filter that more closely resembled a lint trap then an air filter. After our first 20 min in the room there was a knock on our door. We opened it to find the only other hotel worker we saw that day standing there, seemingly high as a kite, with a warm bottle of Korbel in his hand. He handed it to me and turned around and walked away, saying nothing. We soon came to find out that our "resort" had no room service, for there was no restaurant on the grounds, and no bar at which to get cocktails to bring onto the beach, something we were looking forward to on our honeymoon. The pool was closed due to construction, and we were told we could use the public pool 5 blocks away. We had asked for a ocean view suite when we made the reservations 3 months prior, but got a "partial" ocean view that we could only see from the very edge of our lanai. Basically this hotel had nothing to offer a honeymoon couple, not even working AC or friendly service. It was a Motel 6 on the beach. Bed, shower, toilet, stove. That's all you get. LAHAINA SHORES BEACH RESORT SHOULD NOT BE ABLE TO ADVERTISE THEMSELVES AS A RESORT. We checked out the next day (after much correspondance with our travel agent, pleading "get me out of here!"), got our money back that we had pre-paid to Lahaina Shores for the rest of the week, and stayed the rest of our honeymoon at the Royal Lahaina in Kaanapali, which was absolutely wonderful and everything we were looking for. Funny thing is, upon checking out of Lahaina Shores Beach "RESORT", and telling the lady at the front desk (even though we could tell she really didn't care) about why we were not going to be staying with them for the rest of our honeymoon, she said, and i quote, "Oh, what you want is a RESORT, and this definitely is not that."

Reviews.Title: “Location, People and the View. Will definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: nowarian
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Hawaii for a wedding. The bride and groom recommended this hotel and stayed there for a few days as well. It was very easy to find (just off the highway) and within walking distance to the long strip on the beach. We booked snorkeling adventures and were able to walk to the harbor from our hotel. That made is so easy! Being walking distance from many restaurants and shops was a big plus! There is a parking lot at the hotel as well which is entered by a key card. The angle to get into the lot is a bit awkward but you get used to it. The staff at the hotel were very friendly! So helpful and kind from the time we got there! There is an expedia activities desk downstairs which can help you book trips and adventures. Very nice people. The room was definitely older but kept very clean and neat!! We had a full kitchen (utensils and all), 2 full beds, balcony with a view of the mountains and a spacious bathroom. There was a TV, extra chairs/couch and table. Both my friend and I were pleasantly surprised with our room. And of course we had AC....which some of the hotels we considered, didn't! We had internet but there is a charge. The hotel has a nice pool, lots of breezy ocean front property. The only thing was the area of sand between the hotel and ocean....kinda small. Not fluffy, soft sand. However, there are many many beaches to chose from. So not a problem at all. With all the pros of this place...that one little con is very minor. Loved this place, would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of construction, but a diamond in the rough”
Reviews.Author: Audifanatic
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Lahaina Shores with a few friends for part of a wedding and overall itâ€™s a great hotel. Theyâ€™re in the middle of updating the place, but you cannot beat the location for the money. We stayed in Penthouse 5 and had a great view of the ocean (picture enclosed). Be aware that this place is outdated overall, but itâ€™s right on the beach, so youâ€™ll have a great time relaxing in the sun. The front desk people were amazing. They helped me out when I needed something and were always willing to lend a hand with my travel arrangements. I loved the 4.95 breakfast next door.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful condo - perfect for us!”
Reviews.Author: MLJPJK
Reviews.Content: The Lahaina Shores Beach Resort was wonderful. Lots of construction going on that didn't bother us one bit. Location right on the beach. Nice pool. Location within walking distance of Lahaina shops and restaurants. Great small mall right next door. From our balcony we watched the Feast at Lele performance every night! Small downside to that: sound from luau lasted longer than we did on the first night. But overall, we would definitely stay therea again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be afraid of the hard hat special”
Reviews.Author: Alexandria54
Reviews.Content: They aren't kidding about the construction. It's really going on for sure. However, the side of the building that faces the ocean is pristine. No view obstructions and the grounds, although small, are immaculate. the pool is beautiful and the beach if fun but you need floaties cause of all the coral on the sea bed. Here's the deal; location is everything here. It is so awesome to walk out of the hotel and right into Lahaina. Not only are there all kinds of shops immediately outside the hotel but a very short walk takes you into the heart of town and it's exactly how I like it. We are not resort people who enjoy sprawling properties and whenever you go somewhere you have to drive. We were really happy with our choice. Aloha.

Reviews.Title: “Construction Rating”
Reviews.Author: GA2CHI
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a couple of days the week of 9/14. Overall, the stay was great; the only thing was the construction noise was horrible from 9 AM - 5 PM, at least on the 4th floor. I booked their construction rate special aware of the construction going on. Noise does not bother me. I stayed at a hotel on the Waikiki strip with no problem, but this was like a jackhammer in your room. To top it off, they advertised construction is only Monday through Friday, but on Friday, they put up a letter in the elevators saying there would be construction on Saturday. Other than this, the place is great. It's clean and the location is fantastic especially when visiting the east side of the island. However, if you want to stay in Lahaina your entire holiday, you can, as all you need is in the downtown area that is fun to walk through. The beach is okay. I'm probably the only one who feels this way, but IMHO, the island of Lanai blocks what would be a beautiful sunset (not the hotels fault though). The staff was friendly and if the rates are comparable after construction is done, Lahaina Shores is a no brainer for a return.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant place to stay, great value too.”
Reviews.Author: derekp308
Reviews.Content: What a nice find. My mother and I stayed here for four nights on our Hawaii vacation and I must say we made the right choice. Our room overlooked the beach, which also gives you a great view of the nearby island of Lanai. Rooms are large and comfortable, with a bed built into the wall (we got an extra rollaway which my mother said wasn't bad as far as rollaway beds go) and even a VCR/DVD player. The hotel has no restraunt, but your within walking distance from several places to eat at a very nice shopping center nearby (which by the way is also home to a luau called "The Feast at Lele" of which we are able to hear and partualy see from our room. On a sidenote, part of this hotel was under repair. Because of this, we where able to get a nice deal on this place, for I'm sure the prices will skyrocket once the repairs are over.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Comfortable place!”
Reviews.Author: Kerbear63
Reviews.Content: Lahaina Shores was a very nice place to stay in Maui. We had a studio, mountain view which suited us fine. The room was ALWAYS freshly cleaned each day. The kitchen was also stocked nicely with the necessary dishes. The AC was easy to operate. The construction noise was minimal. Parking was overpriced for such a crowded lot ($8.00/day) was the ONLY complaint we can think of. We would definetly recommend this place right on the ocean! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great location but the Penthouse Suite was a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Lady_DiCanada
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is great. The beach is very nice and the grounds are beautiful. We rented the penthouse suite which proved to be a huge disappointment. Each suite is individually owned so it is up to the owner as to how it is furnished. The suite was large but was very bare bones. The Lanai furniture did not have any padding and there were no loungers, just a few chairs. There were no pictures on the walls and everything was very bare. The towels were low grade. The pull out couch was not anything anyone could sleep on. I did talk to other guests however and they said that there are other penthouse suites that are very nicely done and have lots of extras.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value- Great Location, Good Deal!”
Reviews.Author: Tamawa
Reviews.Content: First time to Maui- my travel agent picked this place for me and I would go back.... Resort is beachfront and walking distance to shops and restaurants.. I did not have an ocean front view- but the mountain view was still great. Condo had a kitchen- great for breakfast and dinners if I choose not to go out. Next time I am in Maui- this is where I would stay!!!!

Reviews.Title: “If you want aloha, or great weather - stay here!”
Reviews.Author: MauiGirl2009
Reviews.Content: The only oceanfront hotel in Lahaina. The staff is like family and make everyone feel like Ohana. Steps to a quiet beach where you don't have to compete with other high-rise hotels and crowds.Â  Feels like your own private beach. TheÂ  studio apartments are spaceious and include a sitting area, a fully stocked kitchen and a breakfast area.Â  Not just peek-a-boo views but a whole wall of window to view the ocean (just steps away) or full view of the majestic West Maui Mountains.Â  There is plenty of lounging space and just a walk to hundreds of shops, restaurants, (famous Feast at Lele, Ios, and Pacificos are on the adjoining property) or the harbor where you can get on just about any excursion there is. Jan/Feb/Mar - sit on your lanai and watch the whales do their thing. Sunrise and sunsets are amazing as you can see three islands - Molokai, Lanai and Kahoolawe from the beach or your lanai. When we were there in February - it was sunny with some nice trade winds and an occasional shower.Â  Kaanapali and Kihei friends were getting sand blasted and huddling under umbrellas because of torrential wind and rain.Â  Lahaina is well protected and quite predictable -so you've got a better chance of getting that Hawaiian vaction even in the off season.Â  If you must do business or stay connected - there is high-speed internet in every room.Â  We've been going to Lahaina Shores for years. The staff know our name and greet us like family.Â  Tip of the day - get a cheap raft from the store next door and float with a cocktail at sunset. You can enjoy a wonderful luau while riding the gentle waves.Â  Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Great location/Great condo”
Reviews.Author: VacationgirlSandy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 6 nights in April. It is a beautiful spot overlooking the ocean. I would definitely recommend staying on the ocean side. Picture perfect view of palm trees and the ocean. We stayed in condo 313 which we rented directly through the owner. Very nice condo, clean, comfortable bed, nice spot on the 3rd floor. The whole complex was very nice and well maintained. The pool and the hot tub were always being cleaned. It is a short walk to Lahaina town where the restaurants, bars and shops are. Makes it very easy and relaxing not having to worry about driving around finding a restaurant. The only downside when we were there was the noise from the renovations that are going on (which we heard lasts through December). During the day it is very noticeable. Other than that though, I would highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay near Laihana town”
Reviews.Author: seb96
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through a vacation package and were uncertain of what to expect. But Laihana Shores turned out to be a great find. It is at the end of Laihana town on a small beach. Easy to walk into town for dinner, shopping or drinks. The room was functional - nothing fancy - but having a kitchen was nice for breakfast and snacks. Laihana is centrally located and we zipped up the coast for better beaches, inland for sites and even down south for a day. You can't go wrong here and we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Saved our trip”
Reviews.Author: OmahaSevenStar
Reviews.Content: We had resrved rooms At Ka'anapali Beach hotel but the mold was too much too put up with afterr two days. We were able to find a unit here for the rest of our trip. Views are AWESOME. Extremely quiet, walking distance to the dock area. No on site food, but several place right next door. Rooms extremely clean, especially compared to KBH. 1/2 the price too! We will be back, thanks

Reviews.Title: “If you want views and beach but not”
Reviews.Author: andiwynne
Reviews.Content: This place was even better than I could have hoped. To have a quiet, lovely, beach-front hotel out one side of the building, and the charm and bustle of Lahaina immediately available out the other was superb. We have a toddler and didn't want to deal with a car (carsick, sandy car seat, etc)--and we were completely content to take out the stroller daily and wander the town, hang at the pool or beach, or just sit on our balcony and enjoy the view and sound of waves and birdsong. It was also a priority to have a kitchen, and it completely delivered with everything we could need. The wall-sized screen door allowing us to sleep with the sound of crashing waves was something out of my fantasies. The staff was wonderful--I even accidentally broke something in my room and they were immediate and professional in their attention and charged me what had to be much less than replacement cost for the item on the island. Definitely get an ocean-side room, you won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Best value and service in Lahaina”
Reviews.Author: Flamingo9
Reviews.Content: This is the ultimate ohana place to stay. Warm, welcoming and personable, the staff is excellant. The concierge services are local and knowledgable, coupled with Expedia's service which makes the services tailored to my needs. By stopping at Costco on the way home from the airport, we made use of the fully equipped kitchen to save $$ and eat well. This is the only hotel in Lahaina right on the ocean and within walking distance to downtown Front street shops and the harbor. Plus, right next door are several very nice restaurants and shops. Did I mention the views--unobstructed and gorgeous.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Some units are very old and outdated”
Reviews.Author: ankim
Reviews.Content: Lahaina Shores location is unbeatable. I loved being able to walk to Lahaina in the morning to get coffee or over to Betty's Cafe right next door for breakfast and ocean views. If you are not looking to do the beach thing this may be the place for you. Be advised, however, although it is presented as a hotel each unit is individually owned. Our unit was less than appealing with very dirty carpet (difficult when you have small children), musty smell, and an ac unit that seemed to be circulating dirty air. The unit next door to us had recently been renovated with granite countertops, ceramic tile floors, and a tray ceiling. I would definately be sure to ask for a recently remodeled unit. We had a great time out on the front lawn and enjoyed the view, however, I would not stay in the same unit again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: DebbieNC
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Lahaina Shores, the unit we stayed in was on the bottom floor, we would walk out our door and be on the beach in 30 steps, the unit was well equiped and had the best veiw, We could walk to resturants ,and do acivities, within walking distance. Unit 103 felt like our home for 7 days. I look forward to going back.

Reviews.Title: “Room review”
Reviews.Author: atdahat
Reviews.Content: Ono spot. Individually owned condos - each different. # 635 makai studio is average AT BEST. No need to stay - not recommend. I moved to # 205 (also makai). Mo betta. EZ to bring your vehicle and kayak from O'ahu on SuperFerry ( no need rental) - you can leave kayak on lawn in front of unit ..( outdoor parking $8 per night ). aloha

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place.”
Reviews.Author: ongtyj
Reviews.Content: I stayed on 6 floor for 2 nights (27-28 Nov) with mountain view. This resort is almost at the end of the Front street, so is very quiet but near enough to walk to the center of Lahaina where all the shops and restaurents are. Driving around the island from here is very easy as the freeway is just 2 blocks away. The room is spacious with kitchen and is very clean, beach is just meters away.......a beautiful and lovely place.

Reviews.Title: “Good, if you just need a place to stay near Lahaina”
Reviews.Author: Widby2008
Reviews.Content: We booked penthouse unit 706 through VRBO. Interior is very nice with upscale furniture and the condo was very clean. Just one note of caution: although it is listed as OCEANFRONT on VRBO the condo is on the mountain side of the building facing Front Street. So dispite of what it says on VRBO, you WILL NOT be able to enjoy views of the sunset from your lanai ( the two sunset photos shown there cannot have been taken from the lanai). Lahaina Shores is in a great location in walking distance to downtown Lahaina. With the tight parking situation in Lahaina, that's a big plus. The beach in front of the building however is narrow at low tide and almost completely disappears at high tide. So, if you want a nice, clean condo in West Maui this is a good choice. If you want ocean views and a nice beach you need to go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Grandpa12
Reviews.Content: Excellent for the price. Convenient for walking to shops, restaurants, public transportation, beaches. We did not rent a car as it was not needed for staying in this location. Clean and comfortable with a beautiful view of the ocean from our lanai. Complete kitchenette, nice swimming pool and spa, direct access to beach. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lahainas Only Beach Resort”
Reviews.Author: CorvetteTraveler77
Reviews.Content: Three of us stayed at this property on October 18,19,20,2008. Price per night was $337 including taxes, etc. We stayed in Penthouse PR101 which looked out over the bay/ocean. This was a one bedroom two bathroom condo with kitchen, washer dryer, one LCD TV in the living room and standard TV in the bedroom. Good AC. There was a fold out sofa bed for the third person. This property is old, but well maintained and is clean. No bar or restaurant on the property. The view from the penthouse balcony was outstanding. Parking was $22 for the three nights, but parking is easy access in front of the property. Very small beach and no swimming, but great surfing. This property sits on the beach on the south end of Lihaina (on the west side of the island)a small town with mosty locals and a very nice harbor with shops, etc. There are no super sized resorts in this community which made for a nice slow paced stay. We walked to the harbor using the beach or the sidewalks. Lots of good places to eat in town. It is a 40 minute drive to the airport. We booked direct using www.classicresorts.com site.Great staff. Very good place to stay for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Meaganb
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Lahaina Shores through a condo unit rental (#321) and we couldn't have been more pleased. You are literally 20 ft. from the ocean and a three minute walk from the center of Lahaina. If you are the type of traveler that prefers resorts and spends most of the day by the pool or at the spa, this property is probably not for you. But if you enjoy being in the center of activity and spend most of your day out and about, this is a perfect spot (particularly for the price). The sunsets were breathtaking! Unit #321 had been recently renovated and had everything we needed for a three night stay. The hotel staff was friendly and the resort, though older, was well maintained. As for Lahaina - we enjoyed spending a few nights, but by the third day we were ready to head to another part of Maui. It's basically a manufactured surf town - cute, but a little stale for us. We headed down to Wailea for two nights and were happy we changed it up.

Reviews.Title: “Check out the Penthouse #706 - Why stay at any other hotel/resort?”
Reviews.Author: jetsetter248
Reviews.Content: We went there on our honeymoon in August 2008, and will definitely be back next time we visit Maui. We island hopped for a few days, a few other hotels (Westin, Sheraton..), and this unit blows them away. The whole resort is very nice and located on the edge of the strip in Lahaina - far enough to be quiet but just a short stroll to all the shops and restaurants. Kaanapali is just a short drive north, resorts and tall buildings, but you can retreat to 1500 sq ft in this penthouse. If you want spa/massage and all the fluff then a megaresort may be for you, but if you want your own amazing condo check this one out. www.vrbo.com/103392 The Penthouse #706 won't disappoint. I have to admit, my wife was a little leary going from internet reviews and direct rental off the owner, but she now knows it was better than even higher priced hotels and the transaction went seamless. Congrats to the owner for a well run unit.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Penthouse!!”
Reviews.Author: TampaGuy01
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Penthouse 706 at Lahaina Shores Beach Resort during my stay in Maui. This Penthouse is one of the mosy beautiful suites I have ever stayed in. It is on the top floor with an excellent view. It is located next door to restaurants, bars, and stores. The decor is amazing of the penthouse is amazing. It is an upscale, modern decor with a full kitchen and a huge balcony. Expected to feel pampered here. See pictures and book a reservation at www.vrbo.com/103392. It is Penthouse 706. You will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Experience at Lahaina Shores Beach Resort”
Reviews.Author: KnoxvilleJon
Reviews.Content: Tom Meyers has a terrific place at this very nice resort. My wife is very particular about where we stay and it exceeded her expectations. It's beautifully furnished and well maintained. Tom's unit is Penthouse 706. Beautiful views ! We were there in May of 2008 and would definitely return. Tom's website is: www.vrbo.com/103392

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: Coastalcruiser
Reviews.Content: We spent 12 nights at Lahaina Shores Beach Resort and loved every minute of it! It is not fancy, but it is very comfortable, clean, friendly and convenient to restaurants, shopping and the boat docks. From reading other reviews I learned to ask for a room on a high floor, ocean side. Do not try to save money with a mtn. view or you will be disappointed! We were on the 6th floor with a spectacular view of the sunsets over the neighbor island, boats, surfers, etc. and had an added bonus of being able to hear the luau next door. No, the beach is not great, but great beaches are just 10 min. away. The pool and hot tub were fine. The morning welcome breakfast is not much of a breakfast, but we received lots of helpful info on things to do and did not feel pressured to make a decision right then as we were when we went to the Pleasant Holiday's breakfast. Expedia's prices were also better! We did a lot of things during our time on Maui: played golf, took a van trip to Hana & helicoptered back, snorkeled, drove up to Haleakala, even flew over to the big island to see the volcano but the one thing we enjoyed the most was being able to walk downtown. Parking in Lahaina is limited so it was great not having that hassle! The old town atmosphere of Lahaina is another plus! We were not interested in staying in the big resorts further north with their higher prices, more people and traffic. If we get back to Maui we would do everything the same with the exception of going to the Royal Lahaina luau. There are better ones available and if I had paid attention to the guidebook I bought I would have gone to one of those. I spent a lot of time reading about Maui before we left and would recommend everyone do that. Once you get there you want to get on with your vacation and having a plan makes it more relaxing. Hope we can go back again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: Tayl405
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lahaina Shores for a few nights last week and loved it! The hotel was clean, quiet, staff was very helpful and friendly, and it is a short walk into town. The room was big and I highly recommend the ocean view rooms - the view is beautiful! You have to pay extra for parking, but that is standard in Hawaii and $7 is pretty cheap compared to many other places. I've stayed on Maui before and this is all around the best place I've stayed. It has a full kitchen, which was great because we could throw beer and water in the fridge (we didn't stay long enough to make food, but you can easily eat meals at the hotel). We didn't use the pool or jacuzzi but they looked very nice and clean. And the hotel is on the beach, which is hard to find in Hawaii. We are a young couple on vacation and I think this hotel is perfect for similar parties, but I also think it would be good for families or people who don't want to deal with driving out to dinner every night.

Reviews.Title: “good not fancy”
Reviews.Author: mainemary
Reviews.Content: This property is well-sited on Front Street. Shops and restaurants are a brief walk away. The room's decor is not trendy, but the place is clean and safe. Staff are friendly and the beach/pool area are nice. The internet connection is slow - you'd be better off to use the wired cafe up the street. Renovations are going on in the building above the parking garage, so it is a bit messy but I always felt safe traveling alone. The resort offers a hospitality suite- which you must book in advance- to tidy up in before you fly home. Warning- food in Maui is not cheap- you may not save by doing your own cooking.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad - a roll of the dice”
Reviews.Author: HemisphereRambler
Reviews.Content: Good luck with this one. All of the rooms are different. I reserved 6 non-smoking rooms for 6 nights. When we got there, I found out only 5 of the rooms were non-smoking. No other standard non-smoking rooms were left so I expected the staff to upgrade us to a better non-smoking room . . . they refused. Ergo, 2 people in my group did not sleep well and woke up with headaches because of the smell. They did put the two in a non-smoking standard for the next 5 evenings. My room, the person who made the reservations was adequate at best. I had not a view of the mountains, like the website said I would, but a view of the roof that covers the entryway. Plus, it was right by the washing machines and elevators. You think they would take care of someone who purchased 36 room nights from them like most other places do! Avoid 220 if you can. Otherwise, it was a pleasant experience. Very close to Lahaina, convenient parking ($7 a day), luau next door, and great views of sunset. If you have a later flight the day you check out, take advantage of their hospitality rooms. Avoid the free breakfast if you are short on time - concierge goes through a long talk on things they can sell you. 1 and a half hours on Maui for a free lame, non filling breakfast. Some people did not even get to eat because they ran out of food.

Reviews.Title: “Great View and Location, Nice Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: sledge_ams
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our stay in Maui. We stayed our first two nights in room 337 in Lahaina Shores. This was a studio accomodations with a queen size bed. We had an ocean view that was amazing. The room was adequate for our needs as a couple. Could use a bit of updating but nothing really to complain about room wise. Bed was comfortable and firm. There is a luau right next door so you will hear the drumming until about 9 pm if you stay on the east corner like we did. We did not try the pool and jacuzzi area but it was clean. We liked the convenience of being able to walk to Front Street where all the shops and restaurants are in Lahaina from our hotel. This is a major plus of this hotel. Would recommend this place, although you could probably get a vacation rental for less money per night that would be in Lahaina as well. But this has the convenience of a hotel, even though these are owner condos.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place!”
Reviews.Author: frizzboy
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Unit 433. Great views and very clean, well kept room. Close to shops/restaurants on Front St, yet quiet and secluded as well. Only negative is that the beachfront is not very functional (very limited beach area with sandy/murky water) . However, for those wishing to enjoy the surf, I would still recommend this resort as it's just a short drive away from other wonderful beaches.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Place!”
Reviews.Author: MarilynHuntsville_AL
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 days, Aug. 24-28 here. Loved it. Quiet and serene. Enjoyed the view from Ocean View lanai. Room was good with nice kitchen and bath. Loved the pool and hot tub, but not good beach. Actually went to another area to swim in ocean as the water here was dirty and could not see bottom. I don't swim where I can't see bottom. I would not stay here again for that reason, but other than that it was good and we spent so much time doing other things, that the beach didn't matter that much. Next time I go to Maui, however, I will stay at a resort that has a better beach for swimming.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly stay at Lahaina Shores...!”
Reviews.Author: Carna08
Reviews.Content: We have nothing but good things to say about this facility. We went to Maui for the first time to get married, and while we had heard great things about this hotel, it exceeded our expectations. We stayed in an oceanfront view on the 6th floor, and the view was breathtaking. Because the beach in front is fairly small, it's not that busy, so it's very peaceful to sit on the balcony and stare out at the ships, listen to the ocean. Everytime we drove back to Lahaina from touring the island, we felt so glad we were "home" because it was so quiet and relaxing there. We found everything was always clean, and we loved the staff, especially Carmen at the front desk. The concierge helped us with anything we needed as well. The pool area was lovely too - you could sit on a lounger under the plumeria trees in the grass, go for a quick swim or walk on the beach and then head for a dip in the pool. A few other bonuses: You get parking right in front of the hotel (probably a 10 second walk from the lobby compared to those big resorts in Kaanapali etc.), and as has been said in numerous reviews, the most fantastic thing is the location - you can walk up and down Front Street and shop or eat without having to take the car out. We had a beautiful wedding in Maui, and the Lahaina Shores helped us to have a beautiful honeymoon too. We will be back...!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: Marissa26
Reviews.Content: We were there on our Honeymoon and we loved the Hotel. The staff was also nice and the ocean view from the room spectacular. The room was clean and big (it was a studio), it had a good space with closet and a good size bed. The best part of staying at this Hotel is the location; we walked everyday to the restaurants and stores. We also found this Hotel very safe and we would recommend it to all my friends and relatives. We will definitely go back to Lahaina Shores

Reviews.Title: “Very funky 80s hotel with a good view”
Reviews.Author: Krissykoala
Reviews.Content: The Lahaina Shores Beach Resort has a great beach front location on Front Street, the main street with shops and restaurants in Lahaina. We were offered an oceanfront room upgrade for an additional $25/nt. when we checked in and I am so glad we did it because the ocean view balcony saved this part of our trip. Our balcony and ocean view was beautiful, but the room was NOT. Rainbow murals, framed cartoon dolphin pictures from the 1980 olympics, cheesy baskets of old fake flowers, a bed that folds out from the wall, worn and wild looking furniture, a dank smell, a LOUD airconditioner, and tons of Hawaiian pictures made our room super funky and uncomfortable. I was happy that we only booked this hotel for only the first three nights of our trip, because we then spent the next 7 days at the Grand Wailea, which was wonderful. The TV at Lahaina Shores was flat screen and quite large. If you do stay at this hotel, get the ocean view- it is more than worth it. If you do not like old, worn, funky hotels, this is not the place for you. It is definitely not a resort, it is more like a motel on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RosRox
Reviews.Content: The room that we stayed in was very nice: spacious, very nice decor, very clean, the bed is comfortable, fresh sheets and complete with everything you need: stove, sink, big refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker, etc. The staff is very friendly and efficient. The location is minutes away from shopping, grocery, and restaurants and situated along the beach shore (though water was not good to swim during our stay). I highly recommend this place for the quality and price.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE THE LAHAINA SHORES”
Reviews.Author: MnTLuv2Travel
Reviews.Content: We first stayed at this hotel for our honeymoon in 2005, and fell in love with this hotel. We stayed at the hotel again in February 2008, and fell in love with it all over again. The location of this hotel is just outstanding. It is located in Lahaina, and just down the street from the main town. It is also located oceanfront, with fantastic views of the ocean or the mountains, depending on which side of the hotel your room is on. I recommend requesting a room on the third floor or higher, for the great views. The rooms are either one-bedrooms or studios, with kitchenettes. It's a great way to save a little money, by having coffee in the morning in the room, and buying food at a store nearby, and having meals in the hotel room, overlooking the ocean or the mountains. The front desk staff is friendly and helpful, for the most part. We did have contact with one staff member who wasn't so friendly, but her co-workers made up for her with their help and enthusiasm. Bottom line - the location is fantastic, with nearby shopping, the beach, and snorkeling. The rooms are spacious and clean, and the kitchenettes are great to have on vacation. We will always stay here when we visit Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Unit 501 Lahaina Shores Beach Resort.. afraid to let this secret out :)”
Reviews.Author: bergadon25
Reviews.Content: First and Foremost... We have visited Maui before and stayed at Lahaina Shores Beach Resort. We LOVED the PERFECT Front Street location in Lahaina town, however our room wasn't outstanding. It wasn't terrible by any means, just hadn't been updated since (what looked like) the 70's. At the time, that wasn't a big deal, but for our honeymoon, we wanted something more. After some research, I found a unit at this resort privately rented out through the owner and a company the owner uses to manage their property called "Chase 'N Rainbows". The unit we rented out THIS time was unit #501. You could look at their website: http://www.lahainasunsets.com/ to see their pics and info, and even though the site I saw above took my breath away, pictures could not do justice to what I witnessed when I opened the door for the first time... not to sound cheesy, but I literally got teary-eyed. It was amazing! The VIEW from ANY area in the condo was breathtaking. The lanai stretched from the corner of the bedroom alongside the entire wall to the end of the corner of the living area wall. There was a seperate mountain/oceanview lanai alongside the kitchen/eating area. If you opened the sliding glass doors, turned on the fan and closed the screen door, you could hear waves crashing and feel the most amazing ocean breeze. A perfect view of Lana'i was directly facing you. The bathroom was even great and had the cutest shower area (you can see the photo...won't waste time with bathroom reviews:)..) The kitchen was fully stocked with anything (besides groceries.. we stopped at Down to Earth in Kahalui immediately after picking up our rental car for FABULOUS "health" food and delicious local produce) we needed to cook with... pots, pans, dishes, paper towels, fridge, freezer, blender, microwave, stove top..... There was also a TV (like you need that on Maui) and sitting area with a filled bookshelf and desk with IA ($9 /day or $40 per week, i think) As for the bedroom itself, besides the indescribable view, I am not a good person to rate the comfort of a bed- it was better than most, but my husband is the manager of a mattress store and home is ALWAYS better than away... there was a desk, chair and LOTS of storage space. Besides our gorgeous home-away-from-home's room itself, the location of Lahaina Shores it more than perfect (unless you like the "convienience" of a resort complex). It is next door to the 505 Front Street Shops that houses 2 of the best restaurants on Maui- I'o and Pacific'o. Also a well-known luau "Feast at Lele" several art galleries, a Whaler's General Store (that got alot of our business during our stay) and several smaller cafes and restaurants that we didn't have a chance to try. The other shops and restaurants along Front Street are a pleasant stroll away. We didn't venture out to other areas for dinner simply because Front Street Lahaina had so much to offer and we didn' teven have to get into our car. You name it, we ate there.... (I will review those seperately) There are so many shops to check out which became a nightly activity- strolling Front Street as well as making a stop at "Scoops" an ice cream shop at the "end" of Front Street that serves Lapperts ice cream- The Lahaina Harbor is also very close to Lahaina Shores Beach Resort. This is where many of the tours depart from. If you have any questions, I don't mind to answer them.. we LOVED our 12 day stay in paradise and WHEN (not if) we return, we will again stay in room 501!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hit and miss”
Reviews.Author: hawaiigal_8
Reviews.Content: Lahaina Shores is a hit-and-miss proposition. I've had good and bad experiences here. In 2007, we stayed at unit 615, which was a beautiful and well-kept oceanfront unit. We absolutely loved it. However, the next year, that unit wasn't available, so we stayed in unit 637, a corner unit. That unit was smaller (we knew it going in), but we figured it had a wraparound lanai, which seemed a bonus. However, that unit hasn't been updated in years -- the cabinets are all crooked and almost falling off. The kitchen utensils were in bad shape. We had to call maintenance twice -- first, the a/c didn't work and also because the closet doors were stuck and we couldn't open them (and in a small unit you definitely need to stash the luggage somewhere). They did fix both the a/c and closet doors. The only saving grace was that this unit overlooks a luau next door, and each night we got a free show. Otherwise, the grounds are well-kept, the condo is very quiet and laid back and very central to Lahaina. However, for our next stay, we'll probably go elsewhere -- that last room turned us off.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: KELLYGIRL77
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at this hotel. We had a corner room 537 on the ocean side. Although we did not spend a lot of time in the room, it was well worth the view. The Lele Luau is held each night right next door and we were able to see it and hear it from both balconys off our room which was nice. The room and decor was very basic. It was nice to have kitchenette to keep drinks cool and snacks.The staff was very tenative and it is keep very clean. It's great that food/shops are in walking distance. I high recommend the restuarants Pacifico and IO right next door.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Lahaina Shores”
Reviews.Author: mmarti3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Lahaina Shores for a week. We booked through VRBO and got a great deal, especially for Maui. We stayed 4 days in a room with a mountain view. The room wasn't fancy, but had everything we needed for our stay. After a night in Hana, we returned to Lahaina Shores and stayed in a room with an ocean view. It was nice to wake up with a view of the ocean and pool every morning. It was great having a gate from the garden to the beach. When we tired of the beach, the pool and hottub were there to enjoy. In addition, everyone working there was very friendly and made us feel right at home. MK at the expedia desk helped us out tremendously in booking our activities. She knows everything happening on the island and we are greatful for her help. Lahaina shores was the perfect place for us, right in the middle of town with shops and restaurants a stones throw away. We are already planning a return trip and would definitely stay at Lahaina shores again.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Accomadations”
Reviews.Author: MaureenL2008
Reviews.Content: I didn't expect much from Lahaina Shores & I wasn't dissapointed. The condo faciliaty is old, but clean & with freindly staff. The location is great; right on the water & just a few minutes walk to great shops & restuarants. Paying for parking was worth every penny. If you're looking for luxury, this ain't it. It's basic accomadations. What we didn't spend on a ritzy resort, we spent having a lot of fun on Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, relaxing place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Jules99
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights in January and loved it. Coming from the noise and bustle of Waikiki, this hotel was an oasis of calm. If you love big soulless resorts with lots of activities and facilities then this isn't the hotel for you. It's got old fashioned charm and is relatively small. It's only a few minutes walk from the centre of Lahaina with loads of restaurants to choose from and has the beach right outside. The beach itself is quite narrow and probably not the most picturesque in Hawaii but the setting is still lovely. We stayed in the penthouse - was very spacious, 2 bathrooms, a kitchen, bedroom and lounge and a lanai stretching all along the front side with a great view over the sea and the neighbouring island. Was a lovely place to relax for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Great balcony view!”
Reviews.Author: sf213
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in an ocean view studio at the Lahaina Shores Beach Resort and had a pleasant time. Our room had a balcony with a beautiful view of the ocean and palm trees. We'd open the balcony doors in the morning and just listen to the waves - it was so calm and relaxing. We were on a higher floor, so didn't have any issues with noise, as described in some other reviews. Our room had a little kitchenette and was pretty spacious. Parking was extra and the parking garage is a little yucky, but this didn't bother us. We didn't spend much time in the parking garage. The hotel is within walking distance from the shops and restaurants in Lahaina, which was convenient. This is not a luxury hotel, but it's a good value in a great little spot with awesome balcony views!

Reviews.Title: “Home in the Islands”
Reviews.Author: MauiBoi
Reviews.Content: Resort lobby is beautiful, the perfect ocean view we had. Whales were right in front of our room 4 days of the 7 days. Room was nice but needs a little touch up, the maids were clean and paid attention to detail. Front desk staff friendly and helpful but I could not understand the middle age women who could not speak english very good. Other than that this resort feels like a home in the islands.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: cousin310
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in Feb for our 40th anniversary and it was excellent. We were suppose to arrive at 330 pm but due to weather on the flights didnt get there til 11 pm We are SMOKERS ya I know. We had requested a smoking room but did not get one and I told the desk clerk that and he said let me work on it overnight and the next day we had a SMOKING room. Its right in the middle of everything and we walked as parking is a premium in Lahaina. Read several reviews before me and we parked at the 505 (those of u that been there will knw what im talking about) and it was 29 bucks for 6 days hey get over it!! And one said noise we have stayed in Waikiki 4 times and u want noise go over there!! Rooms were nice maids very friendly and will do anything for you (almost) haha Beach is a stones throw away Cant say more trying to book it for 2009 right now but they only go out 330 days so will have to wait til next month.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good stay at Lahaina Shores”
Reviews.Author: KayinCal
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Lahina Shores the week of Jan. 13-19, 2008. We were in a studio unit with an ocean view. The resort has a very nice entrance and impressive lobby. The surrounding neighborhood is a little seedy, though. The resort is located within easy walking distance to Old Town Lahaina where there are many shops and restaurants. The white railed bannisters at each lanai look quaint from a distance, but there's some serious paint peeling going on. Paying extra for parking was annoying; it should be included in the room price. Extra annoying is that the parking garage smelled like a dumpster. Our room (#215) had a beautiful view of the ocean. However, it was located right over the pool and Jacuzzi, so there was a noise problem for anyone who wanted to retire before 10 PM. Even after that hour, the resort's maintenance crew made a racket by dragging the plastic chairs across the cement floor. Before sunrise, the maintenance crew would be out there again, hosing down the area and making more noise. The furnishings of our room were quite nice and well-maintained, although I found it odd that the floor board trim was missing. Unfortunately, there is no dishwasher in this unit, so my vacation included washing dishes. The first time I left dishes in the sink, planning on washing up at the end of the day, the maid squirted a large amount of dish detergent into each bowl, glass, and mug and left. (One such squirt would have sufficed for a whole sink full of dishes.) It took me forever to rinse away all the bubbles that resulted. The maid blew her tip with that stunt. The maid service was a little hit-and-miss anyway -- mildew on the tub's tile, dirty doorknobs, sticky countertop, etc. I would recommend this resort to anyone who didn't mind a place that isn't brand new but still a good value. I would also suggest to anyone that they try for a higher floor to escape the noise, especially over the pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Accomodations - definately go back”
Reviews.Author: shawnastan
Reviews.Content: This condo provides all the amenities needed! I had wanted an ocean view when I started my search, but found the mountain views WONDERFUL. The 2 block walk to Lahaina made the location so nice for our trip. The condo was well furnished, clean and spacious - made this trip wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Keep coming back”
Reviews.Author: Mauigramma
Reviews.Content: This was the third time we have stayed at Lahaina Shores. My husband and I love Maui, we also love the resort. The mountain view was breathtaking the first time we were there in Jan. 2000, but after that, we have always gotten the ocean view. It costs more but it is more than worth the extra money. We are on our way back in March '08' for our 35th wedding anniversary. We wanted to celebrate in our favorite place. The staff is friendly, the rooms are clean, and you have everything you need in the room. The lanai is one of my favorite parts of the whole stay. We get up in the morning and have our coffee on the lanai. It is a perfect way to start your day. I cant wait to come back!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: shona10
Reviews.Content: We loved the condo 706, it fit our needs for a family get away. The furniture was confortable. Loved the bed. The bonus was the laundry room. This made thing nice when traveling with an infanct. Tom was very helpful with making our reservations. Grounds include pool, jacuzzi, BBQâ€™s. Excellent shopping is available at nearby 505 Front Street Shopping Center, which offers award-winning restaurants, shops, and exciting nightlife. We would stay here again. John and Shona Bernal

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved Penthouse 706”
Reviews.Author: BigBearGeish
Reviews.Content: My daughters and I checked in to Penthouse 706 and walked in to the most beautiful, spacious place we have ever stayed on Maui. Everything in the condo was perfect. The furniture was beautiful and comfortable. The bedroom was gorgeous and there was more than ample closet/storage space for a full family. The bathrooms were well designed and we loved that there was a laundry room right in the condo. The state of the art kitchen was a delight to cook in. I had my morning Kona coffee every morning out on the lanai and watched the sun come up over the mountains. We walked into Lahaina every day. While we had a car we didn't really need it as we were so close to everything we wanted to see and do in Lahaina. The owner Tom Myers was wonderful to deal with and I booked our stay directly through him. He was easy to contact and more than willing to correct anything that might have gone wrong with our trip. although nothing went wrong. I have stayed on Maui 5 times now and this has been my favorite place to stay. I can't wait until we can return and enjoy the Penthouse again. Our ten day stay wasn't long enough!

Reviews.Title: “Bad News for Non-smokers / why do we pay for parking? / young guests”
Reviews.Author: canyondrive
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a trip to Maui. We stayed at Lahaina Shores for the whole time. We were able to stay at a cheaper rate much less than $200 a night, after a little searching. Location is not bad. It's the lower end of Lahaina so you can leave to other places like Kihei and Kafului in the morning without too much traffic and coming back. It's a little too long walk to completely tour around the old town Lahaina though. First thing surprised us was we had to pay for parking each night. $7 a night. Come on! What else can we get around in Maui? They should at least grant 1 parking spot per room, after paying around $1000 a week to stay. The cart insert for parking gate is on the opposite side of the road, which made getting into the lot a little awkward. We stayed on oceanfront studio. I loved to leave the window open (w/ screen) and listen to the waves and fall asleep. However, almost every night we had to shut the window in the middle of the night, because of some idiot people smoking in the balcony on adjacent units. Wind from ocean pushes smoke back to the building if somebody smokes on the balcony. Hello? this is 21st century! Smoking is so lame! Especially when people break the fire law and smoke within 20 feet from the building. Apparently each unit is owned privately and resort manager can't do anything as far as people smoking on the balcony. Our room was non-smoking, but it doesn't mean a whole a lot if I have to smell smoke every night. They said there are hotels in Maui that has strict non-smoking policy. I guess I'm not staying in this one, again. Other reason I stayed at this place was because it is a condo. However, the kitchen equipment was cheapest grade tools you can buy at walmart. Knives were so dull (looked new) and pots and pans burned like hell every time. Almost every night I heard other units having get together party of some sort - sounded pretty young. I also smelled pot in the hallway a couple of times. Not my kind of guests I want to stay with. Well, I guess u get what u pay for, for less than 200 a night this season in Maui it starts to get a little low-class.

Reviews.Title: “Lahaina Shores Room 624”
Reviews.Author: Kidney20A
Reviews.Content: Jim is the owner of the mountain side unit which is on the six floor middle of the building, and I booked through him via the net. The unit is basic, and I guess could use a slight updating (According to my wife) but it is very very clean. This updating thing was not a factor to me since I was not in Maui to spend time in my Hotel except to sleep and have a breakfast. Jim was great to rent from he extended us a little bit since our plane was late plus the price is very competitive. Lahaina Shores is a great place to stay, it is located near everything you would want, the beach outside is not really a swimming beach, but it does have great surfing near by, along with super safe snorkeling. The town of Lahaina is about a 10 mins walk and has numerous markets ( Food land/Safeway) and all levels of retail stores and eating places to pick up whatever you need. (Look for the happy hour at the moose 3-6p everyday) All the super Maui beaches are within 10-40 mins by car. And if you don't like the first one you go to another close by. There are many more near by all with different characteristic to them. Jim save that room for us we shall be back for trip number five to this great location. Pick up a copy of Maui Revealed it is the must have guide book for Maui, and you will see all the people in the know carrying the blue book PS see my note about rental see in Maui. Aloha (Waves clam snorkeling boggy boarding ECT...) Kam 1/ 2/ 3 in Kehia where my favorites.

Reviews.Title: “Very Handy Location”
Reviews.Author: Boilermaker_91
Reviews.Content: Lahaina Shores is an older property and it surely shows. It really needs some updating and redecorating. Our ocean view studio was OK. About what you'd expect from a 70's era property. The few looking toward Lanai was absolutely fantastic. We found the staff moderately friendly with a very lovely and extremely helpful lady down at the Expedia desk. Be sure to book your excursions through MK Williams. What a sweetheart! With all that said, it was a great place for our home base on Maui. Numerous restaurants, a Foodland grocery store, many many shops, even several churches are all within walking distance. Lahaina Harbor to pick up one of the excursion boats is even within walking distance. Although it is 1.5 miles down front street, the Old Lahaina Luau is still within walking distance if you are physically able. We had a fabulous time in Lahaina. Glad we stayed there rather than the generic resort areas up in Kaanapali or Kihei.

Reviews.Title: “Location is great and that's about it. Unfriendly staff, no room service”
Reviews.Author: bice710
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Lahaina Shores for 2 nights in September. On the phone they were nice when we booked our room, but when we got to the front desk they were pretty unfriendly and didn't seem to care too much about customer service. The rooms are very old and run down. The view, however, is spectacular...if you're going to stay here you must upgrade to an ocean view. Otherwise you'll be facing the parking lot! There's a full kitchen with refrigerator, though we didn't use it. The kitchen and bathroom were old but kept pretty clean and seemed fine. Beds are pretty hard and the bedspread looked old, cheap and not so clean...we threw ours on the floor rather than sleep with it. The location is just off the main drag in Lahaina so that was perfect, as we wanted to be close to town. It's the closest hotel if you want to be within walking distance of the restaurants and shopping. The pool was very nice and clean. There is beach access, but it's not the best beach there...very shallow beach and the water was a little murky. It was our wedding anniversary, so they told us they would give us a complimentary bottle of champagne. When we arrived back from our lovely dinner and sunset sail, a warm bottle of champagne was sitting on the countertop. They couldn't even put it in the fridge 5 feet away, and I had left a NICE tip. They also turned OFF the music I had left on for when we got back! Apparently they don't have room service...not even ice. I actually brought the champagne back to them and said to forget it...not that I'm trying to be ungrateful but I'd rather they hadn't done anything than something that dumb. The front desk guy didn't really care and just grabbed the bottle and said "ok." Oh well!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place For Longer Stay”
Reviews.Author: MarylandLabLady
Reviews.Content: AAA booked our rooms for us, and we did some moving around on the islands, so we didn't stay in many places for more than one night. We were only at Lahaina Shores for one night, but if we were going to stay in that area for more than one night, this would be the place to stay. The beach is right outside, so we could sit out on our lanai and enjoy the view. It was gorgeous! The beach in this area is not swimmable, but it's great for a beach stroll, sunsets, or just sitting on the lanai and hearing the waves. Lanais are a good size and have post railings, so you don't have to crane your neck to see above a concrete wall if you are seated. The kitchen area is fully outfitted, making it a great place for a longer stay. There is a full-sized fridge for anyone who wants to get groceries and save some money by eating in for some meals. There is a pool & a hot tub. We were planning to drive the road to Hana, and we were told at the desk that we could borrow a DVD of the drive if we wanted to learn more about what is on the route. We had a tour book, so this was not necessary, but it's wonderful that they have such things available and take the time to find out if they can help with the rest of your trip in some way. The resort is within walking distance of the town, which is a nice feature, as parking in Lahaina is difficult.

Reviews.Title: “Idyllic stay in Paradise.”
Reviews.Author: ChrisofCarmel
Reviews.Content: Lahaina Shores was the answer to a lot of searching for a place to relax and really enjoy Maui. This was our first stay at this grand old colonial hotel, and we made the commitment to return twice a year and made our reservations while we were there. We have stayed in several sites on Maui, but have never had a more beautiful view as we did from our comfortable 4th floor room. The staff were all really friendly and helpful. The underground garage kept our car cool when we took to the road. The proximity to the little town of Lahaina was an easy walk several times a day. Early in the mornings, we walked in the surf, which was a few feet outside the lobby of the hotel. Watching the sun kiss the island of Lanai at sunrise was a special delight. We will return in January and again in June of 2008.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Lahaina Shores”
Reviews.Author: Jstylist
Reviews.Content: Went through condominum rentals hawaii to rent two condos here at Lahaina and we were very pleased with our accomodations. The view we had was excellent. The condo was in good condition. It needed a few updates but everything was in good order. The staff at the front desk was very friendly. And the concierge breakfast was a great way to learn about Maui if you have never been there before. The condo was in an excellent location to town. About a 10 minute walk to town or the harbor where a lot of the excursions take off from. Can't say enough about the location it was really great. I would definetly go back to Lahaina Shores/ a home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “penthouse #6 at Lahaina Shores. AWESOME!!!”
Reviews.Author: rprofancik
Reviews.Content: Hello. Our family stayed in maui for the 4th of july week and stayed at Lahaina Shores because we wanted a condo with a kitchen. We contacted the owners of the condo directly and saved a lot. The place is beatiful. It isn't an ocean view, but the view of the mountains from the lanai is super, great for a morning coffee and sunrise or an afternoon cigar, Make sure you have plenty f film in your camera. The unit is just recently decorated and looks like it came out of a magazine. We wanted to save some money so we shopped at safeway (make sure you go to the customer service counter and get a shopping card to use instantly and save more), which is right up the street at the northern end of lahaina, and we ate dinners in the condo. It has a full kitchen with everything you need. We also packed lunches for the daily snorkeling and sightseeing trips. It was right next to town for shopping and other ventures from the marina (parasiling, snorkeling, deep sea fishing, etc.). The concierge at Lahain shores was more than helpful in planning our week. The hotel was a little more relaxed than some of the other big places to stay, very clean hotel and friendly people, but it had all the necessities, closness to shopping and fun, outside gas grills, smaller but noncrowded pool, quiet beach, good snorkeling right from shore, etc. If you want to contact the owner directly he has an e-mail and website; email : lahainacondo@yahoo.com website : [--] You acn also contact me at rprofancik@hotmail.com

Reviews.Title: “Just What We Were Looking For”
Reviews.Author: LahainaOwl
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed in Maui for 10 days. We spent 6 days at the Westin Pool & Spa Resort and 4 at Lahaina Shores - Penthouse #6. I'm not sure about the other rooms there but this penthouse was perfect for us. We all agreed, we wish we had stayed there longer. Not only was it half the price, but the room was 3-4 times larger than our room at the Westin and completely remodeled. The kitchen was nicer than mine at home, with granite & all new appliances. There was a comfortable king size bed and sofa bed for the kids. The 50" plasma TV and DVD player was perfect for late nights watching movies. We also loved the clean, nicely tiled bathrooms, one of which had a double shower. I thought I might be disappointed with the view of the mountains, but it was beautiful.
