I read some of the other reviews which mentioned the pool. To be honest, coming from the Westin, it didn't compare. If you're looking for a fabulous pool with water slides, this may not be the place for you. However, the pool was fine for us - It was an ordinary pool, but it was clean & NOT CROWDED. This you won't find at the Westin. It was also literally a few steps from the beach, which was narrow, but nice and also not very crowded. My favorite part about the place was its proximity to the town of Lahaina. We walked a half mile to town every night, which meant not having to hassle with or pay for parking. The restaurants and night life in Lahaina are fabulous. Great for families or singles. Our favorite place to eat was an inexpensive little place called Pasta Penne. Not much ambiance but the food was great, especially for picky kids. All in all, we would highly recommend this condo. To rent it, contact the owners, Tom & Ann Myers at [--]. It was definitely a good value which is hard to find in Hawaii.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: LovesWarmWeather
Reviews.Content: We loved Lahaina. Nice town, lots of great shops. Restaurants throughout Hawaii are expensive. We stayed at this small resort...with full kitchen. Very handy to keep leftovers which we occassionaly ate for lunch. We bought milk, juice, cereal to have on a few mornings. Our unit was a studio...but very spacious. All new kitchen/bath. Clean throughout (most important). Right near 505 Front Street...very convenient, and not at all noisy. We parked in the garage next door...no complaints as we had read from others (not smelly). Overall, we would return and recommend to anyone. We also took a Blue Hawaiian Helicoper ride. Great experience. Because I am prone to air sickness, we opted for the one hour trip. This prevented us from going over the live volcano. I also took dramamine (good thing). Lahaina is on the opposite end of the island if you want to see the volcano..more than a 2 hour drive one way. Something to keep in mind.

Reviews.Title: “Our Honeymoon Home Base”
Reviews.Author: Woodward85
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our honeymoon in Maui and had lodgings here. We had a 6th floor; 2nd from the end that had an absolute gorgeous ocean view. The rooms were clean with basic daily maid service. The room had a full kitchen and was spacious. On some mornings, we would have breakfast at lanai and watch the sunrise. The pool area and overall grounds are average. It's not a place where you would "hang-out" unlike the other large resorts. Instead, it's a good value condo that has gorgeus views and walking distance from downtown Lahaina. It was nice not having to find parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time, Great Location and Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: robcamacho
Reviews.Content: Just like many of the other people who reviewed this property I was a little concerned due to the amount of negative comments. Me and my girlfriend had a wonderful time at this perfectly located resort. The Room: Let me start by saying this is not the typically resort quality room. It reminds me a lot of the older condos that are available along the California coast. Older appliances, older carpet and tile but clean. For the price of the Ocean View room is exceeded expectations. If you are looking for the five star decorations and new pillow top matresses do not stay here (Stay at one of the Wailea resorts). The Location: If you have never stayed on Maui you are going to want to spend a lot of time on Front street for shopping, eating and hanging out. If you have stayed on Maui before you know what an awesome place Front Street is and for both of these scenarios this resort is perfect. It is right on Front Street and close to everything. It is not very noisy as some of the reviews have stated but you certainly want an Ocean View and as high in the building as possible. Things to do: You have to do the following if you are in Maui. The Maui Magic trip to Molokini was an outstanding snorkeling trip but it takes the long way to the snorkel site (if you are looking to snorkel more find a different one). The Road to Hana is another must for 10-20 bucks you can get a CD that guides your trip and it is worth the small investment. Eat at KIMOs - this place is right on Front Street and by far is the best place I have ever eaten (the steak and seafood is remarkable and the service is great). With drinks you are looking at $30-50 per person. The Maui Princess Dinner cruise is also great -the food wasnt great but the view and people you will meet are well worth the trip. I would highly recommend doing any type of excursions early on your trip as you may meet some people you would like to hang out with during your stay. If you end up staying at this awesome resort please Tell Dan and Carmin at the front desk I said hello. They were awesome and took care of everything we needed (not that a lot came up but they sure were helpful)

Reviews.Title: “Ocean view room a must....”
Reviews.Author: LuvnLifeSB
Reviews.Content: We were booked for a "mountain view" room, but when we got to this beautiful location right on the beach we immediately asked to see an "ocean view" room. We went and looked at both. We saw the mountain view room first and was ok. But then saw the ocean view room and immediately our spirits were lifted and practically ran back down to the desk and upgraded. They charged us $60.00 dollars more per night, but believe me it was worth it! I think you would be disappointed overall if you don't stay in one of their ocean view rooms. Their is nothing fancy or new about this hotel. The grounds were kept very clean and nice. The hotel is within walking distance to great restaurants, general stores, and more shopping than one can imagine. There is nothing better than watching the sunrise and the sunset from your private lana'i.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place - Lahaina Shore”
Reviews.Author: Serp
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Lahaina Shores from March 28-April 4/07 and we were happy with our stay. When we first checked in they had us on the 2 floor and our view was not that great and we were close to the 505 Front Street (which was a little loud in the evening) - the next morning we asked if there were any rooms available on a higher floor and they moved us too 621 - very nice room - amazing ocean front view - the sunsets were amazing..nothing better than sitting on you lanai have a glass of wine and watching the sunset. The hotel is older but very clean and the staff are wonderful. We would definitely stay there again..

Reviews.Title: “Great deal--beautiful room!”
Reviews.Author: latte
Reviews.Content: I am surprised when I read reviews that complain about this property and Lahaina, in general. I stayed in the same unit as "avianman" and couldn't have been more pleased with the accommodations! I was a bit apprehensive since I had booked the unit from an ad on Craigslist, but was only pleased. The unit was recently renovated by its owners, Tom and Ann Meyers, (lahainacondo@yahoo.com ) with beautiful tile floors, granite countertops and stainless steel appliances in the kitchen and a wonderful shower in the master. The lanai is huge and faces the mountains. Initially I was very bummed that the view was mountains instead of ocean, but they really are beautiful and since you are looking at the ocean all day long, it really didn't turn out to be a negative at all. The decor in our condo matched the "Tommy Bahama" style of the lobby and is very nice. The pool area is clean and nice, and although it is small, our kids had a great time playing in it for hours a day. The best part of this property, in my opinion, is that you can go from the lobby to the pool in 10 steps and 10 more and you are ON THE BEACH! We had some in our group that wanted to be on the beach all the time and others that wanted the pool, so it was very convenient that it wasn't a couple football fields away. The beach is narrow, but you don't need a large beach for the amount of people that are generally there. We were never crowded on the beach--and we were there during spring break. A big plus was sitting on the beach at 8:45 and seeing the fire dancers at The Feast at Lele's right next door--about 20 feet from us! We went to a cheaper luau (kids) but this one looks beautiful! This property is within easy walking distance to the busy downtown area--which we did every night for dinner. There are also wonderful restaurants right next door (IO and PacificO) if you want more expensive seafood/asian. We parked in the outside lot for a few dollars a day--because our SUV seemed too tall for the parking garage. Back to our condo: I can only speak for our condo (penthouse #6) but it was beautiful and I would definitely stay there again. The common areas of the property are very well maintained and the staff was very pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A fully-depreciated operation...with a great view”
Reviews.Author: leonc1234
Reviews.Content: The good news - great view on the ocean side. You're right on the water. Very prompt, friendly service, clean. The queen-size bed was decent. Good location, just outside of Lahiana (more on this below). The bad - this place is old. The ceilngs are low, the fixtures are old, the sinks don't drain well. Ancient cieling fan, oldish furniture. No wireless internet...need a physical connection and they charge by the day. Thank God for my Blackberry! The bathroom has this weird configuration--the toilet and shower share the same, oddly slopped tile floor. Yech. Don't walk in there if you've had more than a drink, it'll take a minute to find your "sea legs"! The pillows were not comfortable; they were the kind that sort of lump up and are too hard. We were also really disappointed that we couldn't get a king bed...had the impression that they were either not available or few and far between. For 240+ per night, we expected better. As for the location; we were very, very glad that it wasn't right in the very heart of Lahaina. We hadn't been to that part of Maui for many years and it's gotten absolutely nuts, crowd wise. The cruise ships now portage into town during the days and what was already a crowded, touristy area is worse...much worse, IMO. The town is just full of crowded, overpriced shops that appeal to tourists. I can find this kinda scene 10 minutes away in Hermosa Beach anytime I want it. Granted this is Maui we're talking about, but we still felt like this was not a good value. Lahaina is nowhere worth seeing or staying unless you're into overpriced tchachkies, hamburgers and crowd-scenes. Feh!

Reviews.Title: “BEST deal on Maui, hands down!”
Reviews.Author: avianman
Reviews.Content: Lahaina shores isn't for people who want to stay at the Hyatt - it wasn't meant to be. The rooms are nearly all different due to the fact that they are individually owned and the decoration is up to the owner. Because of this, online reviews can be VASTLY different, and you could easily get the wrong impression! We stayed in the penthouse unit. It was graced with granite countertops, tile floor throughout, luxury bath/shower in the bedroom and an additional bath/shower in the main hallway. The kitchen is full service (HUGE COST SAVINGS with a grocery store very nearby) with all new appliances as of January 07. The 50" plasma TV was great for a late night movie. The view from the Lanai (facing the mountains) was just awesome, and the sunrise takes your breath away. The Lanai (porch, for us mainlanders!) by itself was larger than the suite we stayed in at the Hyatt Regency the week before! The owner has some outdoor games, rafts and even some basic snorkel gear available for the tenants of this unit. Since Lahaina shores is easily the tallest building in Lahaina, the view from the penthouse unit is unobstructed. We got our unit directly from Mr. Tom Myers ( lahainacondo@yahoo.com ) and it is the only one I can reccomend, but I GUARANTEE I will stay again. Although rates are subject to change, we were able to book the room for less than half of what a double cost at the Hyatt, and this room if it were at the Hyatt would cost AT LEAST $1200/night! Yes, it is THAT good. Remember, you must contact Mr. Myers directly in order to get his unit. The town of Lahaina is within easy walking distance, even for the older traveller, and offers plenty of reasonably priced dining, as well as unreasonably price offerings for those who like to throw money at things (seems to be a lot of those in Hawaii...). Lahaina shores has a protected, but small beach that is clean and perfect for sunning. The water just off the beach is quite warm due to its shallow nature and protected sea wall. A quick swim offshore with my snorkel gear revealed beautiful butterfly fish, tobys and pufferfish - even a decent sized eel! (this is WAAY beyond where you would swim if you werent snorkeling) There are a lot of smooth stones in the water, so water shoes are reccomended. Because it is protected from the waves, it is calm (almost glass calm) 90% of the time, and is perfect for floating leasurly on a raft. There is a small pool and hot tub as well. There is also a activity service. The penthouse has protected, indoor parking available for a few dollars a day in the adjacent building. The staff was very, very nice. There were no issues of cleanliness or critters. Renovation was complete when we went in January, and the hotel is beautiful. Kaanapali is a short drive up the beach, not more than 10 minutes. Please contact me if you have questions and Ill answer them. How anyone could give this place a bad review is beyond me. (Unless you wanted the Ritz - but then, well, stay at the Ritz - but your room wont be as nice, and it will be 3 times the price!) I also have some photos of the unit I stayed in that I can email you.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: VictoriaTravellers
Reviews.Content: We stayed in unit 322 for one night because the condo we rented in Kahana was not available the day of our arrival. The unit stank of stale cigarette smoke and looked like it was straight out of the 1950â€™s. No renovations here in a long time (if ever). I couldnâ€™t imagine spending my vacation in that unit. We arrived at 10 pm and left at 9 am the next day, with my wallet $250 lighter for the privilege. The Lahaina Shores complex consists of individually owned units, so your experience might be different. We rented our unit through the onsite management and we didnâ€™t know until we checked in which unit they would assign us. If you want to stay there I suggest asking a lot of detailed questions about the unit youâ€™ll get. The only reason to stay at a place like this is if your idea of a Maui vacation is hanging around the bars in Lahaina. The beach and pool area are pretty dismal. For the same money (or less) you can get a condo on a really nice beach in North Kaanapali or Kahana.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for nightlife”
Reviews.Author: vacationloverSd
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and I stayed at Lahaina Shore February 22-28th, 2007. We got a studio Oceanfront room, equipped with fridge, microwave, stove, coffee pot and coffee, hair dryer, iron & board, pots, glasses and utensils. The room (#235) was clean and comfy but probably could use some updates in decor. The lanai was nice but kinda smelled like old, wet cigarettes to me (my husband did not think it did.) Our daughter slept on a rollaway but it was very comfy and clean. (some friends of ours stayed in a room that had a murphy bed. they were NOT impressed.) The view from our lanai was breathtaking and we could see whales, ships and the like. I did request a room higher-up but they were full and could not accomodate this request, which I understand. Each condo is individually owned and this accounts for the different decors and room standards. Housekeeping was wonderful and very, very accomodating. They were the sweetest people. Front desk staff weren't rude but certainly weren't very friendy.(We stayed during the owner's convention and this might have played a part in this.) I was definitely not impressed with the activity desk. When we went down to clarify some things about an excursion we had booked the agent sighed and asked," Didn't so-and-so explain ANY of this to you? Okay, here we go again...." I was quite taken aback for when I spend $250 for dinner cruise, I feel I should be able to ask questions if I need to. LS has a wonderful pool and spa. The area was kept very clean but did not open until 9am, which was a pain (especially with an eight year old.) Lahaina Shores' beach is not a beachgoers beach. It is rocky and shallow. I wouldn't advise going in without water shoes as some of the rocks are kinda sharp. It's a great beach for sunset walks but not recommended for beach activity, per se. We took a five-minute drive to Kaanapaali Beach every day and used the beach right in front of the Royal Lahaina (whose staff were wonderful, accomodating and gracious, even to us non-guests.) We recommend this beach for those that want to use the beach for swimming and sunning. We also advise that you drive to a grocery store (we went to Smarts) and load up on beer, snacks, sandwich stuff, etc. This will save you loads. Prices at the groc stores were not at all outrageous. We also bought a collapsible cooler to take to the beach with us that came in SO handy on a number of occasions. LS is right at the end of Front Street, where all the shops and a great deal of resturaunts are located. It was a great location for us, because we could just walk back to the hotel after dinner and drinks. Not far down the street is the famed Banyan Tree, which is cool. Parking is very convienent...there is a parking garage right next to the hotel and we never had any problem finding a spot in the first or second rows closest to the hotel. It is $6 a day and usually had a parking attendant present. Next door to LS are some resturaunts and Feast at Leles. We were not at all impressed with Hecocks, the resturaunt next door. The staff were very rude. We ate a quick bite at Gaby's one night and that was enjoyable. We also ate at the Lahaina Fish Company (fantastic with a great view) and a Moose McGuillicuddy's, which was okay but did not live up to the rave reviews of our friends. Also, we had an awesome breakfast at the Pioneer Inn on Cruise Ship Day and it was fun to see the cruisers come off the ship. All of the resturaunts mentioned have very reasonable prices and good food. (Lahaina Fish Co. was a a touch on the pricey side but well worth it. Ribeyes were comparable to what you would spend here in SD. I had a wonderful Reisling with swordfish. Delicious.) Maui is the most beautiful place I've ever had the pleasure to visit. If we go back, we probably won't be choosing Lahaina Shores because of the dismal beach opportunities but it is a perfectly fine hotel and most of the people we talked to (mostly older folks) had been coming to LS for years and years and said they love the place. If you are into the Front St. scene (shopping and art), this hotel would be the perfect location for you. We were just expecting more of a beach and it's hard to prevent that disappointment from spilling over into some of the information. Our travel agent really didn't have a clue. lessons learned.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, just beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Titchvic
Reviews.Content: Wow, we had such a fantastic time here. We booked through Maui Vacations, and we knew that each condo is privately owned so they differ massively as to how they are decorated and furnished etc. But we were not disappointed. The room was clean and spacious, and we had the ocean view we had requested. We were on the 3rd floor, and people have said that the view gets better the higher up you go. I can't vouch for that, but I certainly wouldn't want to be on the ground floor as people were constantly walking past your door to get to the pool etc. Pool and hot tub were lovely, and with the resort being right on the beach it was perfect for those romantic evening walks. Had a great time sitting on the balcony sipping wine and watching the humpback whales jumping out of the ocean while the sun went down. Just a perfect end to the honeymoon. The property is really convenient for town. We didn't hire a car and had no problems getting around and into town to find something to eat. We went to the Luau at the Hyatt as we couldn't get in at the Feast of Lele next door. Ours was great, and the sounds coming from next door sounded like fun too. Also went on the sunset dinner cruise wich was just beautiful and we have some fabulous photos. From talking to other people there it seems that a lot of people go back year after year so you'll have to book early to get a good room! But the reception desk were really helpful, the location was great and the views were amazing. We had a brilliant time and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place right on the beach”
Reviews.Author: misspokey
Reviews.Content: This is the 4th time we stayed here and was just as good as the others. It's not as fancy as others or have all the amenities as the big ones but is right on the beach, clean and comfy, and is smaller so less people to compete with for the beach and lounge chairs. If we are able to return we will certainly want to come here again.

Reviews.Title: “Must be nice without Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca537
Reviews.Content: After the first night, my daughter noticed a dozen visible bug bites on her leg. At 10AM, we immediately reported it to the Front Desk asking that they either change our Room or make an attempt to get a new Mattress. Of course it being the day after Christmas - I expected the Aloha Spirit the Islands are so fondly known for. We returned to our Room at 4PM and when I went to the Front Desk - I was told Housekeeping had already left for the day. When I mentioned I specifically had spoken to someone earlier - that person came from the back office claiming they had the mattress scrubbed down and if there are any more problems - let them know. Needless to say, my daughter slept in my bug-free bed the remainder of the visit.; refusing to take another chance. A month later - those bites are still pink spots on her leg. I would not take a chance and revisit this location again.

Reviews.Title: “Lahaina Shores is paradise”
Reviews.Author: BrumBeachLover
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Lahaina Shores for our honeymoon. We booked a condo directly with the owner through VRBO and could not have been more thrilled with the hotel when we arrived. It faces a small but pretty beach, perfect to while away the days. Just a short stroll away is the centre of Lahaina, with plenty of shops, restaurants and bars as well as the lovely harbour. A word of warning though, Maui is very laid back, and most places in Lahaina close up at about 10pm as we found one night when we tried to get a late dinner. This didn't matter to us anyway as we were quite happy to sit on our balcony overlooking the beach with views to the island of Lanai'i with a cold beer or glass of wine. The pool and hot tub at the complex are open until 10pm too, so we spent several pleasant evenings in the hot tub after dark. The only thing that Lahaina Shores could benefit from is a bar. However, due to the proximity to the town, this didn't worry us too much and we also kept our fridge well stocked. We think it was well worth paying extra to have an ocean view - it made mornings a joy to have the view of the ocean, but the rear of the property looked out over the mountains and was pretty picturesque too. We only hired a car for a couple of days to explore the rainforest on the east side of the island and drive to the top of Haleakala but there is a car park at the back of the hotel should you need it. Realistically though, unless you are going to be driving around the island the whole time, there is little need for a car. We had a wonderful time at Lahaina Shores and it was the perfect start to our honeymoon before moving on to bigger, brasher Waikiki. We would retrun there in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: lovemebab
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lahaina Shores for 3 nights. The location is perfect....right on Front street near all of the shops, bars, and food. We stayed in a privately owned condo which was reserved through Most Romantic Vacations. Other condos here are reserved either through Classic Vacations or directly through the owner. The condo we stayed in (335) was ocean view for about $200 a night and it was awesome to wake up to the ocean and watch the sunset. It was a little outdated but nice. There are also Mountain view condos which we toured. They are larger and remodeled for about the same price we paid for the ocean view. The Mountain views are also very nice. All of the condos have kitchens which is nice if you are planning to stay for a while. The pool and hot tub are nice. The crowd seems to be a little older at this resort.....so if you are looking for party party....you may want to try somewhere else. Kelly at the Expediafun concierge desk was really helpful. We booked all of our excursions through her. They are located right in the lobby. Parking is about $3.50 a day and because we had a small car we were in the "stinky" garage next door.....hold your breath. Lahaina is within driving distance of pretty much everything. We would totally stay here again....we may try the remodeled mountain view instead. We recommend you go whale watching with the Pacific Whale Foundation....they were very informative, go snorkeling at Molikini with the Mahana Nai (sp?, twin dolphins), see the theatre show Ulelena (sp?) in Lahaina, check out Kanapali beach. We did the Road to Hana and the views were amazing but this is a VERY long day....so if you don't have much time we don't recommend it. Maui is so awesome....I can't wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Base”
Reviews.Author: e26
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 2 week trip to Hawaii. Stayed 1 week in Maui and another in Kauai. In Maui, I stayed the first 4 nites at Lahaina Shores and the remaining 2 nites at the Grand Hyatt. I travelled with 2 other 20 something girls and we are all from the NYC area. We stayed from Dec. 15- Dec. 22. Weather was perfect every day for us! HOTEL: So with that said, we didn't mind staying at Lahaina Shores at all. We came to Maui to do a lot of activities so we stayed there cuz it was cheap and a good location. We moved to the Hyatt after to enjoy a luxurious hotel. So, if a lot of your days are gonna be filled up with activities out of the hotel, no need to stay anywhere that nice, which is what we did. The room we had faced the mountain view which was lovely. Every morning we could see the sun rising from the ridge of the mountain. We also rented a car to get around, and for compact cars, they direct you to park at the garage next door in the shopping area. This garage STINKS!! Thanks to other tips on tripadisor, i went to the front desk and asked to be moved to the upstairs/outdoor lot which is right outside the hotel. That lot is usually reserved for larger cars but they were nice enough to hold a spot for me for the rest of my trip. Everyone at the hotel is very nice and pleasant. The room itself was for the most part clean but nothing spectacular. I think all rooms have kitchens which incl. a large fridge, a stove, and a microwave. This was great as we bought food for breakfast to eat before we went out for the day. Honestly, we hardly spent anytime in the hotel at all. I think we only went out to the beach behind the hotel twice. The beach is okay, very small but water is clean and sand is clean. Pool is a joke but who cares when you can hop in a car and go to a big beach? LOCATION: As for location, I am really glad we stayed here cuz it was a good drive to get to places. It's about 30 min. to get to the airport (no traffic) and about 1 hr to get to South Maui. For the Haleakala sunrise drive, we left at 3 and got there by 5. For the Hana drive we left at 8 and got there by 11. To get to Northwest maui is another 30-45 min cuz there seems to be more traffic up there. Also, its very close to all the shops on Front St. so at night we would walk down Front St. for the shops and stuff. IO Restaurant is right next door and has excellent appetizers/ambience!! It's rated #1 in the island. Bamboo Grill is also next door and is like a fast food/bar place and totally sucked. Don't eat there! ACITIVITIES: -Haleaka sunrise--I LOVED IT. It was really the most beautiful thing I ever saw. I think everyone's experience will be different b/c the conditions will not be the same every day. we were really lucky and the day we went was very cloudy. It's the most beautiful when it's cloudy as the colors reflect better. We did not drive to the summit top but saw it at the overlook at the Visitors Center, which is the same as the summit anyway. Definitely cold and windy so you need to bring stuff for coverage! Flashlight helps too. -Hiked to Haleakala Crater on Sliding Trails--Hated it on the climb up but it was worth it. Can't describe it. Everything is ddead there but beautiufl and silent. Hike down to crater should take an hr but it took us 2 cuz we stoped to take a million pictures. Hike up took us 2 hrs. The change in elevation hiking down is like 1400 ft so it is hard on your lungs but anyone can do it, just try to start early right after sunrise. The trail is by the Visitors Center as well. IF you want to go down to the crater, there will a fork in the trail--one that continues onto Sliding Trail, another that takes u to the crater. If you take the LEFT you go to the crater. Even there there is another fork. Everyone always takes the wrong path (the right side) and slips/sides their way down. Stay LEFT to the big boulder rock and though you have to climb down some rocks, much easier than the right trail. -Ziplining--Definitely book in advance! it was so much fun. i was nervous at first but as soon as u leave that platform, u do feel safe in your harness and can relax and enjoy it. The last line is the longest and the 'scariest' cuz u literally fly at 40-50 mph but so much fun!! -Drive to Hana--only worth it if you're going to see Black Sand/Red sand beach. otherwise the views are nice, but nothing really spectacular. Waterfalls = stream-size water falling down the side of the mountain. Also depends if it has rained a lot or not. The drive itself is kinda fun tho--you definitely wont get bored driving cuz of all the turns and zig zags/ We got lucky and encountered zero traffic. Also being in NYC we are used to diriving in small spaces so we didnt think it was that difficult at all. I think Haleakala drive was more difficult. you HAVE to get shaved ice if you see it at the food stands on the way to Hana. Shaved ice is the best! Its like a better version of a snow cone and you can get diif flavors like guava or mango, etc. -Pacific Whale Life Foundation whale watch tour--waste of our $37. I guess i can think of it as donating money to charity. But since it was early in the season we didnt see much. When we did see whales a few times, all i saw were dots in the water. There is a rule that boats cant be 100 yrds of a whale. I dont know how far 100 yards is but it seemed to me like we were 1000 yards away. I did a boat cruise in Kauai where they dont enforce that rule and we saw whales VERY UP CLOSE--like maybe 30 ft away. BUt that was just luck. Otherwise, we also saw flying fish on the whale watch tour and that was it. I think it's better if u go in Jan/Feb. BEACHES: We beach hopped as much as we could. We drove to Polo Beach, which I think is the beach in front of Maui Prince hotel. it was nice. Clean. South Maui beaches are suppose to be the nicest ones on the island so just drive down and find one! The Maui Revealed blue book helped a lot. Everyone who goes to Hawaii uses that book. I think its more useful for maps cuz people's opinions on good/actviities will always be different but the maps helped a lot in finding beaches most tourists prob wont know about. West Maui beaches like Black Rock at Sheraton was ok. That place is best for snorkeling on West maui. We didnt have time to snorkel in South Maui but heard its the same. SHOPPING: really, buy all your souvenirs at Walmart. Its the cheapest there, and its pretty much the same stuff on the island. Walmart is right by the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Just so, so”
Reviews.Author: djr76
Reviews.Content: I was really under whelmed by this hotel. Basically the units are individually owned and rented out through the hotel. When we walked in we were really confused. We couldn't find a bedroom anywhere. We searched for our bed and finally discovered that there was a Murphy bed. The decor inside the room was really minimalistic and unattractive (typical wicker and 80â€™s aqua, turquoise combo). The only nice feature was the balcony that overlooked the ocean. The "concierge" in the lobby was really a timeshare salesperson. We sat down with her to book some activities and she kept pressuring us to go to a timeshare seminar. We told her no several times but she kept pushing. I also had in mind a snorkel trip that I wanted to go on. It was not only snorkeling but also educational. She somehow talked us out of it and booked us on a snorkel booze cruise. I was really disappointed. The hotel is really off the beaten track and we had to walk a really long way to reach the shops and restaurants. And the fact that they include â€œresortâ€� in there name is a joke, the pool was really small, we never went in it.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous view”
Reviews.Author: LittleTigerLily
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lahaina Shores for our 2 nights in Maui. First of all, it is a fantastic location if you want to stay real close to everything in Lahaina. It turned out we were even right next door to our surfing school! Our room was always clean, the staff were friendly and fantastic, and the view from our oceanfront studio was a great sight to see every morning. On our last night we sat on our balcony with microwave popcorn and some drinks, looking out to the ocean while the sound of the surf accompanied our conversation. I would gladly recommend Lahaina Shores to anyone who wants to spend some time right in Lahaina.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Missy2938
Reviews.Content: We stayed here our the first half of our honeymoon. We decided to spend half the week in Maui and the other in Oahu. First, let me just say that we LOVED the town of Lahaina. It was a great town. There was everything you could imagine. The cruise boats stay here when they dock in Maui. There are about 10 blocks of shops, restaurants, and anything else you could possibly need. Now the hotel. While it had a great location, the hotel was a bit outdated. We stayed in a studio room. Ocean front view to die for. The bed had no bedskirt and honestly, the bed looked like it was just a rollaway. It wasn't that comfortable. We did however thoroughly enjoy the balcony. We were on the end of the hotel and we could see the "Feast at Lei Lei's" which is right next door. There's a four course meal and a dinner show. There are no restaurants in the hotel, but we walked five minutes down the street and found dozens of places to eat. If you like French Toast, make sure you try it here. They make it on Portguese sweet bread and it's awesome. Get it with pineapples on top. May not sound great, but it was the best! I had that at "Cheeseburger in Paradise". Oh if you go make sure you get the smoothies. They are $5 but worth every penny. Most tripadvisor reviews I had read before booking this place said the staff was amazing. And they are. They are super friendly. The hotel is a beach front hotel. And while there is little beach, we discovered that all of Maui is like that. If you want the true beaches, you have to drive about 10 mins away and you will find it. Overall, we loved Maui. It was very laid back. We loved the town of Lahaina. If you want a hotel in the heart of a town, stay at Lahaina. If you want just the hotels with the beaches..stay in Ka'anapli (sry can't spell) and if you have the money and want to be spoiled..then stay in South Maui. But Lahaina will give you the true Hawaiian feel. Oh, and make sure you go to the Old Lahaina Luau...great show..open bar...but book weeks in advance (like 4-5 weeks).

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Tina380
Reviews.Content: Lahaina Shores was recommended by our travel agent because originally we were going to be joined by my 82-year old mother and stepfather. The agent thought that being close to downtown Lahaina would provide them with something to do while we went sightseeing. In the end we went by ourselves, my parents decided the travel would be too much for them, but we were already committed to this hotel. I was disappointed when I learned this hotel did not have a business center, since really the only extra I look for in a hotel is the ability to access internet from their computer. This much said, Lahaina Shores was a very pleasant surprise. We arrived from Waikiki, where we stayed in a highrise hotel. Lahaina Shores looks more like an old hotel, reminded me of the Sheraton Moana Surfrider in Waikiki. Very charming and feels luxurious without the formality and stuffiness that are normally part of the package in a luxury hotel. The hotel is directly on the beach. You enter on Front Street, then in the back there is a jacuzzi and a pool and a grassy area to sit and relax. This area is separated from the beach by a hedge and a locked gate which opens with your room key. There is a very narrow strip of beach there which is suitable mostly for walking, but you could swim there and then relax on the chaise lounge on the hotel grounds. Half the rooms face the ocea and get a beautiful view of the ocean and neighboring island Lanai. Our room was on the second floor, a corner room facing the mountains. The room was spacious and cheerful, we had two large balconies. All rooms in Lahaina Shores have fully equipped kitchens, and I was impressed how well the kitchens meet a guest's needs. There is absolutely everything you could need. Potato peeler; bottle and can openers; cutting board; knives, mixing spoons, measuring cups, cutlery, china, pots, pans, dishtowels, dishwashing liquid, dish rack, sponge. I probably left something out but trust me all the basics are there. The kitchen has a microwave, a full size range and oven, sink, and a full size refrigerator, plus a toaster and a coffee maker. Complimentary coffee is supplied each morning - both regular coffee and decaf. The room had a modern decor with an old time feel to it, very pleasant. Good bed, large TV that worked well with I think 70 channels. Standard bathroom, but the sink/vanity area is separated from the bathroom/toilet area with a door, which is very convenient. There is a large closet with extra pillows and a beach towel for each guest. The air condition was easy to set and worked well. We had two large sliding doors, both had two sets of drapes. One set was light filtering, one was room darkening. So anyone can get the effect they are after. There is a dining table with chairs for eating, a dresser, a couple of night stands with lamps, and two large chairs. Everything looks new, is clean and in great condition. The service was excellent. Our first morning here was the day of the earthquake off the Big Island. Most hotel guests were spooked. We're from Southern California, so an earthquake didn't faze us as much, but we were still impressed that the hotel served the guests coffee and fruit and sweet rolls, since the earthquake was at 7:07 a.m. and most didn't have yet breakfast. We were without power and the hotel staff definitely did their best to calm the guests. They told us they received no tsunami warning and explained what would be done in such a case. It was comforting to know there was a plan and we would not be left to our own devices. The hotel withstood the shaking and they informed us to move our cars from the underground parking, since it was likely to flood when they could not pump the water out due to the power outage. They did have an alternative parking lot ready for us, so moving the cars was no big problem. Fortunately power was restored within 3 hours on Maui. Other pluses: parking is right next door, very convenient. Location is good. On the ocean, a 5 minute walk to the center of downtown Lahaina. Pleasant lobby, soothing Hawaiian music always playing. Pleasant and efficient staff. Next door is a shopping complex, 505 Front Street, with a couple of restaurants, a convenience store, and some specialty shops geared to tourists. Negatives: we found two. One, there are no safes in the rooms. Generally, we find a safe to be very convenient. And by the way - next time you say you don't carry any cash when traveling: After the earthquake there was no power and stores accepted only cash. Debit and credit cards were useless. Luckily power was restored quickly, but on Oahu they were without power almost 20 hours, and you never know how long it will take. The hotel does provide a safe which works this way: you get a key and the hotel staff has a key. It takes 2 keys to open the safe where you will put your things. Access is 24 hours. If you lose your key to the safe, they will charge you $100. The other negative was no business center in the hotel. We need internet access and prefer the hotel to provide a computer that usually charges something like $1/5 minutes. Lahaina Shores has no business center. In the adjacent 505 Front Street complex is an internet cafe that can meet this need. Overall we really enjoyed this hotel, would stay there again if we return to Lahaina.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return!!!!”
Reviews.Author: SamMinke
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved the Lahaina Shores Beach Resort! I don't think there is another place on the island with a location as good as this.....you are right in the midst of the lovely town of Lahaina and everything is walkable. We had a mountain view room, which was pretty, but NOTHING compared to the ocean view rooms! The view from the ocean view side is just out of this world and on our next return we will certainly be booking an ocean view room. The staff at the hotel are fantastic....very, very nice and accomodating. There are several bar & eating options right next door to the hotel. The beach was fabulous! I can't say enough good things about this place.....we just returned and are already counting the days until we can return. I highly recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Mauitravler06
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Lahaina Shores for 12 days from 10 September 2006- 22 September 2006. The front desk was very curtious on our arrival and departure. The room was always clean and plenty of towels. The kitchen in our studio mountainside was very convient. We basically only ate breakfast in the room. The hotel is located just at the end of town. We had parking in the upper lot which always had plenty of parking spaces. Every night there was a rainbow which could be seen from our lanai. I would highly recommend this hotel and can not wait to return again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and views”
Reviews.Author: Scootie2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lahaina Shores for 3 nights prior to our wedding which took place at Kapalua Bay. We were pretty busy with other activities and wedding details so we didn't get a chance to use the pool or walk on the beach; however, we had a fantastic view from our 6th floor ocean view room. Our room was clean and updated with a very nice kitchen. The location is great for walking to the shops in town. The parking garage did have an odd smell but since you really don't spend much time in there, it wasn't an issue for us. We would recommend staying here...you really can't beat the price and the upgrade for the ocean view is definitely worth it. We did so many things while on Maui, we were really rarely in our room...I would definitely not want to pay the outrageous price for one of the big resort places.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Food Lady
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Lahaina Shores. We were on the 5th floor ocean front. Fantastic view and could see the luau next door each night for free. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Our son was on Ohau on army business and flew over to stay with us over the weekend. The staff was so thoughtful, leaving extra towels and beach towels for him at no extra charge. Downtown Lahaina begins right next door. We recommend Moose McGilicuties on Front Street both for the early bird breakfast-$1.99 and the early bird special for dinner. Happy hour is from 3 to 6 with drinks only $2. Our studio was updated ann clean. I would defintely go there again. On down Front Street there is a Safeway grocery store with reasonable (for Hawaii) prices.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Franchise35
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really in a perfect location. The center of town (Lahaina) is a 5-10 minute walk and there are lots of ammenities in town. The only downfall is that there is no real "beach" in the area. There are very narrow beaches scattered around Lahaina but you really have to drive 10-15 minutes to Kannapali or Kapalua to get the traditional beaches you think of when you hear about Hawaii. The staff at the hotel were very friendly and the conseirge (i.e. excursion booking staff from Expedia) were excellent. We booked the Royal Lahaina Luau...very fun and some kayak/snorkeling through Kelli's Kayaks (HIGHLY recommended) The hotel itself was very clean and it was handy to have a nice sized kitchen right in the room. We had an awesome view from our 6th floor ocean-view room. If you stay here definitely pay the extra money per night for an ocean view....gives you a great sunset view! (you can also sneak a view of the Luau that happens next door from a nice high room on the ocean side) The little shopping plaza next door (525 Front Street or something like that) is nothing to write home about but there are a few restaurants and a good size convenience.grocery store. As far as restaurants and such, there is a really good one in town (Lahaina) called Sunrise Cafe....excellent breakfast! Overall, the Lahaine Shores Beach Resort is a great location but don't expect a fancy, high-end hotel on the beach like you see in the commercials. However, for the money, the convenience and location can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Lahaina Shores is just OK”
Reviews.Author: trg1978
Reviews.Content: The hotel is what it is. If you're looking for some big beautiful modern hotel with fancy swim-up bars and pools with waterfalls this place isn't for you. However, what it lacked in amenities it made up for with it's beautiful view and quiet setting. Don't know if I'd recommend staying here for a full week though. The hotel beach leaves a LOT to be desired, you will find yourself making the drive to Ka'anapali for the beaches. And if anyone tells you that you don't need a rental car- don't listen. While you can spend thousands on excursions that don't live up to the hype, rent the car, pick up a good map, do your homework and explore. You WILL be disappointed with their beach, at high tide it is completely non-existant. The town is quaint and nice but you may become bored after the second day (rental car). Be cautious of booking a full week stay here. Think of your priorities and do your research. This place could live up to every expectation or disappoint you to no end. Do your homework!

Reviews.Title: “Best Location to do it all!”
Reviews.Author: newstarr
Reviews.Content: We loved the location. We were there for my 30th birthday and had a wonderful time. I upgraded the rental car for no reason, it sat in the garrage the entire time. We walked everywhere. We went to the galleries, all of our excursions left from the dock close by except for one. We love the Feast at Le Le and drank ourselves silly then crawled back to our rooms! I'm not a big lay around the pool type so this was perfect for a travelers who loves to see and do it all. I wouldn't recommend it to my fu-fu friends who want lush grounds, a spa, and a cabanna boy but it is an awesome place to stay if you plan to be in the middle of the mix!

Reviews.Title: “Awsome Motel”
Reviews.Author: funonvacation
Reviews.Content: The Lahaina Shores Beach Resort is a very nice place to stay and I would recommend it to all my friends. I know if I get back to Maui i would stay there again. The front desk clerks were very nice and always said hi to us. Almost everyday when my sister and I was leaving or coming back they would ask us what we did and they loved everything we said and they made you feel like you were at home. The room was very nice and it was comfortable . The beach front was nice there and not that many people out there so you could enjoy yourself while you were walking or relaxing on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful....Wow..... What else can I say!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: teena.wagner
Reviews.Content: Wow. We just got back from staying there for 8 nights 9 days. We had a mountain view room. The view was awesome. The room we had was very clean. The staff that worked the front desk was so friendly. Every time we walked down there they always said hi to us. When it came for us to leave they held our luggage since we didn't leave til 7:35. The ladies at the front desk were so sweet it seemed liked they were our family when we left they told us to come back sometime to tell them all about our ventures we take in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Place with Great Views”
Reviews.Author: Bayou-Babies
Reviews.Content: We stay at Lahaina Shores Beach Resort July 5-13 to celebrate our 25th anniversary. It was a great trip. The condo was clean and well equipped. We really enjoyed the view from our 6th floor lanai. We enjoyed the peace and quiet and the beautiful view so much we brought food in for dinner several night. We ate all but one breakfast sitting on our lanai. It was great. It was nice not having to fight a crowd waiting for an ocean front table, we already had one! The beach may not be the best for snorkeling but it was wonderful to stroll on in the mornings and evenings. The lanai and beach had front row seats to a wonderful sunset every night, and again, no crowds. We could even watch kids surfing from our lanai. This condo is located in the heart of the best part of Maui, within walking distance to all the nice restaurants and shops. The nice beaches of West Maui are only a short drive away; make sure you check out Kapalua Bay. It was the very best beach for sunning and snorkeling. The pool, lawn, and hot tub were never too crowded to use. We always found lounge chairs when we wanted them. The lobby area is very inviting and the check in process was quick and easy. Everyone was very accommodating. I would highly recommend this place to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Lahaina Shores Resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After much research for a nice place to stay in Maui, we chose Lahaina Shores Resort. We were a little nervous at first, since this was for our honeymoon. We pulled up to the hotel/condo and it was very nice. The staff is very friendly. They greeted us with a bottle of champagne. We stayed on the 3rd floor. I would say from the 3rd floor and up would be the best views of the ocean. Our room was very clean and quiet. It had central air, full kitchen, huge closet, large fridge. Everyday the house keepers would clean it for us. This was a nice change from staying in condos with no house keeper. The best part of Lahaina Shores was its location. It is one of only a couple places to stay in Lahaina directly on the beach. About 20 feet from the outside pool was the beach. We were there in June 2006, and at the most there was maybe 2 or 3 couples on the beach at the same time. It was like having your own private beach. Of the 10 days we stayed there, we never once seen any sea life in the ocean out front. Lahaina Shores beach has a barrier reef which keeps the sea life pests away. The beach was very pretty white sand. There was some coral in the ocean but it wasn't too bad. We never had to wear shoes in to swim or anything like that. Also, right next door to Lahaina Shores they have a luau every night. It never did annoy us. From Lahaina Shores, it was just a short walk into town. We only rented a car to see the rest of Maui. Of all the towns to stay in in Maui, i would highly suggest Lahaina if you like shopping and good food. We visited Kaanapali and wasn't empressed. It was very crowed there and just too commercial. We can't wait to go back to Lahaina Shores Beach Resort!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lahaina is the Best Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Costa_Rican_Gem
Reviews.Content: There were 7 of us who stayed at Lahaina Shores, from June 26-July 2, 2006. Every day we had tons of things to do, great restaurants and the beaches were endless. You could walk into town for a casual dinner at an open-air restaurant and galleries and shops galore. There was something for everyone; the ages of our group ranged from 12 to 84! Kaanapali beaches were our favorite, only about 5 minutes from Lahaina Shores. The condos were extremely clean, the staff was helpful and kind, and you can really save $$$ if you pack lunches (fully equipped kitchens) and just hang out on the various beaches each day. We went thru the Visitor Center (Nick Monroe) and he answered each and every question within minutes of emailing him. If you want a high-rise hotel with tons of people on the beach, then try the Sheraton or another resort, but if you want a FABULOUS family vacation then go to Lahaina Shores. They even provided fresh beach towels each day, and let us use their pool and facilities even after checking out (our flight wasn't until 9pm). This was the best way to spend a relaxing, perfect location and reasonable vacation than anywhere else. The Feast at Le Le is right next door, and Heckock's had the best food (even breakfasts) with an open-air ambiance and flair that was absolutely wonderful. You could watch the luau at night right from the restaurant. For breakfast, you could enjoy those learning surfing lessons right on the beach while enjoying your meal.. We definitely would recommend this resort/condo to others, and we definitely want to return SOON!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good solid value.”
Reviews.Author: dvw999
Reviews.Content: This is a good value. The place needs some updating but overall a clean, freindly place. I would suggest upgrading to an Ocean View room for several reasons. The sun will be beating in your room in the morning if you're on the mountain side and also the risk of having some minor road noise is there. We slept with the door open on the ocean side and it was nice to have the sound of the waves put us to sleep. Friendly staff, clean rooms...albeit they need some updating...relatively quiet, low key place to stay. Walking distance to everything in Lahaina. Skip the continental breakfast unless you don't mind trying to be sold tourist adventure packages. If you want posh, go north and pay twice as much. As I stated, it's just a good solid value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Great Great”
Reviews.Author: melissaSanDiego
Reviews.Content: Lahaina Shores is a great hotel at a great price with a great location! I loved it! There's a gate that leads from the pool to the sand! It was perfect! It's a block from all the shops & restaurants! There's even an adorable little pet shop a block away with cute little piglets! It's close enough to the action, but it's still quiet! I will stay here again!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Maui”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Lahaina Shores Beach Resort was a great find for us. It was our first trip to Maui but our third trip to Hawaii. I really wanted to give the rating as excellent but there were a couple issues I think they could fix. Our room was an ocean view one bedroom. When we arrived I was told our room was on the 1st floor and after reading some reviews I ask to be moved up to the 3 floor or above. There were no ocean view one bedroom units available for our entire stay and we didn't want to move for the last few days. We went to the 4th floor to look at a mountain view one bedroom and a ocean front studio. The hallway in that floor and the 3rd floor smelled funny. Not a real stinky smell but a old musky smell. We decided we didn't want to walk down these halls several times a day so we kept the one bedroom on the 1st floor. We were so glad we did because it was perfect. Only a few steps to the small pool and spa and our granddaughter (age 14) could go out by herself to swim and we could just peek out at her from our lanai. We had a great view of the ocean and the sunsets. If we go back and I think we will we will ask for the first floor room just like this visit. The beach was fine for walking, for swimming I would recommend some beach shoes there is a lot of coral out in the water and you need to protect your feet. We snorkeled but didn't see many fish until we got all the way out to the reef that is about 50 yards or so from the beach. If you look at the north end of the resort there is a small stream that runs out into the ocean. If you swim straight out from there that is where we found the most fish. The beach is very safe to just float on the blow up mattress that the hotel provided. We didn't know until the last day that there are two very nice BBQ's at the south end of the resorts. We cooked 3 meals while we were there and we would have used the BBQ if we knew it was there. I think they could lower their prices on doing a load of clothes. It colt $2.00 for the washer, $3.00 for the dryer, $1.00 for soap and $1.00 for fabric softener. If you think you are going to need to do laundry put a zip lock bag of soap 1/4 cup it is a front load and that is what is recommended and pack some fabric softener sheets. Also bring some dishwashing detergent the small tablets. I bought a small box and used it 4 times, I only did a load of dishes every other day and left the rest of the box there. Our room was kept very clean and we were given fresh beach/pool towels each morning and we could have more anytime we ask for them. The staff was all very friendly eveyone had a smile on their face and was willing to help you and answer your questions. What are you waiting for.......just go..........and have a great time.. We went to the Four Winds II trip to Molkini Island to snorkel and it was a great trip and had a very good BBQ lunch hamburger's, hotdog's, vegiburger's or chicken breast sandwich. The crew was very helpful and friendly. Over all I loved this place and would go back tomorrow if I could.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Maui”
Reviews.Author: Schuett.
Reviews.Content: Ok, when we got there, I was expecting the worst after reading some of the reviews. However, when we got there, the staff was VERY friendly and helpful throughout our stay there and we even got upgraded to an oceanview room which made the stay even better. A note to people, they have 2 parking lots (one under the building next door and one out front) and we got the underground parking initially. All you have to do is ask the staff to see if you can get a top lot parking when someone leaves and then just check back every day and you should get one in one or two days. Just outside the lobby was a pool that barely ever had people in it and if there were people, they weren't kids so it wasn't a big kids splash pool. The hot tub was also perfect in the evening times when a slight breeze blew through and got a bit cool. Just beyond the pool, is the beach. Now, I saw some people swimming in it but it's not a fun beach to swim at as there are no big waves to ride in. However, if you want calm water so that you can just lay on a float (which the hotel provides)- this is the beach for you! Our room was on the 4th floor and it was very well kept. It was clean and spacious and the fridge really helped with all the fruit we would buy and eat for breakfast. We visited all the other towns on the western side of the island from Wailea on north and this was our favorite because it wasn't crowded like the other hotels. The Grand Hyatt (up in Kanapali) has TONS of people laying out by the pools and it looks like a zoo. The resorts on the southern side had fewer people but cost a fortune. Lahaina was just a fun town to be at in the morning and at night for dinner and that was the only time we were really there (morning and night) so it was perfect. I do think the town gets a bit touristy in the afternoon but we spent our afternoons in the water snorkeling everywhere so we didn't mind. One side note, we went on the Molokini and Turtle arches snorkeling trip with Eco Adventures and it was amazing. We will definitely repeat that snorkeling trip every time we visit the island.

Reviews.Title: “Maui on a budget.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a 10 night stay in Lahaina. (May 2006) We have been to Maui many times, but wanted to find a hotel that was conveniently close to town, a bargain in regards to rates, one that had a beach on the property, and one that was clean and a place where the staff were friendly. Lahaina Shores Beach Resort met all of our expectations. Our room was a studio mountain view, complete with a small dining & kitchen area, and a lanai where one could sit and watch the sunset over the mountains. My plan was to upgrade the room, but when I saw the incredible view of the mountains, that were frequently decorated with the largest rainbows I had ever seen, I decided I was happy in our bargain room. We were on the 6th floor. I recommend a higher floor if you have an option. As for the beach, it was pleasant to sit on, but wasn't the best swimming conditions.(a lot of seaweed). When the tide went out, one could walk for miles. And from the beach, one could enjoy the almost nightly luau held at a restuarant next door. There is a small shopping area next door that has pretty much everything you need, and town is only a short walk away. The resort has washers & dryers, but it cost about $5.00 per load. Not included soap. Unfortunately, they close at 8:00 pm. Parking was $6.00 per night plus tax. The structure smelled pretty bad. They did have a lot outside of the hotel, but parking was restricted there. There are irons, ironing boards, & blow dryers in the room. We never had any trouble finding a free lounge if we wanted to lay out, and the resort was willing to give you extra towels when you needed them. The jacuzzi is small, so if you want to soak at night, get there early. It closes at 10:00 pm. The rooms did not have safes. But they did have deposit boxes at the front desk for no charge, but one needed to get assistance every time you wanted to use it. The charges for lost safe keys & parking cards were a bit high. Thankfully we didn't loose ours. Overall, our trip was great. We will definately go back to the resort again. Hope this information helps.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Rent Lahaina Shores Through Maui Condos”
Reviews.Author: mcurtiss57
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 8 days at Lahaina Shores. We booked through Andrea's Maui Accomodations, who I found out booked through Condominium Rentals Hawaii. I would NOT book through Andrea's again. When we checked in it was around 9pm and the room we were given was completely filthy, dirty dishes in the sink, dirty towels in the floor, chip bags and trash all over the counters and the trash can was full. I called the front desk and was told since I booked through a rental agency I had to contact them. Of course, Andrea's voicemail stated that they did not work on weekends so you are out of luck if you want to speak to her on the weekend (not that it does any good). I called the emergency number that was on a paper in the room but the girl told me she didn't have another room to move us to that night and that we would just have to make do. Since we assumed the sheets were dirty as well we had to either sleep on top of the bed or sleep in the floor. The next morning we had to call CRH again (even though we told a manager would call us first thing) and they moved us to another room. When we got to that room, it was clean but it had all the cleaning supplies on the cabinets, towels all over the place, a curtain rod on the table, etc. I called CRH again and told them about the room and she (Charla, who was very nice and helpful) called the front desk again and we went to another room. The next room we went to was clean however it had twin beds instead of a queen bed that we had requested and it was on the 4th floor and we had requested the 5th or 6th floors. We went ahead and unpacked because by then we were exhausted and tired of moving from room to room. Plus it was no way to start our anniversary vacation. When we did hear from Andrea she basically told us that WE had to get the compensation from CRH for the trouble at check-in. This to me, was not right because we did not book through CRH and had I known that was who she used I wouldn't have booked with her either because of the reviews I have read from other travelers. After a whole week of trying to get a hold of CRH (kept leaving messages that weren't returned) I finally called Andrea back and told her that I had left messages with CRH but nobody was calling me back. This was on Friday and I knew if I didn't get any response then I surely wouldn't hear from anyone on the weekend. Andrea did call back and say that CRH was going to compensate us and had tried getting a hold of us. We had left the room to go sightseeing and there was a message waiting for us at the room when we returned. Upon arriving home I sent and email to Andrea's Maui Accommodations to at least let her know of our disppointment with her services and to also let her know that it should have been her job to notify CRH and not mine, seeing as how I booked with her and not CRH. I received a very nasty reply stating that she detests working with people like me over such small incidents. I don't think that I would say that upon our arrival we received a room that was less than satisfactory and the fact that I had to spend MY VACATION TIME to contact CRH every single day. As far as Lahaina Shores the room view was awesome but there are rocks out front so it's really not a swimming beach. I had read from previous views (I thought) that it had a good swimming beach and I guess if you have reef shoes then it would be ok. It was great for snorkeling though and we were told that the Lahaina area was best part of Maui for snorkeling. The grassy area where the beach chairs are is small but we never had any problems getting chairs. The part I didn't like was not being able to take the chairs on the beach. Being at the ocean is always windy and laying on a towel in the sand is not fun when you have sand blowing in your face the whole time. We didn't encounter any rude or unfriendly staff but didn't really need them except on check-in and check-out. The resort is within walking distance to Front Street where the Banyan Tree is and all of the shops and restaurants. You can also book all of your tours/cruises through the activity desk they have in the lobby or at any of the shops set up on Front Street. After all the trouble we had checking in we did enjoy our stay there, but probably would've had a better time without the twin beds. We would probably stay here again but would make sure who we were booking it through. I did hear a couple inquire about rooms and they were quoted $240 a nIght for oceanfront. I would not have paid over $175 for the OF rooms and not nearly that much for the mountainview rooms. Feel free to email me with any questions or other information.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: bordeauxWhitleyBay
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful time staying here. On arrival the view through the lobby, out to the pool and then the beach were great. Rooms overlooking the ocean were spacious, clean with spectacular views. Room service was excellent - even clean beach towels every day - we stayed with our son and daughter in law who are seasoned travellers and they agreed with us that this hotel, location and views were great!! Staff were also very friendly. Would love to go back again if we are lucky enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well worth it. perfect location, right on the beach and can easily walk to downtown for dinner or other activities. There was some construction on one of the elevators but everything else was gret. Nice pool. Given how expensive Maui is, this place is a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoBufffan
Reviews.Content: We stayed in late March 2006 with our two kids, age 7 and 4. We had a ground floor ocean view room, which was nice for them to play on the grassy area and gave quick access to pool and beach - (with parents close behind of course.) The room was clean and reasonably well equipped for making basic meals. We were in one of the "private" units (we went thru VRBO(-)), so we did not have much interaction with the front desk staff other than check in and check out. As part of that arrangement we did not have daily maid service, but for just a week that was ok. The room was clean but somewhat dated in decor and carpet. I think they are in the midst of an upgrade as appliances were new. We did not see other rooms except on the website, which seemed to have more updated furniture, countertops, etc. But hey, you're not spending a lot of time in the room so it wasn't a huge deal for us. It's within walking distance to old Lahaina town for shopping and occasional meals out. There is also a convenience store right next door at the 505 Front Street area, which came in handy a few times. The pool is somewhat small, but there were not a lot of swimmers during our stay. We had the pool to ourselves quite often, ditto for the beach. It's not as nice as some of the Kaanapali beaches, but definitely usable with kids. Water was calm and depth was shallow for quite a ways out. Good for kids to try snorkeling. One drawback: On the ground floor rooms you hear noise from people outside coming home late, as they walk by your door to the front of the hotel. If you're an early and light sleeper it might be a problem but it usually ended about 10pm. We also heard muffled noise from the luau next door a couple of nights but it ended around 9. If you want a quiet, out-of-the-way place with minimal noise and no touristy distractions Lahaina Shores is great. You just need to keep in mind it's probably a 3-4 star (out of 5) place - don't go with expectations of a full-blown Marriott or Hyatt resort and you'll enjoy your stay. I definitely would stay there again if we return to Maui, but perhaps on a higher floor. And definitely with ocean view!

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort, nice location”
Reviews.Author: traveldogsIdaho
Reviews.Content: We started out with a Mountain view room (views the parking lot & locals homes) but were able to upgrade to an ocean view. That made for a much better Hawaiian experience to hear & see the ocean. It is a nice, quiet resort and during our stay virtually no children. The beach out front is small (meaning sand to ocean), very swimmable and quiet with not a lot of people. The pool is small but not many people were swimming anyways. The grassy area around the pool was very nice and we never had a problem getting a lounge chair am or pm. There is some shopping and dining right next to resort plus a small spa for massages, etc. It seemed like a few locals hung out at the bars there but that was not a problem. No restaurants/bars at resort. It's about a 2 block walk into where the main shopping/dining starts in Lahaina. Be prepared to pack your luggage into your room, there are no bellhops. They have a couple of carts but those weren't always available. If you truly want to be left alone this is a good resort. The staff was friendly but we just never really saw them much. We had a tour company trying to call us at 7am and the front desk never answered (they tried twice), therefore making us late for our tour. The rooms are clean & comfortable, the kitchen had all the amenities you could want (stocked better than most). Washers/dryers available on a couple of the floors. It is a nice resort for the price. Pay a little extra for the oceanview, it's well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal, Great Time”
Reviews.Author: matang
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent deal. You must get an ocean view room. I would also suggest asking for a room not on a first floor. The reason being the view is simply better. If you want Ultra nice this is not for you. But if you want a beautiful view of the ocean, being able to walk all over town, and a nice quiet hotel, this is the spot for you. Remember that each room is owned my individuals so your room decor may be different or be out of date. I think until I can afford a $5000 a week vacation to Maui, I will stick with this hotel. In Fact we just booked our honeymoon yesterday. And you guessed it we are COMING BACK!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!!”
Reviews.Author: Judarell
Reviews.Content: My (now) fiancee and I came to Lahaina Shores last April and found it to be absolutely charming. We are so glad we decided on the OCEAN FRONT studio because the resort, though small, is only feet away from the ocean, and the sound of the waves crashing onto shore was wonderfully relaxing. The price was excellent. Our room was clean and comfortable and the service was good (although we never needed to call anyone for any reason since there were no complaints by us!). This place is within walking distance to the many quaint restaurants and shops that fill Lahaina, and there is a luau behind the restaurant next door that can be heard from our balcony some nights. Only downside is that the actual beach behind the resort is not the best, but if you are renting a car (highly recommended) you can drive to Kanapaali or Wailea and spend the day at those beaches. We are planning to come back during our honeymoon for SURE.

Reviews.Title: “Meh - wouldn't go back”
Reviews.Author: leafpeeper
Reviews.Content: Well...it was okay for the money which wasn't much. We had a mountainview room on the third floor. I tried for months to get an upgrade to a oceanview room with no luck. We pretty much had a view of the roof of the portico and powerlines. There was lots of construction happening across the street so there was constant noise of heavy construction equipment coming and going and backing up with that constant beeping noise. Anyway, the thing that really caused me to never consider this place again, is that the grassy yard that faces the ocean is lovely, but small. But, even at 8:00 am in the morning people come outside and cover the available chairs with towels so you don't have a prayer of sitting out there and enjoying the view. The lobby and the staff are lovely. And there is a back gated entrance to the mall next door which includes Pacifo's, Io's and Heathcock's bar. Incidently, if you time it right, you can watch most of the wonderful dinner show at Feast at Lele's from the bar at Heathcocks.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were at Lahaina Shores with 8 family members (4 couples). One couple had a penthouse suite on the 7th floor. This was by far the best room with a great view (facing the ocean). One room was on the 4th floor and 2 on the 6th, all with mountain view rooms. The 6th floor rooms definitely had better views because it put you above the parking lot and power lines. The view of the mountains was gorgeous with a rainbow almost every day. This hotel is in a great location. So much is within walking distance (shops, restaurants, galleries, whale watching, snorkeling & dinner cruises). A luau is held every night and we were able to watch it from the penthouse balcony. At least one of the previous reviews talked about the luau getting annoying after the first couple of nights, but we loved it. Sitting out on the lanai with the sounds of the luau was magical. There is not a restaurant on-site but there was one right next door as well as a general store where we picked up soda and snacks to keep in our rooms. Out of all of the resort areas we visited on our vacation we liked ours the best because of the convenience of being able to walk to so much instead of getting in the car every time you wanted to go somewhere. This hotel is clean and well-kept. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The only complaint we have is that our beds consisted of 2 beds pushed together so we had a big bump in the middle. One couple's bed actually had a gap in the middle but when they complained they were immediately relocated to another room. When driving up to hotel, you may have to drive down a block or two that looks a bit run-down. Once you get to the hotel though, this is not the case at all. The hotel itself and all the way down Front St. is very nice. We would highly recommend staying at Lahaina Shores. If we are able to return to Maui we will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved Lahaina Shores”
Reviews.Author: Carole-Renee'
Reviews.Content: We went to Maui for the second time in September of 2002. Our room at Lahaina Shores faced the water and at night seemed magical with the lights of boats and views of the other islands. One of my favorite sights was of a cruise ship coming in early morning and seeing the flashes of the cameras. Here they were taking pictures and here we were right where they were taking the pictures! Being older, and not as brave as we once were, we loved snorkeling in the shallow waters right outside our hotel. Don't forget to wear those rubber shoes (I can't remember exactly what they are called at the moment)because it is rough going in your bare feet. Actually most of the time you need them in Hawaii if you are going in the water. We could see the yellow coral from our window. There is no restaurant on the premises, but there is a nice place very close by. We were within walking distance to Lahaina and the shops and the famous banyon tree in the square. Our room had twin beds (we usually prefer doubles, but this was a minor thing) and a refrigerator, microwave if I recall correctly and sink. We had a wonderful maid who even went beyond the call of duty and washed up our dishes one morning. She was so pleasant. Lahaina Shores was peaceful, clean, in good repair and the views on the water side are wonderful, magical. We were about 3 floors up. I never like to stay at ground level as I think you lose some of the view and also some of your privacy. Lahaina Shores was my husband's favorite place to stay in Hawaii, and we have been there 5 times and stayed in about 8 different places while there.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband, me and our baby stayed here on our visit. It was the second time we've stayed here, and we love it. It's quiet, family oriented, and in walking distance of everything you could want. I watched the sunset from our balcony every night, and watched whales from there every morning while drinking my coffee. Great place to stay. Staff is very helpful and friendly, as are the guests!!!
