I've already started saving for the next trip!!

Reviews.Title: “OK, but could have been better”
Reviews.Author: drwlaw
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is good if you want to be close to the shopping and dining in downtown Lahaina without worrying about parking or traffic and if you also want to be right on the beach. Even though this is an older hotel, it is kept up nicely and the rooms were clean with a full kitchen. The view from our fourth floor oceanfront room was beautiful and probably worth the price for the upgrade even though we weren't in our room very much. We enjoyed listening to the waves crash into shore while we slept each night. The pool and hot tub and lobby areas are nice, and they provide an area on the beach side of the hotel with beach chairs for hotel guests. However, some of the front desk staff are very nice and accomodating, and others are very rude and don't understand or speak English very well. For example, one day we asked for an extra beach towel because housekeeping did not provide us with clean beach towels in our room that day (for some unknown reason). The front desk clerk told us we were provided with beach towels in our room and they said they only had one clean beach towel left which they reluctantly gave to us. We had a fishing trip reserved for 4:45 a.m. the last morning of our stay. This trip was scheduled to return at 11:00 a.m. at Lahaina Harbor (just a couple blocks from the hotel)and check out time is 11:00 a.m. They would not allow us to check out 15 minutes late. Therefore, we had to check out at 4:30 a.m. and store our bags in a room off the lobby and we had to move our car out of the hotel's parking garage at 4:30 a.m. When we returned from our fishing trip, we happened to be in the lobby around noon and we saw another person checking out of their room around noon. So apparently some people are allowed to check out after 11:00 a.m., but not us. They do have a hospitality room which was great so we could take a shower before we left for our red eye flight. You need to reserve this room for a one hour time slot the day before your check out--the front desk clerk also wrote down our hospitality room reservation time incorrectly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: Bailey715
Reviews.Content: Lahaina Shores was great -- Our room was nice very clean. The kitchen is quite a benefit becasue we made our breakfast each morning and packed a lunch some days for the beach. The location is key. Just a short walk from downtown Lahaina with lots of shops and GREAT food. Nice too if you want to have a few mai-tais and don't want to drive or pay for a cab! Here are our suggestions for Maui in general. Note --are in our 20s and like to stay busy with interesting things, but relax on vacation too. Road to Hana: AWESOME, drive yourself so you can stop wherever you want and eat fruit along the way. We did something that every single person will tell you not to do -- we took the back way around the island on our way back. We LOVED IT! We had a jeep, and it was needed. It was like we had the island all to ourselves. Seeing the sunset was amazing and we felt like we were in old Hawaii. I totally reccommend it. I stood up in the jeep while my husband drove, it was just great. Haleakala -- We could have passed on this. We got up at 2am, exhausted, drove for 2 hours, froze our ---- off for an hour before the sun even came up. It was nice, but not worth the 4 hours total in the car and the freezing. Molokini - Awesome! We had dolphins following us and jumping, it was great. I reccommed it to anyone. But if you go on a cheaper cruise, rent your snorkel gear. It is cheap from a local vendor and is much better quality (you won't get tons of saltwater in your month).

Reviews.Title: “Good value but is getting 'tired'”
Reviews.Author: rosem55
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Lahaina Shores (4th flr ocean view) for 7 nights. If you want to be in the heart of Lahaina you can't beat the location (they are the only beachfront accommodation in town). Beach is nice for a walk and a dip; some fish and damaged corals. Good beach for kids. Lobby is nicely done, but much of the resort is tired looking. Our studio kitchen was 'just' adequately equipped - mircrowave but no microwaveable cookingware. No glass allowed near the pool or spa area, yet there was no plastic glasses/tumblers in our unit. Bathroom towels are small and sparingly issued - I'm a fan of providing 2 bath towels per adult - many resorts/hotels do. Green beach towels (1 per person) are provided in each room and changed daily - ok, I have a 'towel thing', but many people in the hotel industry say that the towels say alot about the hotel. These said "skimpy but ok, and you didn't pay for large egyptian towels anyways!" There are 2 outside gas grills off to one side of the resort - but the lighting is poor and no chairs are provided to sit on while you wait for your food. Whether you like it or not, you will hear the luau next door - nice for the first evening, but sometimes you just want quiet. But that's not what you should expect at LH. And don't expect to be able to sit on the outside lounge chairs in the early evening - they stack and lock them up; about 7pm if I remember correctly. Some mornings they were unlocked early (but not unstack - you had to do that yourself - hey, they're heavy), some mornings not so early. Wish I had taken photos of the disgusting underground parking. Dripping pipes, rank smell, stagnant water. Really poor and reflects badly on the entire establishment. Location, location, location at a reasonable price is what makes this hotel worth a visit. I wanted to be able to visit the galleries a bit each day (without driving) while my hubby relaxed on the beach. For this it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Best kids beach in Maui”
Reviews.Author: nookielu007
Reviews.Content: These are all individually owned condos. All in all we had 3 rooms between us. One 1-bedroom penthouse, one studio oceanfront, and 1 studio mountainview. The rooms were all very nice (not super fancy) but very clean and bright and comfortable. The 1-bedroom was very spacious, easily 3 times the size of the studios and had a huge lanai. It had a fold-out couch in the living room and 2 bathrooms. The ocean front studio had a queen murphy bed that was very comfortable as well as a sofabed (but we didn't have enough room to convert it to a bed). The view was fantastic (we were on the 4th floor). It had a lanai and all you could see was ocean. The mountainview room had a regular queen bed (no murphy), a sofa, a chair, etc, also a lanai that overlooked the west maui mountains. it was actually very beautiful as well. The 6th floor was well above the quiet street and power lines so the view was unobstructed. Try to get a room not on the 1st floor--they lacked privacy. The pool and jacuzzi were great--nice sparkling clear water at the perfect temperature, and the location of the hotel was just 4 blocks away from Lahaina town. It is in a residential section so it is very quiet and feels safe. The best part was the beach--calm thanks to a reef offshore, clear perfect water. It was shallow--you could walk all the way out to the reef--and was therefore excellent for our small children and for my snorkeling husband. Our daughter could run and play on the beach without us worrying about the occasional big sneaker wave that plagued every other beach we went to. We loved it and will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, no complaints, worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Joanna100
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Lahaina Shores for 7 nights from Nov 28th until Dec 2nd. I booked an oceanfront studio condo on the Internet for $132/night and requested a room on the 4th floor and above, in a quiet section of the hotel, given the other postings. I got exactly what I requested. The lobby is nice, the hallways are run-down, but our condo was perfect. Every night we left the patio door wide open (even when it poured rain) and listened to the waves all night. The lanai offered an amazing view of the ocean and Lana'i. The only problem we had was a busted circuit breaker that killed all our electrical outlets. But we made one call to the front desk (even though we were in a private condo), and an electrician was at our door in two mins. He couldn't fix the problem himself, so another electrician came and then a senior manager came and they fixed the problem in 45 mins. Great service for a difficult-to-troubleshoot issue. Because we booked a condo, we had to park in the yucky parking lot right next door - but it was so convenient, it's really a minor complaint. Also, the condo rental agency told us that we would have to get our own toilet paper and paper towels after we had used what was there, but whoever owned that particular condo had stocked lots of extras, including extra bedding and towels. Because we booked a condo, we didn't get daily house cleaning - but the condo had its own vacuum cleaner and broom and pan. Absolutely no complaints about Lahaina Shores. I'm not sure if I would stay in Lahaina again, as Kihei/Wailea is a more convenient location with much nicer beaches. If this is your first time to Maui and you plan to do the Road to Hana, Molokini Crater and Haleakala, I would recommend that you stay in Kihei instead. Finally, get the Maui Revealed travel book - it was awesome. Our vacation was excellent, and the stay at Lahaina Shores contributed to it.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Pretty nice place in the southern end of Lahaina. If you want to stay close to where all the night life is - this is the place. I stayed in a studio on the 2nd floor. Room was well furnished with a fully equipped kitchen. The beach outside is under-rated. Its small for sure - but definitely less crowded than the famous beaches and a rock wall a couple of hundred feet from the shore makes sure the water is nice and calm. Not bad for snorkelling, got to see some nice corals and a some fish. Not the best but atleast its more secluded. Worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: hydqueen
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week at Lahina Shores, very nice facility. Room was clean and made up every day. Oceanfront room is definitely worth the extra $. The grounds were kept up beautifully. When returning to Maui, will choose Lahaina Shores again.

Reviews.Title: “Maui is wonderful! Lahaina Shores Resort...is okay.”
Reviews.Author: Zabrina
Reviews.Content: On the plus side, our room was clean and comfortable. Our ocean view was perfect, and Lahaina offered some of the best food on the island. While the beach was not the best for swimming, this didn't bother us since the drive to other swimming and snorkeling spots was easy and convenient from this location. (I highly recommend Black Rock at Ka'anapali Beach). Even the remodeling work being done in the lobby didn't interrupt our good time. We were mostly disappointed to find out that the hotel charges for parking in their OWN parking lot. $5 a day. The parking area is already gated, most likely to keep the non-hotel patrons out...but we're already paying to stay there. So, paying additional to park there as well seemed tacky. Also, I had just put laundry to wash when the doors to the laundry room were locked...with my clothes still inside! When I went to tell the front desk, they told me the laundry room closed at 8pm. He seemed annoyed when I told him it was only 7:30, and called to have it unlocked. I just think the staff could have been a little more considerate. These are really little things when considering the overall vacation in Maui. We are planning to return next year...whether it will include the Lahaina Shores Resort would depend entirely on our budget. It is a reasonable value for the money if you are on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, Would Go Back Again”
Reviews.Author: Bardda
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a studio ocean view room on the 5th floor. The view was fantastic. The room was clean and adequately furnished. The full kitchen was a great bonus since it saves a lot of money eating out. We had breakfast and lunch in our room and ate dinner out most days. We found two local grocery stores in Lahaina, Safeway and Foodland, and the prices are quite a bit higher than home, but I heard that Costco near the airport charges the same prices everywhere, so if you plan to eat in, get your supplies at Costco if you can. Only problem...try to time your arrival so you don't get there before 3 PM, because they WILL NOT let you check in early. That's a problem when you arrive hot and tired and dressed in your winter mainland clothes and you have to find somewhere to go for several hours before you can get to your room. The desk clerk was not nice about it and started out trip out badly. We exoected to be disappointed the rest of the trip, but it got better and everyone else on the staff was very pleasant. The beach is great. You can go out there any time of the day or night and the water is shallow far out, so would be great for small children. There are no big waves, so not dangerous for children. The pool and spa are nice, pool is a little cold and hot tub a little too hot, but very pleasant. The area closes promptly at 10 and you can't even sit by the pool after that time. So if you stay up late, you either have to go to the beach, off the premises or in your room. I highly recommend this hotel for the price. No frills but still great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place Better View”
Reviews.Author: bruceman5000
Reviews.Content: Lahaina Shores Beach Resort was a pleasent surpise when we saw our room we were there for 8 days (too Long for Lahaina) other reviews were correct stay above the 3rd floor. We had a ocean front view and our room was on the end (437) next to 505 Front Street the bar can be noisy But the Luau next to hotel made up for any bar noise. The room was clean and the Murphy bed was comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasy view - we loved it !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Maui,having stayed at the Lahaina Shores Oct 14- 21st. I was a little nervous as I had been dreaming about this "dream" vacation for months and did not want it ruined by my hotel choice. Once we arrived I could not believe my luck and was patting myself on the back for selecting this place. The view from our roonm was to die for. The ocean was about 30 yards from our balcony. We stayed in room #533 on the ocean side.The room was spotless, and looked like it had been recentley remodeled.Our room was a studio size room and quite large with a small kitchen,resonable size bathroom,a 10 ft.long closet and an extremely comfortable king size bed. The room was air conditioned and had new wicker tropical style furniture.We loved the hotel. The hotel is not a resort with room service,its the view in my belief that makes this place so special, especially for the money.Like the other reviews have said,go for the ocean front side and ask for 4th floor or higer.There was a luau next door almost every night,which we watched from our balcony. Also, you are within walking distance of Lahaina town. My husband and I shopped and went out to dinner and explored the town. While everyone else was fighting for a parking spot in Lahaina,we just strolled on back to our hotel.Lahaina Shores was the best decision I made on this vacation. We sat next to a doctor on the flight back to Oklahoma,and she told us she stayed at a resort hotel on the south side of Maui,paying $285 a night.She said all she got as far as a view from her room,was the view of the back side of another building.I am just a hard working person who goes on an annual vacation like you other hard working stiffs do.If your going to Maui,you want an ocean view,you want that memory as part of your vacation. Get the ocean view,you know you deserve it. You don't go to Hawaii every day. Go to Lahaina Shores. Nice hotel,nice room and A FANTASY VIEW.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wow- What a perfect place in a perfect town! We stayed there for 8 nights for our honeymoon. My wife was nervous being that it is a condo type hotel, with all of them being different. We arrived to a beautifully redone lobby overlooking the open and airy outside area w/pool and jacuzzi. It is literally right on the ocean. We went upstairs (she was still nervous) to discover the most perfect room!! I cannot say enough how happy we were! The sliding door is huge and to listen to the waves made the place just surreal. Anywhere else is not right on the water and the waves would never be heard. We were on the fourth floor, try to stay on 3rd or above, the view is amazing. Just get the studio, springing for a 1 bedroom puts you on the first floor and is more expensive. The pictures don't do the place justice though. We will be going back in 2 years, already reserved a penthouse on the top floor! Gosh I cannot say enough, clean rooms, nice people, lots of soft towels, and the town is perfect too! A little slice of heaven! Its like Key West toned down. Gosh we miss it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: margstew
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Lahaina Shores during the week of September 10th to 16th and were very happy with our Ocean Front Studio on the 4th floor. We had requested 4th floor or above based on previous reviews and were not disappointed. Beautiful ocean and sunset views. We fell asleep and woke each morning to the sound of the waves. The location was perfect for us, within walking distance of Front Street and all the stores and restaurants. The beach in front of the hotel is great for taking walks along the shore but really not for sunbathing and a little rocky to do much swimming. However the pool and garden area are right next to the ocean and were a great alternative. There was construction going on in the lobby area of the hotel while we were there but signs were posted each day with alternate exits and entrances and it was never a problem. Would definitely return to Lahaina Shores on our next visit to Maui ... can't wait!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Lahaina Shores Beach Resort as the 2nd leg of a 3 island trip to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary. I can't say enough wonderful things about this resort, and the town it is in! The island of Maui was what I always pictured Hawaii to be! The town of Lahaina was the perfect choice for our stay, and Lahaina Shores was in the perfect location. We had an oceanfront studio room, and it was even more than we had hoped for. Even though the resort was oceanfront, we did not get in the ocean. Lahaina is not the destination if you plan to spend your days on the beach, as 99% of the Lahaina oceanfront is commercial. I believe that I read somewhere that the Lahaina Shores is Lahaina's only oceanfront hotel. Lahaina Shores is located on the southern end of Lahaina, which was perfect for us. We spent our time there exploring the island, and NEVER experienced a traffic problem, unlike Oahu and Kauai. There was no noise problem, and as a woman, I felt perfectly safe going outside alone. All in all, I WILL go back to Maui again, and I fully intend to stay at the Lahaina Shores when I do!

Reviews.Title: “three star paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First of all I have to say I got a great deal on this package. $980 for 7 night stay with car rental & round trip airfare from Sacramento Ca directly into maui. The hotel itself is a 3 star so it isnâ€™t perfect. The location is ideal, only 2 blocks from old town lahaina where all of the shopping & restaurants are. There are no other hotels in the area, actually its location is in a residential area, so there are a lot of locals around the hotel & bars nearby. There were minor irritations, none bad enough to ruin my vacation, I had an awesome time. First of all the bed was lousy. Instead of a comfortable king sized bed, we had 2 full size beds stuck together under one mattress cover disguised as a king. Was greatly uncomfortable & very annoying to sleep on. Second, the water pressure in the shower was very low, we found ourselves taking 30 minute showers & still did not feel clean. Then the beach access was very disappointing. While the hotel is right off the beach, there is a chain linked gate that separates hotel from sand. Instead of a large sandy beach area, what lies between the hotel gate & the water is about 6 feet of sand, not a good place to lay your towel down for some sun. The pool & spa area is also rather small compared to other hotels in the greater lahaina area. We found ourselves hanging out at the beaches in kaanapali just down the way where the hyatt, marriott, westin, & other hotels are located. Not a far drive from our hotel so it was fine. Overall, it was a nice stay, but if I went again, I would more than likely spend more money & stay at the hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I took my 9 year old niece to Maui for her birthday present in August, and we stayed for a week at Lahaina Shores. I was a little worried because it sounded as though it can either be good or terrible, depending on what room you get. We got a great room with an ocean view---definitely splurge, I almost didn't and am very glad I did. Also, we were on the 4th floor, definitely get something that high, or higher. The staff was very friendly. We had maid service, so didn't have any issues with washing our own towels and such....they did a pretty good job, some days cleaner than others. The front desk staff was very nice, one lady in particular---she is the blonde lady at the front desk--Diane I think---but I can't really remember. My niece really liked her, and she was very friendly, and asked my niece each day what we did and such, always calling her by name. The room was decent sized, could have been more updated, but it was fine. The only thing that I didn't like about our room was the fan in the bathroom, it goes on automatically when you turn the light on, and it was SO loud. But if that's all I can complain about, then we aren't doing too bad. The views were great. We didn't hear any noise in our room from the luau next door, but we were on the far end of the hotel too. The pool is small, but nice. Always clean, and while we were there, there were several families with children(including myself) but the pool never got that loud. The kids played with each other, but weren't running around like maniacs. We ate in our room a reasonable amount of times. We were out and about obviously, but did eat a couple of dinners there, and some breakfast and lunches as well. Having the kitchen was great. We didn't hang out at the beach too much. Mostly left for the days to other beaches, but it was still nice to have it so close and to hear the waves at night and have the views during the day. I would definitely stay at Lahaina Shores again. It's not a high end resort, but it doesn't market itself that way. Its clean, a little outdated, and economical. And the views can't be beat!! I would definitely rather spend my money on activities, than hotel rooms, but that is just my opinion. As for things to do---definitely do the sunrise at Haleakeala---that was by far my favorite thing we did. Also the Ulelena show was great!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing place to soak in PARADISE”
Reviews.Author: quiet_logic
Reviews.Content: Wow. I just read the previous review and can't believe they stayed at the same place we did. Here's the deal. These are individually owned condos, managed by a property mgmt company. All are uniquely decorated by the owners. We stayed on a 2nd floor end unit on the ocean side and could not have asked for more (see pics). The 1 bd rm was nicely decorated, and stocked with everything from a wine opener, to coffee filters, to beach chairs. We tried spending as much time on the balcony as possible. The property is very well maintained, with a nice pool and jacuzzi. A shower is provided at the point between the beach and the pool. The location was central to everything you want to do. We walked 1 block for Pacific'O and I'O restaurants (prefer Pacific'o), the general store, and shops. Lei Spa is next store and nice way relax. Then, you walk about 5 blocks and you are in downtown Lahaina. We stayed 4 days so reducing travel time and hassle driving to good beachs, excursions, and restaurants was important for us. Aside: I'O restaurant offers a "Fete." Though we did not go, it was nice to watch the performers row the canoe into the ocean at sun set, torches and all, in preparation for the party. We could also faintly hear the music from our balcony (lanai in Hawaiian) as we sipped wine and watched the sun set on another day in Paradise. (can you tell we want to go back already?)

Reviews.Title: “Great bargain for a family”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an ocean-view penthouse suite (sleeps 5) on the 7th floor for $270/night (6 night stay), with complete kitchen. We had 2 adults and three teen/college-age kids with us. Layout is one large private bedroom with king size bed, then one main room with a sofa bed, 5th person on a comfortable rollaway put in either room. Main room has a dining table for 5, kitchen has a nice serve-through bar, and good fridge/stove/dishwasher (also mini-washer/dryer in a closet). It was plenty of space, with a full lanai accessed by a sliding door from each room. Excellent a/c (it was hot and muggy in August); free beach towels checked out at the front desk daily; all very clean; good housekeeping; quick elevators. The shops next door are perfect for older kids (and adults!) -- a general store, the surf-lesson place, etc.. The pool is nothing special, but clean (and, no floating toys allowed), the hot tub worked well. Both are right in front of the hotel on the ocean side; then it's only steps through the (locked) gate to the beach. It's a short walk down to the Lahaina docks and Front Street - you can walk either on the beach- or go out the other side of the hotel and walk on Front Street. A couple of flaws: the sofa bed was not comfortable (pretty common in hotels), and first they gave us some egg-crating to help; next night gave us a queen size mattress for the floor instead, which worked better. The hot tub (and pool) were only open from 9 am til 10 pm, and you often want it earlier or later than that. The "activity desk" is run by Expedia, who should be embarassed by their pushy sales people, but they did have full information on all the activities on the island -- and this big push on buy-your-activitiy tickets *here" is all over Maui. Overall, very clean, very pretty if not wildly modern (they told me they're renovating room-by-room), extremely convenient to all the fun in Lahaina, and a great bargain for a family, particularly after you stop at Costco near the airport and stock up the fridge. We would stay here again with a group. Great things to recommend: Goofy Foot Surf Lessons - from little kids to adults, guaranteed to stand up or you get your money back. Lessons near the docks, where the waves break in only 4-5 foot water, and, yes, everyone stood up! Kimo's restaurant in Lahaina -- great seafood & steaks, meals for about $22-25/person include sides and salads, right on the water, with live music, chosen as favorite 'special-occasion' restaurant by locals. Cheeseburger in Paradise -- lunch right on the water, but *not* known for their cheeseburgers -- great fries, great fish & chips, great atmosphere. The Marriott at Kaanapali luau -- half the price of the others that are touted ($47/person), and worked well for a family who doesn't want to spend $90/person for a few hour luau! Great buffet, gorgeous setting, good music, dancing, funny comedian, kids will like both the show and the food.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well we had no idea how awesome the location would turn out to be, and as it is, that was the only really great part about it. Our biggest complaint/issue was that (Room 612 which is a privately owned condo) this room, facing East (Mountain side) had NO window coverings at ALL. We're not early risers, but had NO choice but to get up every morning around 7am when the sun would come over the mountain and there was no place to hide. It was ridiculous. Also, even though we were on the sixth level, there are houses and a busy street right below that could easily see in. Very baffling. We enjoyed saving money by eating cereal in the room each morning, yet we were so paranoid about the cleanliness that we wore flip-flops in the shower and bought our own plastic spoons and bowls. We also didn't appreciate needing to restock the place with toilet paper and Kleenex which ran out by Day 3. It was nice to have a laundry room not too far from our room since we did need to wash our small supply of towels, though not something I wanted to be doing on a vacation. It's great that Laihana was only several blocks of walkable distance away, however you'll quickly memorize every nook of it! Just do NOT eat at Longhi's! Their food was disgustingly over-priced and well, disgusting!

Reviews.Title: “Completely Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When arriving at the hotel the staff was immediatly friendly and helpful. Check-in was a snap. Had a Mtn. View room which was georgous. The hotel is right on a private beach but gets pretty rocky about 5 ft depth. Only complaint to be made is the water pressure for the shower. Other than that it was PERFECT! Right on front street, close to shops/bars/food. Plus the most helpful staff ive ever met.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for a honeymoon, 15 years delayed!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Lahaina Shores Beach Resort in June for a 15 year delayed honeymoon> The resort was perfect for two people who just wanted to get away and spend time with each other. We stayed in one of the penthouse suites which was absolutely perfect. For less money than a mountain or garden view room at most of the other hotels on the more crowded beaches we go a clean, comfortable 1 bedroom suite with two bathrooms, one for each of us! The private lanai was perfect and there was no issues with noise from the nightly luau next door. The location was perfect, we were never more than a 15 minute walk from any of the great shops and resteraunts in Lahaina and no more than a 15 minute drive to our favorite snorkeling beach in Kapalua! But overall, the best part of our trip had to be sleeping on the lanai! With no bugs and perfect weather, we where able sit out on the lanai after a busy day of snorkeling and exploring and just relax to the sound of the waves in the ocean below and enjoy the fantastive view of the stars and moon in a near perfectly cloudless sky every night. The only down side that we could see was that this was not the place to stay if you have young children. The pool was small and they did not allow any floating toys. But for us, a young couple trying to get away from everything and enjoy an belated, romantic honeymoon and just enjoy each others company and relax, Lahaina shores was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is a bit old but it has a million $ view”
Reviews.Author: theTruthSpeaks
Reviews.Content: When we first enter the hotel front desk I was kind of dissapointed in the decor. It looks very old. Rusty elevators, and torn rugs. At first we got a room that had two twin bed that was attached to the wall, I was there with my boyfriend so I called the front desk to change my room to a one king bed. Although both rooms have the same size, the second room was a bit cleaner and better decor. However, all of the rooms facing the ocean have a great view. At night you can see the stars and a cruise ship shining on the sea, if you open the glass door you can also hear live haiwaiian music playing from the restaurant next door. Lahaina town is a great place to be if you like Santa Monica 3rd st or Venice. For me it was too tourisy. I like to go to more remote locations on my vacations. So in conclusion, your experience solely depends on the room you are getting at Lahaina Shores. Every room is different, but no matter what, make sure you get the ocean view room. Its worth it! Price : 4 stars Location: 3 stars View: 5 stars Decor: 2 stars Service: 4 stars

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: toasttime
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Lahaina Shores June 2005. The location is perfect, a nice walk to downtown. We stayed on the 5th floor ocean side. (Pay the extra money for the ocean side). The view was awesome and the room was comfortable. The staff was nice and helpful with all our questions. Check in and check out was smooth. Our favorite "hang out" in Lahaina was the Tropical bar and grill. Great bartenders and wonderful service. (Try the nachos and split them with your partner- you won't be disappointed). Alot of the "locals" hang out there and the atmosphere was "the best". We plan to return to Maui and we will most likely stay here again! So nice we didn't want to leave!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Lahaina.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our trip to Maui. Lahaina Shores was a great base. The room was clean and the staff was very friendly. We stayed in a mountain view room on the second floor. The kichenette was great for preparing breakfast and midday snacks. The hotel is located right on the beach. The Feast at Lele was next door and we were able to catch a glimpse of it on one of our sunset walks on the beach. The beach was so close, it was great that there was a option to layout on the beach or poolside. Most of the rooms at this hotel are privately owned and the staff helps maintain the rooms. Each room is different and there are various ways to reserve, either through an agent or privately. We used Pleasant Holidays and everthing was what they represented. Lahaina Shores served as a great base, as there is so much to do in Maui that we were rarely in our room. If you are looking for a resort type stay this is not for you. The shops and resturants are within walking distance, but the hotel is far enough away from the crowds. Overall we were very satisfied with Lahaina Shores and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect compromise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my sister. I love out-of-the-way funk. She requires air-conditioning. We had an ocean front room, 5th or 6th floor, can't remember. Perfect except the non-smokers next door decided to smoke on their lanai. Luckily, they were only there the first two days of our stay. Location is perfect if you like shopping (my sis does). Pool OK, right on beach -- actually got in a little snorkeling, though it's not an ideal place for that. Staff exceedingly friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great value...one bedroom unit with two baths”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a ground floor, one bedroom unit that overlooked the courtyard and was near the pool. At the front of our unit we could see the mountains and at the back lanai area we viewed the ocean. The unit was very clean and had new furnishings. Having two bathrooms was a luxury. While we didn't cook any dinners, we did use the kitchen for fresh fruit , banana bread , and coffee for breakfast. Our adult children stayed in an ocean front unit on the fourth floor that was in need of some carpet replacement but otherwise was pleasant. My husband's brother also had a room on the fourth floor which was nicely upgraded. The view on the fourth floor is excellent but having all the extra room in our one bedroom made up for being on the ground floor. Also, we did not hear the luau next door each night because our bedroom room was in the front of the unit. The beach is small but acceptable. There are no servers taking your drink orders if that's what you might want. The ocean area here is good for snorkeling but has a rocky bottom. While the complex is older, it is good value for an oceanfront room. The check-in and out went very smoothly, the grounds were well kept, and we would definitely plan a return stay!

Reviews.Title: “We're headed back!”
Reviews.Author: KatieK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lahaina Shores Beach Resort during the last week of May. It was nothing fancy but perfect for our budget. It didn't matter much to us b/c we rarely spent time in our hotel. Our room was on the 4th floor and no more than 50 feet away from the ocean. We really enjoyed being in walking distance to the downtown scene of Lahaina but we were far enough away to never hear the street noise (perhaps the sound of the waves crashing drowned all the other sounds). There was always something to do or something to eat close by. They don't offer the all the amenities of a big resort but they make the place feel very personable. The staff is wonderfully pleasant. We really enjoyed having our breakfast and coffee on the lanai every morning while staring out into the ocean. Do the ocean front upgrade. Watching the sunset every evening from the lanai was spectacular. My only gripe was having to park in the 505 Front Street garage and enduring the smelly funk everytime. We're headed back in November!

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just came back from Maui. First time in Maui. Loved the area where the hotel is located. Probably the best area in Maui. A lot of activities going on in the area. We got the condo it is nice and clean. Most of the stuff members are friendly. Try to request a floor higher than the 4th floor. I did that because of the advice we got from this website. We had the moutain view which was great but the beach view is even more amazing. My advice is get the condo and make your own food if you want to save money. Food cost on the average of $30 a plate. Shop from safeway. Don't do the cruise dinner on a boat. It is a waste of money. Good luck.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FlyboyWV
Reviews.Content: It would be difficult to imagine a more conveniently located hotel anywhere on the island. It is indeed only 8 miles from the West End airport, but there are no commercial passenger flights into that airport, so I am at a loss as to why the hotel management would list that as the airport from which they give directions in this website. The airport for all passenger travel into Maui is Kahului (OGG) airport which is located 21 miles away. It takes roughly 45 minutes to drive from the airport, so renting a car to explore Maui is a must-do. It is a very nice drive of open highway paralleling the beach. Kaanapali is the huge tourist resort area which is about 5 miles further down the road. Expect to pay 2-3 times as much to stay there, and yet have to drive to the area right next door to this hotel for shopping and entertainment. All of Lahaina town is within a 2-15 minute walk. Other comments in this website complain about no on-site resturaunts. This is true, but about 150 feet from the front door of the hotel is the resturaunt and shopping plaza that other hotels send their patrons to for the best in dining and shopping. Therefore, the only thing that is lacking is room service. Big deal. I could not be happier with the location. The hotel itself is actually a condo complex of studios and one-bedrooms. Private individuals own the rooms, so each room is decorated differently. Most are neat but spartan. None of them are lavish, but all are in good repair and quite acceptable, consistent with a 3-star hotel. A wicker/Rattan wall unit that opens up into a "Murphy Bed" was in our uit. These are common in studio units in the tropics. The kitchen was well stocked with the usual utensils and pans for cooking. The day staff was very helpful and knowlegeable. However, the night staff was surly and grumpy and of little or no help. This ranged from the front desk guy who scolded us (from across the lobby) for not turning our pool towels in by 10:00 PM (when the pool closes) to the night watchman who sees himself as a draconian enforcer of the rule that the the pool and hot tub MUST be vacant at 10:00 PM on the nose. Apparently they believe that adults need to have a 10:00 curfew. After speaking to guests from other hotels, there seems to be a 5:00 PM curfew for pool activities at other hotels. Odd, very odd. There were very few kids at the hotel, so there was never a problem with cannonballs in the pool or hot tub, and no problem with loud disturbances of anykind. IF you have kids, you should try a place like the Kaanapali resorts where kids are abundant and they have child-oriented activities. This hotel is not oriented to entertaining the guests, it just provides a clean, safe and convenient place to base your stay while exploring Maui. I mean really, a person comes to Maui to see the island, not to explore the inside of a hotel. My biggest complaint about the ammenities of the hotel is the total lack of Internet access. There is no possible method to hook up to even check E-mail. There is even a hefty charge for local calls, so finding a way to even find a dial-up access is prohibitive. The Livewire Internet Cafe and Coffee House is about a 2-minute walk down the street. The current charge for Internet access there is $6 for 30 minutes with your own laptop or $6 for 20 minutes with their computers. Not too bad, but I would have rather been able to stay in the privacy of my own hotel room and paid the typical charge of $9-12 per 24 hours for wireless access, as most hotels charge. Wold I go back? In a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Lahaina Shores”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a wonderful honeymoon in Maui and one of the best decisions my husband and I made was to stay at Lahaina Shores. This place is not for those who want to be pampered, but the room was clean, functional, and was perfect for us. With the full kitchen and cooking appliances, we were able to purchase food at a local grocery store and make most of our meals in our room. This saved us some serious money since I heard of several other couples spending upwards of $200 per day on food alone. Our oceanview room on the 5th floor was the perfect spot with the ocean right below us and an awesome view of the sunset from our balcony. The staff at Lahaina Shores was very friendly and always helpful. Since it is located in the neat historic town of Lahaina, you can walk right down the street to great restaurants and shopping. Overall, this is an amazing deal considering that it is a suite and is right near the ocean. One good tip is to book most of your activities in advance so you don't have to worry about that when you get there. Definately do a luau (Feast at LeLe was wonderful), do a snorkel trip (Trilogy is the best on the island), do the road to Hana (rent a Jeep or convertible and you will not be disappointed), and bike down the volcano. For food, be sure to go to breakfast at Pacific Coolers, lunch at Cheeseburger in Paradise, and dinner at Pacific O's. These were some of our favorite. We really enjoyed our time at Lahaina Shores and we look forward to vacationing there again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed reviews”
Reviews.Author: PonyF
Reviews.Content: We generally avoid mega-resorts when we travel and Lahaina Shores appeared to be just what we were looking for in Maui -- right in the center of everything, oceanfront and small enough to have some character. Essentially, the hotel was fine but we stayed in one of the oceanfront penthouse units and I just expected a bit more. The location is great. The staff is helpful and friendly and we had no complaints about cleanliness. But this unit was about 20 years beyond needing a facelift! The furnishings, carpet, decorations and appliances are genuine 70s relics. The in-unit washer/dryer did not work well and ended up scorching some of our clothing. The dish-washer sounded like a 747 taking off in the kitchen. Lahaina is great. We had some fantastic dinners and the view is to-die-for. The funky shopping district was great fun. But Maui is not my favorite island and I doubt I'll return. If I did, I would look for something a bit more up-to-date, I think.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about the hotel. We had an ocean front room on the 4th floor with a beautiful view. It is in walking distance to all of the shops and restaurants in Lahaina. The pool is small and they have enough lounge chairs to go around, no waiting like you would have a big hotel. The hotel is in the PERFECT spot on the island. Our room had a small kitchen so we went to Costco for snacks and drinks and packed our lunch for long road trips (Road to Hana). The staff was super friendly and our room was always cleaned by the early afternoon. The best vacation EVER! I have told all of our friends about it and will be back in two years. Make sure you go to Gabbies Pizza!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best on Maui!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Lahaina Shores from February 14-18, 2005. It was our first trip to Hawaii and it was absolutely perfect! We had an ocean view room with a spectacular view! We sat out on our balcony every night and listened to the waves. You can sleep with your patio door open and hear the waves all night long! It was a very relaxing, quiet, clean hotel. The Activity Desk was excellent in helping us plan a helicopter tour to Hana. Highly recommend it! The hotel is within walking distance to all the shops and restaurants on Front Street. It is the perfect location and the only hotel ON THE BEACH in Lahaina. It can't be beat for the price! We wouldn't stay any where else on Maui when we return. (hopefully soon!)

Reviews.Title: “Lahaina was the perfect resort for us”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were in Maui in February 2005. Great time for whale watching. Lahaina Shores Beach Resort is the only resort on the beach in Lahaina. Lahaina is a very popular area in Maui. The hotel does not have the perks as the large chain hotels, but for me and my husband it was perfect!!!! At night we would open the sliding doors (with a screen) and the sound of the ocean put us to sleep every night and we would awaken with the sunrise (such a beautiful sight). Some mornings we would sit on the balcony and watch the sunrise. Our room was equipped with a king size bed, sofa, television, table and chairs, counter bar stools, stove, fridge and microwave. Food is very expensive in Hawaii -- there was a nearby grocery store of which we purchased some food items. We were on the 5th floor ocean view side. Additionally, the hotel was affordable, clean and the beds were oh so comfortable!!!!! The pool was perfect and never crowed, and just a few steps away you were on the private beach of Lahaina Shores Resort. We rented a car so we were able to drive through other areas of Hawaii. Maui is nothing but a big circle; you won't get lost. The location was perfect! Right next door to the hotel were several restaurants that were very good with ocean view seating. We were able to walk to Lahaina Town... That's were all the restaurants, the pier, shops, etc. are located. If you want a quiet hotel that is affordable, clean and close to everything, Lahaina Shores is the place, but make sure you request an upper floor ocean view room. We visited some of the larger hotels, and found them to be overcrowed, noisy and impersonal. If we ever go back to Maui we will stay at Lahaina Shores. Checking in and out was a breeze.

Reviews.Title: “Lahaina Shores Beach Resort”
Reviews.Author: Vicktrisha
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Maui, April 30, 2005. The Lahaina Shores Beach Resort is great. We were on the fourth floor in an ocean front studio room. We were very pleased the room was clean with full kitchen, which is nice because food is bit pricey. We went to grocery store and bought a few items to have in the room. Our room overlooked the pool, grounds and the ocean. We enjoyed sitting on our balcony (lanai in hawaii) watching the sunset. We also enjoyed using the hot tub and walking down to the beach for a stroll. There is not a restaurant or bar with resort, but you are within walking distance to all of these amenities. Bubba Gumps, was my favorite restarant in Lahaina. I cannot choose which activitity I liked best, but the road to Hana is an experience everyone should do.

Reviews.Title: “The only !! Hotel on the beach in Lahaina”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Lahaina Shores in February 2005. I noticed many "Beachfront" hotels advertise that they are located in Lahaina. This is NOT true. The city of Lahaina was Federally declared a "Historical City" in 1975. ( Lahaina Shores was built in 1974 ) As a result, there are no more Hotels allowed on the beach in Lahaina. Lahaina Shores is, and always will be, the ONLY beachfront hotel in Lahaina town. It was very convenient to walk out of the hotel and be in Lahaina for Dinner, Shopping, Nightlife.etc. The rooms were not overly luxurious & either was the price. Nice pool, Nice Jacuzzi, and beautiful views of the island of Lanai. The staff was very helpful. From the huge lobby to the beach is no more than 60 ft. This was our 5th trip to Maui & we have always stayed at Lahaina Shores, because of 2 things. "Value" & "Being right in Lahaina Town".

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: LVallenari
Reviews.Content: Selected Lahaina Shores Beach Resort mostly because it's the only beachfront hotel in Lahaina and because of reviews like this one. Great choice. The lobby and rooms were clean, the staff was polite, helpful and even asssited in our surprise birthday party. Our rooms had full kitchens, full size refridgerator and was stocked with dishes, silverware, even a corkscrew for our wines. Even their laundry facilities were great. We had three rooms and all were exceptional. Hotel is close enough to enjoy a short walk to the main strip, Front street, where the shops, restaurants and harbor are. I highly recommend a little restaurant called Cafe O Lei 839 Front Street. You have to walk through a little jewelry shop to get to it but the food is wonderful and the service is friendly. Lahaina Shores and Cafe O Lei really made our trip to Maui complete.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from a week in Maui. We chose to stay at Lahaina Shores for a few reasons. First, as most will agree, was the location. This place has the best location on Maui if you want to stay in a fun atmosphere. It's not for you if you want total seclusion, mayby Kihei is a better option, but if you're looking for a place where you can walk anyplace you may want to go with respect to food, drinks, shopping, then Lahaina is a great option, and this place is situated perfectly. Second reason we came to find out to be true was the weather. At some places on the island, especially further north near the Ritz, the wind was a little much. Lahaina is very calm, and relaxing. As for this hotel/condo specifically, it meets all needs. It has the basic ammenities, and if you want others, they are within 200 feet of the hotel, just north. Let's face it, even if a more upscale place to stay has more to offer, you'll pay for it anyway. The service was great. The staff had the room cleaned no later than 2:00PM everyday. We stayed on the mountain side of the resort. Completely fine, as the mountain you get to see is amazingly beautiful.This place was great! No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “just perfect”
Reviews.Author: tewkstrav
Reviews.Content: we stayed at lahaina shores 2/16-2/23...just great!...no bugs...neat as a pin!...staff was friendly and helpful...nice view of mountains even if the water view wasnt available...kitchen more than adequate...even if it shows a bit of wear...all in all...a good value...we slept great...and we will surely return

Reviews.Title: “Good for the Price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Lahaina Shores from February 21st to the 28th. When we arrived we were given a mountain view studio on the second floor. While the room wasn't fancy, it was certainly adequate. Our room looked out directly over the parking lot, so we weren't able to keep our patio door open through the night, which would have been nice. I would suggest getting one of the ocean view rooms if they are available, if not, try to get something fourth floor or above. There was a great little kitchen area that we used to reheat leftover food, and store beer and drinks in. We did have to vacate our room for a whole day for pest control to come in and spray, which was inconvenient, but better than having bugs! The only other complaint is about the beds, maybe it was just in our room, but the mattress was horrible! Other than that, this is a clean, convenient place to stay. It's not anything fancy, so if you want to stay somewhere plush, I would suggest looking elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: amber8807
Reviews.Content: We just spent 5 nights at Lahaina Shores Resort in Feb 2005. It was wonderful and we'd stay there again. The rooms are spacious and always clean. They include a roomy area with a double bed, a kitchenette, a huge closet, a nice bathroom, and a private balcony. We had the moutain view and it was beautiful. Definitely rent a car and drive the island while you're there. We drove the north shore and it was incredible. Also, if you drive to Hana... don't turn around at Hana... keep going (even though the say not to) and it is worth the beautiful drive if you have a 4x4 car. The staff at the resort was great and there were people to arrange excursions. There was a pool and hot tub and sort of a 'back yard'. The beach is very small but very private so we loved it. If you walk down the street you're in Lahaina town which is full of little shops and restaurants. Get kabobs from Kahuna Kabob's stand. The hotel was quiet, bug-free, and a perfect location. Be sure to do a whale watching tour if you are there during whale season. It was awesome. Also, there are a lot of luaus to pick from but Old Lahaina Luau is the best and most authentic. You MUST get advance tickets or else don't expect to get in. You can order them online. Totally worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Moncana
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Lahaina Shores Beach Resort (2/12-2/18). The location of the resort cannot be beat, it's within walking distance of all the restaurants and shops on Front St. and the Lahaina Harbor. The rooms are very clean and spacious, and the views are spectacular. We stayed at an Ocean Front Studio and WHAT A VIEW! (see photos) The beach in front of the hotel is very nice and the water could not be any clearer...perfect for snorkeling or just to relax. This is an older, smaller hotel, so don't expect all the buzz and luxuries of a huge Resort...that is exactly what we liked about it. The hotel is nice and quiet, the pool and patio are perfect for a realxing afternoon or for drinks at night. We will definitely come back to the Lahaina Shores. We would not stay anywhere else in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “best ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My father and I stayed here and had an amazing time. The room was great and the employes where helpful and kind. The view of the mountain and the beach where incredeble. If you stay in Lahina stay at the Lahina shores.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Michigantraveler
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Maui yesterday 1/31/05. Our stay at Lahaina Shores Resort was wonderful. We had requested 4th floor or higher but we could only be accommodated on the 3rd floor which we were still very pleased with. We did have ocean front. The view was fantastic. Our room was nicely done in neutral colors, nothing fancy, but very, very clean and that was important to us. This resort is ideal for "baby boomers" or actually any age if you want a place where it is peaceful, quiet and very relaxing without hundreds and hundreds of people all over the place like you find in your big, lavish hotels/resorts. The grounds at LSR are meticulous. There is beach in front, although small, is large enough to relax on for sunning, walking along etc. The staff at LSR was very friendly and helpful. Would we go back to Lahaina Shores Resorts, yes we would and will.

Reviews.Title: “Keep in mind, this is not a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Phaedra
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been staying at Lahaina Shores since 1996. We feel it is the BEST value in the islands. I see a few reviews that are not favorable. Guests need to know that the units are individually owned and are decorated and up-dated by the individual owners. Thus the reason for the differences in the rooms. Some owners have had their units damaged by guests and will not put a lot of money in maintenance or decor. This is true of any condo. Also, the mountain view rooms will face the street and parking lot and are not as desireable as the ocean front rooms, but they are less expensive. The oceanfront penthouses, on the 7th floor, are a fantastic value and very comfortable. As for bugs... you are in the islands, they are a part of life, although we have never had a bug problem. The management is currently updating the public areas of the facility, but it takes time. We have no financial interest in Lahaina Shores so I have nothing to gain from offering this info. Our only interest is in giving praise where it is due. Our most recent visit was for 10 days in Nov.'04 and are now planning our next stay. As for food... there are 3 restaurants next door at 505 (a small shopping center), Hecocks (great breakfast), I'O and Pacific O (fantastic seafood). We consider Lahaina Shores #1 on Maui.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: JPifer
Reviews.Content: We just came back from Lahaina last night. We loved spending our honeymoon at Lahaina shores beach resort People were very friendly and helpful, the rooms were big and very clean. We would/will recommend the resort to all our friends and family. The location is just great, for one dollar you can take a shuttle from Lahaina to the number one beach on Maui. We will come back as soon as possible

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Kidney20A
Reviews.Content: We stayed there from 12/17- 12/26/2004 and loved it, and shall come back to this very nice hotel with the great location. We spent 5 nights in the Ocean front room and the rest on the Mountain side. Yes, the Ocean front is very nice and I would take that over the mountain view. The hotel is basic, yet clean and very nice. It has a fun sized pool and is right on the beach. If you get the ocean side you will fall asleep to the sounds of the waves in your ears and by the end of your trip in your heart. It should be noted that this is NOT a Resort per say, and does not compare to the services/rooms offered at the likes of the Four Seasons or any other 5 stars super hotel/true resort. If you need that kind of service you should think about another place to stay and of course pay. However, for the money this place is great. All the rooms come with a small kitchenette which is a nice option for reheating things you may pick up from one of the many great places to eat on the island. The staff is great and let it be known that they are there to help you 24 hours a day. If you book ask for an upper floor room (fifth floor or better) and try to get one that is to the south end of the hotel away from the party/luau that sometimes takes place at a nearby club. ( The party/luau ends at 10 PM so don't worry about being kept up all night) Also the hotel is about a 1/4 mile (15 min walk) from the fun of the beach town called Lahaina which is just the right distance to be. You should however get the rental car. You have parking there at the hotel for 3 dollars a night. I booked a small car via Alamo and was offered a jeep for only 100.00 more at the counter, for a total of 350.00 for 10 days (this would have cost me 650.00 had I booked a jeep on the web) I am told that this, " we have a special" thing being told to you at the counter, is very common. Also don't be scared into doing the Hanna highway with a group tour. Your rental car, yes car will more then be able to make the tip, and you will not be stuck in a van with a bunch of yahoo's The only other must have in Maui is what travel people in the know call the Bible. It is a travel book called Maui Revealed by Andrew Doughty & Harriet Friedman, it is a must have to see all the many things and eat at the greatest local places, and book with the right companies for your many events. And, I am not joking you will see all the people carrying it like some kind of bible. MAUI............Great time.... Great place...... WILL BE BACK!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Okay but I wouldn't stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We got married in Maui and we stayed in the Lahaina area the first 4 days at this hotel and I was so upset my first few day here. We check in and there were dead bugs all over our room. We called done to the front desk to get a new room and they told us we would have to wait until the manager got there the next day. I told them it was my wedding/honeymoon but they didn't care. We had a hard time falling asleep that night and then I woke up to a bug crawling on me. The manager never contacted me I had to contact the manager. They did move us that night and the new room we were moved into was clean but very old looking. The reason why I put Okay instead of Terrible is because I had a friend staying there too and her room was good. It had newer furniture and was clean. So I think it's just the luck of the draw. If you want a cheep place to stay it's okay but DO NOT GO HERE IF IT'S YOUR HONEYMOON OR IF YOU HATE BUGS, YOU WILL BE DISAPOITED!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great view”
Reviews.Author: fudy
Reviews.Content: Book this hotel as part of a packaged deal and you will get a deal! We got a spacious clean room on the mountain side and what a view! We loved the full kitchen, a must-have in pricey Maui. Location was perfect - right on the outskirts of downtown Lahaina, lots of places that you can stroll to, and yet quiet. Go figure!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: TexasSundowner
Reviews.Content: For a recent trip to Maui for a family wedding, I researched the Internet for hotels, with an emphasis on those that were well above the norm. From the information I found, the Lahaina Shores Beach Resort met this requirement. However, we found the staff not very friendly or helpful. The distribution of towels and washcloths for our room was chintzy, at best. A requested late checkout was flatly denied. A request to repair a slow draining sink and tub was never done. Their attitude was that they were doing us a favor by allowing us to stay at their property, rather than being appreciative of our business. We had a decent mountain view in the distance, but right across the street looked like poverty-city. Our room was below average with furnishings being old and outdated and no food service on the property at all. Both the room and the hotel, in general are past due for major updating. The property did not closely resemble the pictures we found on the Internet. Overall, we were very disappointed and unimpressed with this hotel and would probably not stay there again nor recommend it to anyone. We give it 2 stars on a good day.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place for the $$”
Reviews.Author: soccernut
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lahaina shores in October and had a wonderful time. Lahaina shores is not a huge resort with all the thrills but it is a wonderful place to stay. It is were all the action is. After talking to many other visitors at Luaus and other activities they were dissapointed in the distance they had to travel to get any where. So be aware of your location if you plan on alot of activites. If you stay at the shores besure you ask for a Ocean Front room and something on the 4th floor or above. I could see where people would not like the ground floor or a mountain view. From our Lanai each morning we had magnificant sunsets and sunrises. Next to the hotel was a night luau but that ended by 8:30-9:00 so it never interfered with sleep as reported in some reviews. The staff was very helpful and went out of they way to help you. It was great having a full kitchen so you could cook if you wanted or heat something up. You were within walking distance of many activities, during the day or night. Our bed was a wall unit that recessed into the wall during the day so we had alot of space. Each unit is decorated differently as these are peoples condo that they rent out during the year. Don't be afraid to try it out. If we return to hawaii I wouldn't think of staying any place else.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Cindy052
Reviews.Content: Just got home 2 weeks ago. Stayed in a 1-bedroom ocean front (bottom floor). Can't wait to go back. Husband wants to leave tomorrow. Management was great, room was excellent. Pay the extra money for the 1-bedroom, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Our part of paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for a week at the Lahaina Shores in June 2004 -- this is our third stay at this resort, and it is the only place I know that is as wonderful as I remembered it each time I return! Lahaina Shores is not only a short stroll to the beach, but also "stumbling distance" to Hecock's Bar and Italian Restaurant right next door. If you have money to burn, The Feast at Lele is a great luau to go to, or you can watch the dancers and musicians for free from Hecock's open windows each night. Whether you want solitude or romance, you can find both at Lahaina Shores. We slept with the window open listening to the waves all night, then I woke up early and read on the balcony overlooking the ocean while my husband slept in (his idea of fun and excitement). The hotel staff are helpful and unobtrusive, and always warm and inviting. Our dream is to retire to Lahaina in a Lahaina Shores condo; until then, we will come back at least every other year to visit Paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Check it out first.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: PS....IMPORTANT! Privately owned/decorated units explain varying opinions. Get a unit that's been renovated. Everything was bright, clean and new in our unit :)

Reviews.Title: “Aloha Spirit”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Only someone not living the aloha spirit would give the LSH less than 5 stars. My wife and I just spent two weeks there for our honeymoon and it was a dream. If you were born with a silver spoon in your mouth and are referred to by others as snobs, then this place is not for you. As a matter of fact Hawai'i and esp Maui is not for you, so do them a favor and stay away, you would be breaking the Aloha Spirit Law (look it up!). Aloha & Mahalo!

Reviews.Title: “Just an OK hotel...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked our entire Maui trip through a travel agent and picked the Lahaina Shores Hotel due to how close the cute shops were, plus the fact that the hotel offered kitchens. They generously upgraded us to the "penthouse", which was twice the size of the regular rooms... I read a bunch of reviews before going and was somewhat apprehensive to stay there because of things I read. When we got there, the reviews were true... the place is quite run down but nothing TOO bad. The rooms seem clean enough (although a little bit of corner cleaning needs to be done) so I did not feel like I needed to leave. One thing I do need to point out is that one night we got back to the hotel pretty late and went out to the patio. It was FILLED with HUGE cockroaches. I almost had a heart attack. I called the front desk to make them aware and was told "Welcome to the mainland." Whatever that means... perhaps cockroaches run rampid in Maui??? I do not know, but we were forced to keep our doors shut once the sun went down which was a huge bummer. The customer service that was previously raved about by other reviewers was not something we witnessed. They were cordial, but not going out of their way to make sure our stay was pleasant. I probably would not stay again due to the cockroach issue, but if you don't mind keeping the doors closed from dusk until dawn, it was an OK place to stay. (BTW: we were on the 7th floor and they climbed up that far... I'm somewhat of a neat freak and know that they were not after anything we had in the room!!) One more thing... there is no beach in front of the hotel. None. You have to travel to Kapalua to experience the greatness of the Maui beaches. (D.T. Fleming beach is AWESOME.)

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: I<3Travel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Lahaina Shores from Aug 11 thru the 16 and it's a great hotel for people that don't spend much time in their rooms except to sleep. If hotel decor is important to you, don't stay here. You can see that the rooms and building are a little run down and outdated. Overall it's a good place to stay and I would stay here again in the future. PS. I had a mountain view studio and the full size fridge came in handy for freezing large bottles of water.

Reviews.Title: “We love it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We've been to Maui seven times so far and since discovering the Lahaina Shores have stayed there every time we go back. It's lovely, affordable and convenient to shopping, restaurants and Lahaina harbor. You could even get by without renting a car.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel”
Reviews.Author: MaiTai24
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed here last Thanksgiving for the first time. We got a great rate through Travelzoo-$79/nt including tax! It wasn't fancy, but the staff was very friendly, the lobby was nice, the location right in Lahaina was great if you want to do some shopping, dining, etc. I loved laying on the grassy area watching the ships out on the ocean. The rooms were incredibly quiet-we had a "town" view which was fine, though I'm sure an ocean view would be much prettier. We also had a small kitchen-full size appliances, which was great for making breakfast/lunch and saving some money. All in all, a great experience if you're not planning on spending a lot of time in your room. I'd stay there again if I was planning on spending some time in Lahaina town.

Reviews.Title: “My Maui Home”
Reviews.Author: DianneJ
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Lahaina Shores 4 times - the first 3 were in studio units booked direct with the property. The 4th time was in January 2004 - a 1 BR 5th floor corner unit booked thru the owner. While I had no major complaints with the studio units, the 1 BR unit was wonderful - 2 lanais, lots of space. Since I sometimes travel to Maui by myself, and I don't drive, Lahaina Shores is a great location for me! It's close enough to all the shops, restaurants, etc. of Front St, but far enough so that you can get away from the busyness of it all at the end of the day. I can walk to Lahaina Harbor to catch the shuttles to the other areas of the island. The staff has always been very friendly - in fact, on my last trip, one of them was leaving as I was going to walk down to the grocery, and she offered me a ride & then insisted she would wait for me & give me a ride back. They always store my luggage for me on my last day, so that I can have a full day in Lahaina before I go off to the airport. Lahaina Shores is defintely not a deluxe property - I've stayed at some of those & still love LS. Because most of the units are privately owned, they are all decorated differently, and I'm sure some of them can use some updating, but this situation is found at a lot of hotels, unless they've just gone thru a major renovation.

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Selected this hotel due reviews at this website. Out of 5 stars, I give it a generous 2. You have to pay for parking, they encourage you to re-use your bath towels, the beach outside of the hotel is dirty, the staff tries their best to be friendly but can do better, the kiosk desk was built in the 30's. You get what you pay for. If you want something nice, go to Kapalua or Wailea. If you can't afford that, stick with Kaanapali. If you can "tough it out", stay at Lahaina Shores. What worked for us is to only use the hotel to sleep. Wake at 7 am and split.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Sorry guys.. If you are looking for a deal... Look elsewhere. You will be disappointed if you come here. Just arrived here and instead of spoiling our vacation and trying to tough it out here, I just booked a room at the Ritz about 6 miles away and will be spending the rest of our trip there. my fiance was horrified with the wet floor, musty smell (luckily I brought some FreBreeze), outdated dirty bathrooms, and it is just overall crappy... Equivilant to a Motel6... Get real.. It's more like a cheap local nonchain motel that you rent by the hour...

Reviews.Title: “An honest opinion”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent hours and hours reviewing the different hotels available on the island of Maui and finally decided to go with the Lahaina Shores Beach Resort. It had mostly good reviews with only a few negative ratings from those who stayed on the lower mountain side rooms. My fiance' and I went on this trip for pleasure and it was our first visit to Maui. We chose to stay in the city of Lahaina because of the rumors that it was a fun town with shopping and many restaurants to chose from. Overall, I believe we made the best choice in locations on the island compared to the northern beaches kaanapali and kapalua and southern beaches of wailea and kihei. Anyways, back to the hotel, we opened the door and were pleasantly surprised to find a clean room with awesome ocean view. We were in a studio ocean view. For the price, which is considerably less than many of the hotels on the island, it is a great deal. The ocean is so close and the waves quietly roll in all night long putting us to sleep after long days of siteseeing and beach bumming. The room had its own small kitchen w/ full size fridge, stove & microwave. Although we didn't really use it other than to warm up some left over local food. The lanai is a good size and the window overlooking the ocean is the length and height of the room which made for beautiful sunsets. The staff was extra friendly and always had the aloha spirit. We felt welcome and smiling faces always greeted us. As for negatives and why I wouldn't give this place a 5 star rating- it is a bit old, the building is mostly made of cement looking bricks colored in a greenish tone, kind of makes the place look a bit outdated. There is no restaurant on site and parking was at the shopping center next door (it's very close though). No amenities at this site other than the pool, ok for a quick dip to cool down but a backyard pool is likely bigger than this thing. The beach is non-existent during high tide but shallow waters allow for floating on a blow up raft right near the hotel. Overall a good place for those who don't spend too much time in the room other than to shower, take a quick nap or sleep. No roaches, no big bugs, simply a clean room, much like a nice Motel 6 like other people have said. On the island, you must take the road to Hana, rent a Jeep and take it around the entire island, see spectacular waterfalls right off the road, practically deserted beaches (the black sand beach), seven pools, and for awesome local food, look for the "local kine grindz" sign near Hana. A couple of local guys bbq'ng in their front yard w/ the BEST local food on the island. Local food in town and around Maui is hard to find and not very good, Cheeseburger in Paradise is good, Rick's seafood terrible, Aloha Plate Lunch overpriced. I recommend beaches: Makena beach #2 is beautiful, deserted beaches around Kihei, Kamaole Beach #3 for swimming, black sand beach for pictures, Napili Bay for turquoise waters, and on the trip from the airport to Lahaina there are some less populated beaches w/ waters up to the waist 1/4 mile out, crystal clear turquoise. An unbelievable trip w/ 5 nights at Lahaina Shores, a good central location, clean, and within walking distance to all of Lahaina.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent recommended Lahaina Shores for the second part of our honeymoon trip. The staff was very friendly and it is right on the beach. We had a beautiful ocean view, however the room was below average. The furnishings were outdated and old, and not anything like the pictures you find on the internet. The hotel and rooms require updating, carpeting was faded and worn and I was generally unimpressed. My husband and I only stayed one night and then transferred to the Sheraton Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Two Thumbs Up!”
Reviews.Author: RebelandKatmandu
Reviews.Content: We just spent a few days at Lahaina Shores Beach Resort in the beginning of May. This was a spur of the moment trip for us and we were on somewhat of a budget. We had been to Maui before and we didn't think we wanted to stay in a big resort in Kaanapali or Wailea. We wanted to be closer to the action of Lahaina and we wanted to be able to walk to dinner each night. We also didn't want to be stuck eating breakfast and lunch at a resort every day. We could not have asked for a better place to stay during our trip. The staff was so friendly and helpful. Our room and the grounds around the hotel were very clean (and up to my standards which are extremely high). The location was close to town but still quiet. There were no screaming children around during our visit which also made it more enjoyable for us. The pool is small and the hotel does not offer the amenities of a resort so it is probably not the best place for families. The guests seemed to be couples of all ages from mid 20s to 60s. We upgraded to an oceanview room. Definitely worth it. We had a great time watching the sunset on our lanai. All in all it was a perfect choice for us. The price was reasonable and we were able to relax without fighting crowds around the hotel and no one bothered us with anything. I would highly recommend this hotel. I know that we will be back someday.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have a hard time understanding why there would be any negative reviews of this hotel. I just returned from Hawaii, the last week of April being spent at the Lahaina Shores. It exceeded all of my expectations ! I stayed in an oceanview on the third floor and it was a close to perfect as you can come for any amount of money. Big, airy room, well cared for, everything in very good condition, clean and very comfortable. The lanai looked over the grounds and the ocean, with a view of the luau next door in the evenings. Except for the evening entertainment ( which one can hardly complain about ), it was as peaceful and picture perfect as one could ask for. I even sat and watched the whales out in front of the hotel on two different evenings...amazing. I would recommend the Lahaina shores to anyone, without hesitation...I can't think of one bad thing to say about my stay there. I absolutely loved it and will definitely stay there again. I can understand those on the ground floor being unhappy...but that is to be expected in any hotel, at any price. If you want an oceanview and do not want to be on the ground floor, you have to pay the extra for it...anyone should know that. It would be no different in a $300 a night luxury hotel. Pay the extra for an ocean view on the third floor or higher....you will not be disappointed and it will be worth every penny. For those who care to complain about the little things...this is NOT a luxury hotel and they do not claim to be. If you want a five star....go and stay at a five star...and pay for it. If you want a beautiful, quiet hotel, on the ocean, with a beautiful view and peaceful grounds only a few short blocks from downtown Lahaina....stay here. I got every single dollar's worth out of my stay here...and more.

Reviews.Title: “Older but affordable”
Reviews.Author: Caniac2006
Reviews.Content: We definetely plan to stay here when we go back. The hotel is older, but we never wanted to stay in the room anyway. The staff was also extremely helpful and nice. The thing I liked best about this place is that it is smaller and relatively quiet. The proximity to Front Street is great. There are lots of good restaurants within walking distance and enough touristy shops to keep any woman intrigued. Of all the islands we went to Lahaina was our favorite area.

HotelInfo.Name: Lahaina Shores Beach Resort
HotelInfo.Address: 475 Front Street, Lahaina, Maui, HI 96761
